JIN ZHENGJUN
WANG FENG
FANG YI
WU QIONG
WU SHUNYU
SHEN LI
LI YINGYING
MAO YISHENG
Abstract: The invention provides a wireless charging staged constant-current constant-voltage output control method adaptive to an offset working condition, and the method specifically comprises the steps: a transmitting end and a receiving end are controlled synchronously, the transmitting end calculates an input impedance phase angle in real time, and records an output voltage Up and an output current Ip of a high-frequency AC power supply when the input impedance phase angle is smaller than a threshold value; the receiving end obtains the charging demand of the load, determines the charging mode and the demand values of the charging current and voltage, collects the charging current or the charging voltage in real time, compares the charging current or the charging voltage with the corresponding demand values, and adjusts the compensation network of the receiving end according to the comparison result so as to adjust the charging current or the charging voltage. The input impedance phase angle changes due to the adjustment of the compensation network of the receiving end, and the transmitting end adjusts Up or Ip according to the change of the input impedance phase angle. Mutual inductance between the transmitting coil and the receiving coil does not need to be estimated, wireless communication needed by closed-loop control between the transmitting end and the receiving end is avoided, and the method can be suitable for wireless charging in wider scenes.
Claims:
1. A wireless charging staged constant-current constant-voltage output control method adapting to offset working conditions is characterized in that,
 the control of the transmitting terminal and the receiving terminal is synchronously carried out;
 the transmitting terminal control unit calculates the input impedance phase angle in the wireless charging process in real time and collects the output voltage U of the corresponding high-frequency alternating-current power supply when the input impedance phase angle is smaller than a threshold value pAnd an output current Ip;
 The receiving end control unit acquires the charging requirement of the load through a battery management system of the load, and determines a charging mode and required values of charging current and charging voltage according to the charging requirement;
 the receiving end control unit acquires the charging current and the charging voltage loaded on the load in real time, compares the acquired charging current or charging voltage with the charging demand value, and adjusts a receiving end compensation network according to the comparison result to adjust the charging current or charging voltage of the load;
 the phase angle of the input impedance is changed after the receiving end compensation network is adjusted, the transmitting end control unit obtains the phase angle of the input impedance after the receiving end compensation network is adjusted, and the transmitting end control unit obtains the phase angle of the input impedance after the receiving end compensation network is adjustedAdjusting the high-frequency AC power supply according to the obtained input impedance phase angle and the corresponding charging mode, and adjusting the output voltage of the high-frequency AC power supply to be output voltage UpOr the output current is adjusted to be the output current Ip?
2. The method for controlling the wireless charging stage-by-stage constant-current constant-voltage output according to the offset working condition of claim 1, wherein the charging modes comprise constant-current charging, constant-voltage charging and constant-current constant-voltage charging.
3. The method for controlling the wireless charging staged constant-current constant-voltage output according to the offset working condition of claim 2, wherein when the charging mode is a constant-current charging mode, the corresponding wireless charging process comprises the following specific steps: when the wireless charging is started, the high-frequency alternating current power supply gradually increases the output voltage, the charging current at two ends of the load at the receiving end gradually increases, the control unit at the receiving end compares the charging current at two ends of the load with the charging current demand value in real time, when the charging current reaches the charging current demand value, the duty ratios of the two power switch tubes in the compensation network at the receiving end are calculated, the on and off of the two power switch tubes are controlled according to the calculated duty ratios of the two power switch tubes in the compensation network at the receiving end, and the charging current is maintained not to exceed the charging current demand value until the charging is finished.
4. The method of claim 3, wherein when the on and off of the two power switching tubes are controlled according to the calculated duty ratios of the two power switching tubes in the receiver compensation network, the transmitting end control unit is further used to calculate the phase angle of the input impedance in real time and determine whether the input impedance satisfies a purely resistive condition, and when the input impedance does not satisfy the purely resistive condition, the method further uses the recorded output voltage U to control the on and off of the two power switching tubes according to the calculated duty ratios of the two power switching tubes in the receiver compensation network, and when the input impedance does not satisfy the purely resistive conditionpCalculating trigger pulse of a power switch tube in the high-frequency alternating current power supply, controlling the on-off of the power switch tube in the high-frequency alternating current power supply according to the trigger pulse obtained by calculation, and outputting power of the high-frequency alternating current power supplyVoltage regulation to output voltage Up?
5. The method as claimed in claim 2, wherein when the charging mode is constant current and constant voltage charging, the battery management system of the load collects the voltage of the load in real time, the load is in the constant current charging stage when the voltage is lower than a preset voltage, and the load is switched from the constant current stage to the constant voltage stage for continuous charging after the voltage reaches the preset voltage.
6. The method for controlling the output of the wireless charging stage with constant current and constant voltage according to the claim 5, wherein when the charging mode is constant current and constant voltage charging and is in the constant current charging stage, the specific corresponding wireless charging process comprises: the receiving end control unit compares the charging current at two ends of the load with the charging current demand value in real time, calculates duty ratios of two power switch tubes in the compensation network according to the comparison result, controls the on and off of the two power switch tubes according to the calculated duty ratios of the two power switch tubes in the receiving end compensation network, and maintains the charging current not to exceed the charging current demand value.
7. The method of claim 5, wherein when the charging mode is constant current and constant voltage charging and the charging is switched from the constant current stage to the constant voltage stage, the transmitter control unit calculates the phase angle of the input impedance in real time and determines whether the input impedance satisfies a purely resistive condition, and when the input impedance does not satisfy the purely resistive condition, the transmitter control unit outputs the output current I according to the output current IpCalculating trigger pulse of a power switch tube in the high-frequency alternating current power supply, controlling the on-off of the power switch tube in the high-frequency alternating current power supply according to the trigger pulse obtained by calculation, and adjusting the output current of the high-frequency alternating current power supply into an output current I pAnd the charging voltage of the receiving end reaches the charging voltage demand value.
8. Title: Battery fault diagnosis method and device
Inventor:
DU RUOYANG
REN HUIZI
HE TAO
SUN YUANJUN
XIA DEZHOU
Abstract: The invention provides a battery fault diagnosis method and device. The method comprises the steps that a vehicle uploads a collected first original data set to a cloud BMS; the cloud BMS performs preliminary diagnosis on the battery based on the first original data set, and sends risk early warning to the vehicle based on the preliminary diagnosis on the battery; the vehicle obtains a second original data set based on the received risk early warning; the second original data set is acquired from the vehicle, the data items included in the second original data set are more than the data items included in the first original data set, or the acquisition frequency of the data in the second original data set is higher than the acquisition frequency of the data in the first original data set; and the vehicle and/or the cloud BMS perform deep diagnosis on the battery based on the second original data set to determine the fault level of the battery. Under the condition that the battery is preliminarily diagnosed to determine that the battery has the fault risk, the vehicle is deeply diagnosed based on richer data, and the fault level of the battery can be more accurately determined.
Claims:
1. A method of diagnosing a battery fault, comprising:
 receiving a first raw data set from a vehicle, the first raw data set being acquired from the vehicle;
 performing a preliminary diagnosis on a battery of the vehicle based on the first raw data set, and sending a risk warning to the vehicle based on the preliminary diagnosis on the battery;
 receiving data from the vehicle, the data comprising: a second raw data set, or first diagnostic data derived by the vehicle based on the second raw data set, wherein the second raw data set is acquired from the vehicle, the second raw data set is used for deep diagnosis of the battery, the second raw data set comprises more data items than the first raw data set, or the acquisition frequency of data in the second raw data set is higher than the acquisition frequency of data in the first raw data set.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the method further comprises:
 performing a deep diagnosis on the battery based on the second raw data set to determine a fault level of the battery.
3. The method of claim 1, wherein the method further comprises:
 performing a deep diagnosis of the battery based on the second raw data set and the first diagnostic data to determine a fault level of the battery.
4. The method of claim 1, wherein the first diagnostic data comprises a fault level of the battery.
5. The method of any of claims 1-4, wherein the sending a risk alert to the vehicle based on the preliminary diagnosis of the battery comprises:
 determining a diagnosis result based on a preliminary diagnosis of the battery, the diagnosis result including a health degree of the battery or a probability value that the battery has a fault;
 and sending the risk early warning to the vehicle under the condition that the diagnosis result reaches a preset threshold.
6. The method of claim 5, wherein in the event that the diagnostic result reaches a preset threshold, the method further comprises:
 and sending an OTA upgrade package to the vehicle, wherein the OTA upgrade package is used for OTA upgrade of the vehicle.
7. The method of claim 6, wherein the OTA upgrade package comprises a recharge/discharge adjustment strategy for adjusting a maximum charge and/or a maximum depth of discharge of the battery.
8. The method according to any one of claims 1 to 7, characterized in that the risk pre-warning is used to indicate a risk level of the presence of the battery and/or a type of failure of the battery; wherein the risk levels are used to determine the urgency of the deep diagnosis, different risk levels corresponding to different degrees of urgency; the fault type comprises one or more of the following: thermal runaway, internal short circuit, poor consistency, over temperature, under voltage, or over voltage.
9. The method of any one of claims 1 to 8, wherein the preliminary diagnosis or the deep diagnosis employs one or more algorithms of mechanistic analysis, knowledge-graph and reasoning, big data analysis, digital twinning, or simulation.
10. The method of any of claims 1-9, wherein the first raw data set and the second raw data set include data from an in-vehicle communication link of the vehicle, and wherein more data items from the in-vehicle communication link of the vehicle in the second raw data set than in the first raw data set.
11. The method of claim 10, wherein the data in the second original data set further comprises: electrochemical impedance spectroscopy EIS chip collected data and/or test environment data.
12. A method of diagnosing a battery fault, comprising:
 uploading a first original data set acquired from a vehicle to a cloud-end Battery Management System (BMS), wherein the first original data set is used for carrying out preliminary diagnosis on the battery of the vehicle;
 acquiring a second raw data set under the condition of receiving risk early warning from the cloud BMS, wherein the second raw data set is used for deep diagnosis of the battery; wherein the risk pre-warning is issued based on a preliminary diagnosis of the battery, the second raw data set is collected from the vehicle, the second raw data set includes more data items than the first raw data set, or the collection frequency of data in the second raw data set is higher than the collection frequency of data in the first raw data set;
 sending data to the cloud BMS, the data comprising: data in the second raw data set, or first diagnostic data derived by the vehicle based on the second raw data set.
13. The method of claim 12, wherein the first diagnostic data includes a fault level of the battery, the fault level being deeply diagnosed by the vehicle based on the second raw data set.
14. The method of claim 12, wherein the sending data to the cloud BMS includes;
 and sending the second raw data set and the first diagnosis data to the cloud BMS, wherein the second raw data set and the first diagnosis data are used for deeply diagnosing the battery by the cloud BMS so as to determine the fault level of the battery.
15. The method of claim 12, wherein the sending data to the cloud BMS comprises:
 and uploading the second original data set to the cloud BMS, wherein the second original data set is used for deeply diagnosing the battery by the cloud BMS so as to determine the fault level of the battery.
16. The method according to any of claims 12 to 15, wherein the risk pre-warning is used to indicate a risk level of the presence of the battery and/or a type of failure of the battery; wherein the risk levels are used to determine the urgency of the deep diagnosis, different risk levels corresponding to different degrees of urgency; the fault type includes one or more of: thermal runaway, internal short circuit, poor consistency, over temperature, under voltage, or over voltage.
17. The method of any of claims 12 to 16, further comprising:
 and under the condition of receiving the risk early warning from the cloud BMS, performing OTA upgrading based on an OTA upgrading packet, wherein the OTA upgrading packet is from the cloud BMS or the vehicle.
18. The method of claim 17, wherein the OTA upgrade package comprises a charging and discharging adjustment policy, and wherein performing OTA upgrade based on the OTA upgrade package comprises:
 and adjusting the maximum charging degree and/or the maximum discharging depth of the battery based on the charging and discharging adjustment strategy.
19. The method of any one of claims 12 to 18, wherein the deep diagnosis of the battery employs one or more algorithms of mechanistic analysis, knowledge-graph and reasoning, big data analysis, digital twinning, or simulation.
20. The method of any of claims 12 to 19, wherein the first and second sets of raw data include data from an in-vehicle communication link of the vehicle, and wherein more data items from the in-vehicle communication link of the vehicle in the second set of raw data than in the first set of raw data.
21. The method of claim 20, wherein the data in the second raw data set further comprises: data collected by the electrochemical impedance spectroscopy EIS chip and/or test environment data.
22. A computer program product, characterized in that it comprises a computer program which, when executed, implements the method of any one of claims 1 to 11.
23. The cloud battery management system BMS is characterized by comprising a memory and a processor; wherein, the first and the second end of the pipe are connected with each other,
 the memory is used for storing program codes;
 the processor is configured to invoke the program code for implementing the method of any one of claims 1 to 11.
24. A computer program product, characterized in that it comprises a computer program which, when executed, implements the method according to any one of claims 12 to 21.
25. A BMS (vehicle-side battery management system) is characterized by comprising a memory and a processor; wherein, the first and the second end of the pipe are connected with each other,
 the memory is used for storing program codes;
 the processor is configured to invoke the program code for implementing the method according to any one of claims 12 to 21.
26. A vehicle characterized by comprising the vehicle-end battery management system BMS according to claim 25.

Title: Online diagnosis system for impedance abnormity of power battery of networked automobile
Inventor:
CAO JUNYI
GAO JINGYI
LEI YAGUO
CHEN SHOUXUAN
LI NAIPENG
WU TONGHAI
Abstract: The invention discloses an online diagnosis system for impedance abnormity of a power battery of a networked automobile. The online diagnosis system comprises a battery model self-adaptive updating system and a battery impedance online identification system, the battery model self-adaptive updating system comprises battery model building, battery model optimization and battery model verification; according to the model parameter updating, battery model parameters are solved according to working condition data in the running process of the networked automobile, and battery model self-adaptive updating is achieved; the battery impedance on-line identification system comprises impedance on-line identification, identification result verification and impedance abnormity alarm, and the impedance on-line identification is used for carrying out parameter identification on a battery model through an on-line identification algorithm; according to identification result verification, an impedance online identification result is judged, a normal value is fed back to a battery model self-adaptive updating system, and an abnormal value is output; the impedance abnormity alarm outputs information of an abnormal impedance value and an abnormal single battery code; according to the invention, online diagnosis of the power battery impedance of the networked automobile is realized, and driving safety is guaranteed.
Claims:
1. The utility model provides an online diagnostic system of networking car power battery impedance anomaly which characterized in that: the method comprises a battery model self-adaptive updating system and a battery impedance online identification system;
 the battery model self-adaptive updating system comprises battery model building, model parameter updating and battery model verification; building a battery model to realize ideal building of the battery model; the model parameter updating is to solve the battery model parameters according to the working condition data in the running process of the networked automobile, so as to realize the self-adaptive updating of the battery model; the battery model is verified to verify the accuracy of the battery model;
 the battery impedance online identification system comprises impedance online identification, identification result verification and impedance abnormity alarm, wherein the battery model is subjected to parameter identification through an online identification algorithm for the impedance online identification, so that the real-time calculation of the impedance information of the battery model is realized; the identification result is verified to judge the online identification result of the impedance, the normal value is fed back to the battery model self-adaptive updating system, and the abnormal value is output; and the impedance abnormity alarm outputs the abnormal battery monomer impedance value and the abnormal battery monomer code information.
2. The system of claim 1, wherein: the battery model is built by simulating the charge-discharge characteristics of the battery by forming an equivalent circuit by ideal electric elements, describing the input-output relationship of the battery and building the reliability relationship between the state parameters and the internal characteristics of the battery, wherein the built battery model is any one of a Rint model, an RC model, a PNGV model and a GNL model.
3. The system of claim 1, wherein: and updating the model parameters, namely performing parameter solution on the battery model by using actual data generated by real-time change of the working conditions and the internal state of the battery in the running process of the networked automobile, considering the characteristic relation among the environment temperature change, the measured environment temperature and the battery impedance in the running process of the automobile, and performing parameter update on the battery model by using the temperature data and the characteristic relation of the impedance.
4. The system of claim 1, wherein: and the battery model verification is that the optimized battery model is subjected to precision verification by using the historical test data of the battery pack under the actual operation condition of the networked automobile, if the optimized model parameters are accurate, the impedance online identification system is continuously used for carrying out impedance identification on the battery model, and if the model has deviation, the impedance online identification system is fed back to the battery model for optimization to update the battery model.
5. The system of claim 1, wherein: the online impedance identification comprises an impedance abnormality information base, the impedance abnormality information base comprises a battery impedance abnormality threshold value and a battery impedance abnormality case which are preset according to historical measurement data of the networked automobile, an online identification model is established by adopting an online identification algorithm to carry out online impedance identification, the online identification algorithm is any one of a recursive least square method, a filtering method and a machine learning algorithm, and the impedance of the battery is calculated through the online identification model, so that the battery impedance abnormality diagnosis is realized.
6. The system of claim 1, wherein: the identification result verification compares the battery impedance calculated in the online identification model with an abnormal threshold value and an abnormal case in an impedance abnormal information base; if the identification result reaches the abnormal threshold value, continuously judging whether the identification result is a novel abnormal case, if not, directly transmitting the identification result to an impedance abnormal alarm, if so, inputting an impedance abnormal information base, updating the impedance abnormal information base, and then transmitting the identification result to the impedance abnormal alarm; and if the identification result does not reach the abnormal threshold value, feeding back the identification result to the battery model self-adaptive updating system for updating the model parameters.
7. The system of claim 1, wherein: the impedance abnormity alarm outputs the impedance abnormity diagnosis result of the battery according to the battery impedance information obtained by calculation of the online identification model and the impedance abnormity case information provided by the impedance abnormity information base.

Title: Systems and method for charging batteries
Inventor:
YE HUI 
TAMIRISA PRABHAKAR A
Abstract: A charging voltage of a battery may be determined based on an age of the battery. The age and charging voltage can be determined by a computing apparatus or a battery management system. The determined charging voltage may increase as the age of the battery increases. The battery may be charged at the charging voltage for the duration of a charge cycle. The battery may be charged using a charger.
Claims:
What is claimed is:
1. A method comprising:
 determining an age of a battery;
 determining a charging voltage for charging the battery, wherein the charging voltage increases as the age of the battery increases; and
  charging the battery at the charging voltage for the duration of a charge cycle.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein determining the charging voltage comprises:
  determining a base charging voltage;
 determining a charging voltage increase based on the determined age of the battery; and
  summing the base charging voltage and the charging voltage increase.
3. The method of claim 1, wherein determining the age of the battery comprises determining a number of times the battery has been charged.
4. The method of claim 1, wherein determining the age of the battery comprises determining an internal impedance of the battery.
5. The method of claim 1, wherein determining the age of the battery comprises:
  supplying a test current to the battery; and
 determining a test voltage while the test current is supplied.
6. The method of claim 1, wherein determining the age of the battery comprises determining a time period between a first charge cycle of the battery and a current charge cycle of the battery.
7. The method of claim 1, wherein determining the charging voltage for charging the battery is further based on a charging time threshold.
8. The method of claim 1, wherein determining the charging voltage for charging the battery is further based on a turbo charge setting, wherein the turbo charge setting is adjustable by a user.
9. The method of claim 1, wherein the battery is a lithium ion battery, wherein the battery comprises an anode having a lithium ion intercalation potential of at least 0.5 V above lithium metal.
10. A battery charging apparatus comprising:
  a charger to charge one or more batteries; and
  a computing apparatus comprising one or more processors operably coupled to the charger and configured to:
   determine an age of a battery;
  determine a charging voltage for charging the battery based on the determined age of the battery, wherein the charging voltage increases as the age of the battery increases; and
   cause the charger to charge the battery at the charging voltage for the duration of a charge cycle.
11. The apparatus of claim 10, wherein to determine the charging voltage the computing apparatus is configured to:
  determine a base charging voltage;
 determine a charging voltage increase based on the determined age of the battery; and
  sum the base charging voltage and the charging voltage increase.
12. The apparatus of claim 10, wherein to determine the age of the battery, the computing apparatus is configured to determine a number of times the battery has been charged.
13. The apparatus of claim 10, wherein to determine the age of the battery, the computing apparatus is configured to determine an internal impedance of the battery.
14. The apparatus of claim 10, wherein to determine the age of the battery, the computing apparatus is configured to:
  supply a test voltage to the battery; and
 determine a test current while the test voltage is supplied.
15. The apparatus of claim 10, wherein to determine the age of the battery, the computing apparatus is configured to determine a time period between a first charge cycle of the battery and a current charge cycle of the battery.
16. The apparatus of claim 10, wherein the computing apparatus is configured to determine the charging voltage based on the determined age of the battery and a charging time threshold.
17. The apparatus of claim 10, wherein the computing apparatus is configured to determine the charging voltage based on the determined age of the battery and a turbo charge setting, wherein the turbo charge setting is adjustable by a user.
18. The apparatus of claim 10, wherein the battery is a lithium ion battery, wherein the battery comprises an anode having a lithium ion intercalation potential of at least 0.5 V above lithium metal.
19. A system comprising:
  a charging apparatus for charging one or more batteries; and
  a battery operatively coupled to the charging apparatus, the battery comprising:
  one or more electrochemical cells; and
   a battery management system comprising one or more processors operably coupled to the one or more electrochemical cells and configured to:
    determine an age of the battery;
   determine a charging voltage for charging the battery based on the determined age of the battery, wherein the charging voltage increases as the age of the battery increases; and
    cause the charger to charge the battery at the charging voltage for the duration of a charge cycle.
20. The system of claim 19, wherein to determine the charging voltage, the battery management system is configured to:
  determine a base charging voltage;
 determine a charging voltage increase based on the determined age of the battery; and
  sum the base charging voltage and the charging voltage increase.
21. The system of claim 19, wherein to determine the age of the battery, the battery management system is configured to determine a number of times the battery has been charged.
22. The system of claim 19, wherein to determine the age of the battery, the battery management system is configured to determine an internal impedance of the battery.
23. The system of claim 19, wherein to determine the age of the battery, the battery management system is configured to:
  supply a test current to the battery; and
 determine a test voltage while the test current is supplied.
24. The system of claim 19, wherein to determine the age of the battery, the battery management system is configured to determine a time period between a first charge cycle of the battery and a current charge cycle of the battery.
25. The system of claim 19, wherein the battery is disposed in a device.
26. The system of claim 19, wherein the battery is a lithium ion battery, wherein the battery comprises an anode having a lithium ion intercalation potential of at least 0.5 V above lithium metal.

Title: System and methods for rechargeable battery diagnostics
Inventor:
JUNG BYUNGHOO 
PARK CHIWOOK
Abstract: Disclosed is a system and methods for measuring electrochemical state of rechargeable batteries such as state of charge (SoC) and state of health (SoH). In various aspects, the system may include an inductive coil attached to the battery and a battery current sensor. Alternating current with a fixed frequency is applied to the coil to generate magnetic fields, and the magnetic fields induce losses including Eddy current loss and a loss related to battery currents. The system compensates for the effect of the loss related to battery currents for battery electrochemical state estimation. In another aspect, the system uses both coil-based measurement and ampere hour counting (AHC) measurement for SoC measurement. The system conducts coil-based SoC measurement only occasionally to reset the accumulated error of AHC-based SoC measurement. In yet another aspect, the system combines coil-based measurement with other measurements.
Claims:
What is claimed is:
1. A method, comprising:
 exciting an inductive coil attached to the rechargeable battery with an AC signal to generate magnetic fields;
  measuring a battery current with a current sensor;
 measuring complex power, power factor, complex impedance, inductance, resistance of the inductive coil, or a combination thereof;
  calculating an electrochemical state of the battery based on the battery current, complex power, the power factor, the complex impedance, the inductance, the resistance, or the combination thereof; and
  outputting the electrochemical state.
2. The method of claim 1 wherein the electrochemical state is a state of charge of the battery, a state of health of the battery, or a combination thereof.
3. The method of claim 1, further comprising:
  determining whether a calibration trigger criterion has been satisfied;
 in response to satisfaction of the calibration criterion:
   exciting the inductive coil and an electrochemical state of the battery based on the battery current, and
   calculating an electrochemical state of the battery based complex power, the power factor, the complex impedance, the inductance, the resistance, or the combination thereof.
4. The method of claim 4, further comprising:
  exciting a plurality of inductive coils respectively attached to a plurality of rechargeable batteries.
5. The method of claim 4, wherein the inductive coils are excited in sequentially.
6. The method of claim 4, wherein the inductive coils are excited simultaneously.
7. The method of claim 4, wherein the batteries are connected in series and the same current sensor measures the battery current for all of the batteries.
8. The method of claim 4, wherein the electrochemical state is the average electrochemical state of all of the batteries.
9. The method of claim 1, wherein the battery is a prismatic or pouch Li ion battery.
10. The method of claim 1, wherein the AC excitation signal frequency is in the range of 5 MHz to 50 MHz.
11. The method of claim 1, wherein a tuning capacitor is connected to the inductive coil in series the method further comprising:
  measuring a voltage across the tuning capacitor; and
 calculating the complex power, power factor, complex impedance, inductance and/or resistance of the coil based on the measured voltage of the tuning capacitor.
12. The method of claim, 1 wherein a tuning capacitor is connected to the inductive coil in parallel, a sensing element, a resistor or a capacitor, is connected in series, the method further comprising:
  measuring a voltage across the sensing element; and
 calculating, based on the measured voltage across the sensing element, the complex power, power factor, complex impedance, inductance and/or resistance of the coil.
13. The method of claim 1, further comprising:
  down converting, with a mixer, the AC signal frequency to a lower frequency.
14. The method of claim 1, wherein a high magnetic permeability sheet covers the inductive coil.
15. The method of claim 1 wherein a high magnetic permeability sheet covers the inductive coil, and another high magnetic permeability sheet is placed on the opposite side of the battery.
16. The method of claim 1, wherein outputting the electrochemical state comprises:
  storing the electrochemical state in a memory, transmitting the electrochemical state over a network, displaying the electrochemical, or a combination thereof.
17. A method comprising:
 tracking a battery state of charge value by:
  receiving a battery current measurement based on a signal generated by a current sensor,
    integrating the battery current measurement over a time period;
   determining a change in the state of charge based on the integrated current measurement, and
    adjusting a battery state of charge value based on the change in battery state of charge;
 repeatedly calibrating the battery state of charge value by:
   exciting an inductive coil attached to the rechargeable battery with an AC signal to generate magnetic fields,
   measuring the battery current with the current sensor,
  measuring complex power, power factor, complex impedance,
  inductance, resistance of the inductive coil, or a combination thereof,
  updating the battery state of charge value based on the battery current and at least one of the complex power, the power factor, the complex impedance, inductance, or the resistance of the inductive coil,
  outputting the battery state of charge value.
18. The method of claim 17 wherein the rechargeable battery is configured to charge via a charging path and discharge via a discharge path, wherein calibrating the battery state of charge value further comprises:
  opening the charging path and the discharging path during the inductive coil excitation to compensate for the battery current.
19. The method of claim 17, further comprising:
  measuring a value comprising elapsed time since a previous calibration, instantaneous battery current value, the integrated battery current value, battery temperature, and/or battery terminal voltage, or a combination thereof; and
  determining a measured value satisfies a calibration trigger criterion, wherein the calibration is performed in response to satisfaction of the calibration trigger criterion.
20. The method of claim 19, wherein the calibration trigger criterion comprises a condition that the battery is rested for a predetermined time where current is less than or equal to a current threshold value, a condition that the battery is fully charged, or a combination thereof.
21. A method, comprising:
 measuring battery current based on output of a current sensor connected to at least one terminal of a battery;
  measuring state of charge of the battery by:
  exciting an inductive coil attached to the battery with an AC signal to generate magnetic fields,
   measuring battery current from a current sensor,
  measuring complex power, power factor, complex impedance,
  inductance, resistance of the coil, or a combination thereof, and
  determining the battery state of charge based on the measured battery current and the complex power, power factor, complex impedance, inductance, internal resistance, or a combination thereof; and
  outputting the state of charge of the battery, a state of health of the battery, or a combination thereof.
22. The method of claim 21, further comprising:
  measuring battery internal resistance based on the battery current; and
 determining the battery state of health based on the internal resistance and the state of charge value.
23. The method of claim 21, further comprising:
  measuring an open circuit voltage of the battery; and
 determining the battery state of health based on the open circuit voltage and the state of charge values.

Title: Apparatus and method for measurement of battery internal impedance and cell balancing
Inventor:
LEE, HYUNG-KYU
WOOHyoJeong
Abstract: A storage battery internal impedance measurement and cell balancing apparatus includes: a current discharge unit provided for each storage battery of a storage battery set in which a plurality of storage batteries are connected in series to generate a discharge current so that the discharge current flows in the storage battery; And an internal impedance measurement unit provided for each of the storage batteries and configured to measure an internal impedance of the storage battery from an alternating current component of the discharge current and an alternating current component of a voltage of the storage battery, And a processor configured to control the current discharging unit to calculate the internal impedance for each first cycle such that the current discharging unit generates the discharge current for each first cycle, wherein the processor compares a measured direct current component of a voltage of the storage battery with a reference voltage, And when the DC component is greater than the reference voltage, the current discharge unit controls the current discharge unit to generate the discharge current at every second cycle smaller than the first cycle, such that cell balancing is performed between the plurality of storage batteries.
Claims:
1. A discharge apparatus comprising: a current discharge unit provided for each storage battery of a storage battery set in which a plurality of storage batteries are connected in series and generating a discharge current so that the discharge current flows through the storage battery; and an internal impedance measurement unit provided for each storage battery and measuring an internal impedance of the storage battery from an alternating component of the discharge current and an alternating component of a voltage of the storage battery, Wherein the internal impedance measuring unit comprises a processor configured to calculate the internal impedance for each first cycle by controlling the current discharging unit such that the current discharging unit generates the discharge current for each first cycle, and Wherein the processor is configured to compare the measured direct current component of the voltage of the corresponding storage battery with a reference voltage, And when the direct current component is greater than the reference voltage, the current discharge unit controls the current discharge unit to generate the discharge current at every second cycle smaller than the first cycle so that cell balancing is achieved between the plurality of batteries.
2. A current discharge unit provided for each storage cell group in which at least two storage cells are connected in series, of a storage cell set in which a plurality of storage cells are connected in series, and generating a discharge current so that the discharge current flows in the storage cell group; And an internal impedance measurement unit provided for each of the storage groups and configured to measure internal impedance of each of the storage batteries included in the corresponding storage group from an alternating current component of the discharge current and an alternating current component of a voltage of each of the storage batteries included in the corresponding storage group, Wherein the internal impedance measuring unit includes a processor configured to control the current discharging unit to calculate internal impedance of each of the storage batteries included in the corresponding storage battery group in each of the first periods, and the processor is configured to compare a sum of measured direct current components of voltages of each of the storage batteries included in the corresponding storage battery group with a reference voltage, And when the sum of the DC components is greater than the reference voltage, the current discharge unit controls the current discharge unit to generate the discharge current at every second cycle smaller than the first cycle so that cell balancing is achieved between the plurality of batteries.
3. The power supply device according to claim 1, wherein the current discharge unit generates the discharge current using a clock signal supplied from the processor, the processor controls the current discharge unit to generate the discharge current for each of the first cycles by supplying the clock signal for each of the first cycles, Wherein the control unit controls the current discharge unit to generate the discharge current for each of the second periods by supplying the clock signal for each of the second periods.
4. The accumulator internal impedance measuring and cell balancing device according to claim 1, wherein the second cycle is a value obtained by multiplying the first cycle by a predetermined value smaller than 1.
5. A storage battery internal impedance measurement and cell balancing method, comprising: a current discharge unit provided for each storage battery of a storage battery set in which a plurality of storage batteries are connected in series and generating a discharge current so that the discharge current flows in the storage battery, And an internal impedance measuring unit which is provided for each of the storage batteries and measures the internal impedance of the corresponding storage battery from the alternating current component of the discharge current and the alternating current component of the voltage of the corresponding storage battery, and compares the measured direct current component of the voltage of the corresponding storage battery with a reference voltage; Measuring the internal impedance in each first cycle by controlling the current discharge unit such that the current discharge unit generates the discharge current in each first cycle when the DC component is not greater than the reference voltage; And measuring the internal impedance in each second cycle by controlling the current discharge unit to generate the discharge current in each second cycle smaller than the first cycle when the direct current component is larger than the reference voltage.
6. A storage battery internal impedance measurement and cell balancing method, comprising: a current discharge unit provided for each storage battery group in which at least two storage batteries are connected in series, of storage battery sets in which a plurality of storage batteries are connected in series, and generating a discharge current so that the discharge current flows in the storage battery group, And an internal impedance measuring unit provided for each of the storage groups and measuring an internal impedance of each of the storage batteries included in the corresponding storage group from an alternating component of the discharge current and an alternating component of a voltage of each of the storage batteries included in the corresponding storage group, Comparing a sum of measured direct current components of voltages of each of the storage batteries included in the corresponding storage battery group with a reference voltage; Measuring an internal impedance of each of the storage batteries included in the corresponding storage battery group in each of the first periods by controlling the current discharge unit to generate the discharge current in each of the first periods when the sum of the DC components is not greater than the reference voltage; And if the sum of the direct current components is greater than the reference voltage, controlling the current discharging unit to generate the discharge current for each of the second periods smaller than the first period, controlling the current discharging unit to measure the internal impedance of each of the storage batteries included in the corresponding storage battery group for each of the second periods.
7. The power supply device according to claim 5, wherein the current discharge unit generates the discharge current using a clock signal supplied from the internal impedance measurement unit, the internal impedance measurement unit supplies the clock signal for each of the first cycles to control the current discharge unit to generate the discharge current for each of the first cycles, And controls the current discharge unit to generate the discharge current in each of the second periods by supplying the clock signal in each of the second periods.
8. The storage battery internal impedance measurement and cell balancing method according to claim 5, wherein the second cycle is a value obtained by multiplying the first cycle by a predetermined value smaller than 1.

Title: Battery module
Inventor:
YOKOSHIMA Tokihiko
OSAKA Tetsuya
MOMMA Toshiyuki
Abstract:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide a battery module 1 for detecting that the degree of deterioration of a battery cell having a charging depth larger than that of another battery cell 30 is larger than that of the other battery cell in an assembled battery including a plurality of battery cells 30.
SOLUTION: The battery module 1 includes an assembled battery system 2 including an assembled battery 3 in which a plurality of battery cells 30 are connected in series, and a balancer for performing equalization processing on charging depths of the plurality of battery cells 30, a measurement circuit 5 for measuring the impedance characteristic before and after the equalization processing of the assembled battery 3, and a processor 6 which uses the impedance characteristic before and after the first equalization processing to detect that a first battery cell having a charging depth larger than that of another battery cell has a higher degree of deterioration than the other battery cell.
SELECTED DRAWING: Figure 1
COPYRIGHT: (C)2022,JPO&INPIT
Claims:
1. A power generation apparatus comprising: a battery set system including a battery set including a plurality of battery cells connected in series, and a balancer configured to equalize a depth of charge of the plurality of battery cells; a measurement circuit configured to measure a first impedance characteristic of the battery set before the equalization process and a second impedance characteristic of the battery set after the equalization process; A processor that detects, among the plurality of battery cells, that a level of deterioration of a first battery cell having a greater depth of charge than other battery cells is greater than a level of deterioration of the other battery cells, using the first impedance characteristic and the second impedance characteristic.
2. The battery module according to claim 1, wherein the processor detects that the degree of degradation of the first battery cell is greater than the degree of degradation of the other battery cells based on changes in the first impedance characteristic and the second impedance characteristic in a charge transfer region and an ion diffusion region of a Nyquist plot.
3. The battery module according to Claim 1, wherein the processor detects that the degree of degradation of the first battery cell is greater than the degree of degradation of the other battery cells based on a change in the second impedance characteristic with respect to the first impedance characteristic in a charge transfer region.
4. The battery module according to any one of claims 1 to 3, wherein each of the first impedance characteristic and the second impedance characteristic is at least one of resistance, reactance, impedance absolute value, and phase angle.

Title: Battery module
Inventor:
YOKOSHIMA Tokihiko
OSAKA Tetsuya
MOMMA Toshiyuki
Abstract:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide a battery module 1 for detecting that a first battery cell having a charging depth larger than that of another battery cell has a higher degree of deterioration than the other battery cell in an assembled battery including a plurality of battery cells 30.
SOLUTION: The battery module 1 includes an assembled battery system 2 including an assembled battery 3 in which a plurality of battery cells 30 are connected in series, and a BMS 4 for performing equalization processing on charging depths of the plurality of battery cells 30, a measurement circuit 5 for measuring a first impedance characteristic of the assembled battery 3 before the equalization processing and a second reference impedance characteristic of a reference battery cell 32 after the equalization processing, and a processor which uses the first impedance characteristic and the second reference impedance characteristic to detect that a first battery cell having a charging depth larger than that of another battery cell has a higher degree of deterioration than the other battery cell.
SELECTED DRAWING: Figure 1
COPYRIGHT: (C)2022,JPO&INPIT
Claims:
1. A power generation apparatus comprising: a battery pack system including a battery pack in which a plurality of battery cells are connected in series, and a balancer configured to perform equalization processing on a depth of charge of the plurality of battery cells; a battery pack system including a first impedance characteristic of the battery pack before the equalization processing or a second impedance characteristic of the battery pack after the equalization processing; A first reference impedance characteristic of a reference battery cell or a second reference impedance characteristic of the reference battery cell after the equalization process, the reference battery cell being any of the battery cells before the equalization process, the reference battery cell being any of the battery cells before the equalization process; and Using the first impedance characteristic or the second impedance characteristic, and the first reference impedance characteristic or the second reference impedance characteristic, A processor that detects that a level of degradation of a first battery cell, among the plurality of battery cells, having a greater depth of charge than other battery cells, is greater than a level of degradation of the other battery cells.

The battery module according to claim 1, wherein the measurement circuit measures the first impedance characteristic and the second reference impedance characteristic, and the processor uses the first impedance characteristic and the second reference impedance characteristic to perform detection.
3. The battery module according to claim 1, wherein the measurement circuit measures the second impedance characteristic and the first reference impedance characteristic, and the processor uses the second impedance characteristic and the first reference impedance characteristic to perform detection.
4. The battery module according to claim 1, wherein the measurement circuit measures the second impedance characteristic and the second reference impedance characteristic, and the processor uses the second impedance characteristic and the second reference impedance characteristic to perform detection.
5. The battery module according to any one of claims 1 to 4, wherein the reference battery cells are detachably separate from battery cells of the battery set other than the reference battery cells.
