Title: Battery impedance measurement circuit
Parent Assignee: TANG ENZHU SEMICONDUCTOR CO LTD, DATANG TELECOM
Inventor: VAN LAMMEREN J P M
Abstract: Provided is a battery impedance measurement circuit (400), comprising: a signal generator (410), connected to at least one battery cell (401), used for inputting a drive current to each battery cell (401); an analog-to-digital converter (420), connected to the two ends of the battery cell (401), and used for converting the analog voltage signal from the battery cell (401) into a digital voltage signal; an impedance extraction module (430), connected to the signal generator (410) and the analog-to-digital converter (420), and used for extracting an impedance signal associated with the impedance characteristics of the battery cell (401); and a digital filter (440), which receives the impedance signal from the impedance extraction module (430), the digital filter (440) having attenuation notches at a plurality of frequencies, the digital filter (440) being used for filtering out crosstalk signals in the impedance signal. The battery impedance measurement circuit (400) can effectively filter out crosstalk signals from a battery impedance signal, and is simple to implement.

Title: System and method for anomaly detection and total capacity estimation of a battery
Inventor:
GULLAPALLI HEMTEJ 
TANOVIC OMER 
TRAA JOHANNES 
SOLTANMOHAMMADI ERFAN
Abstract: The battery monitoring techniques described herein may be used for detection of battery anomalies or faults. Also, the battery monitoring techniques described herein may be used to generate estimates of total battery capacity. The battery monitoring techniques may employ an alternating current frequency response (ACFR) of the battery. The ACFR response of the battery may be used to detect anomalies and/or estimate a total capacity of the battery.
Claims:
1. A method to monitor a battery, the method comprising:
 receiving a first impedance measurement from the battery in response to a first multi-frequency sweep;
  receiving a second impedance measurement from the battery in response to a second multi-frequency sweep; and
  based on the first and second impedance measurements, determining an estimated capacity of the battery using a regression model.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the first impedance measurement is obtained from the battery at a first time associated with a charging cycle and the second impedance measurement is obtained from the battery at a second time associated with the charging cycle that is different from the first time.
3. The method of claim 2, further comprising:
  charging the battery to full using a constant current prior to obtaining the first impedance measurement; and
  saturating charge of the battery using a constant voltage prior to obtaining the second impedance measurement.
4. The method of claim 1, wherein the first and second impedance measurements are obtained during a steady state of the battery.
5. The method of claim 1, wherein in the regression model is a recurrent neural network model.
6. The method of claim 5, wherein the recurrent neural network model is trained using impedance measurements of another battery.
7. The method of claim 6, wherein the recurrent neural network is trained based on a calculated charge capacity per cycle of another battery.
8. The method of claim 1, wherein the first and second impedance measurements are taken at a first temperature and the estimated capacity is for a second temperature that is different from the first temperature.
9. A method to detect an anomaly in a battery, the method comprising:
 receiving a first impedance measurement from the battery in response to a first multi-frequency sweep;
  receiving a second impedance measurement from the battery in response to a second multi-frequency sweep; and
  based on the first and second impedance measurements, detecting the anomaly in the battery.
10. The method of claim 9, further comprising:
  determining a shift in impedance between the first and second impedance measurements; and
 comparing the shift to an expected value for the shift.
11. The method of claim 10, wherein the expected value for the shift is based on an age of the battery.
12. The method of claim 10, wherein the expected value for the shift is based on a model generated using another battery.
13. The method of claim 9, wherein the first impedance measurement is obtained from the battery at a first time associated with a charging cycle and the second impedance measurement is obtained from the battery at a second time associated with the charging cycle that is different from the first time.
14. The method of claim 13, further comprising:
  charging the battery to full using a constant current prior to obtaining the first impedance measurement; and
  saturating charge of the battery using a constant voltage prior to obtaining the second impedance measurement.
15. The method of claim 9, wherein the first and second impedance measurements are obtained during a steady state of the battery.
16. A battery management system comprising:
 at least one hardware processor; and
 at least one memory storing instructions that, when executed by the at least one hardware processor, cause the at least one hardware processor to perform operations comprising:
  receiving a first impedance measurement from the battery in response to a first multi-frequency sweep;
  receiving a second impedance measurement from the battery in response to a second multi-frequency sweep;
  based on the first and second impedance measurements, generating an estimated capacity of the battery using a regression model; and
  detecting an anomaly in the battery.
17. The system of claim 16, wherein the first impedance measurement is obtained from the battery at a first time associated with a charging cycle and the second impedance measurement is obtained from the battery at a second time associated with the charging cycle that is different from the first time.
18. The system of claim 17, the operations further comprising:
  charging the battery to full using a constant current prior to obtaining the first impedance measurement; and
  saturating charge of the battery using a constant voltage prior to obtaining the second impedance measurement.
19. The system of claim 16, wherein the first and second impedance measurements are obtained during a steady state of the battery.
20. The system of claim 16, wherein generating the estimated capacity includes inputting the first and second impedance measurements in a recurrent neural network model.

Title: Battery modules for determining temperature and voltage characteristics of electrochemical cells, and associated methods
Inventor:
KAHN SETH MARSHALL 
DEVIE ARNAUD 
CAMMI CORRADO 
BRINKERHOFF NATHAN THOMAS
Abstract: A method for determining a temperature characteristic of an electrochemical cell assembly includes (1) sensing a first voltage via one or more thermistors electrically coupled to the electrochemical cell assembly while loading circuitry electrically coupled to the thermistors is deactivated, (2) sensing a second voltage via the one or more thermistors while the loading circuitry is activated, and (3) determining the temperature characteristic of the electrochemical cell assembly at least partially from the first and second voltages.
Claims:
What is claimed is:
1. A method for determining a temperature characteristic of an electrochemical cell assembly, comprising:
  sensing a first voltage via one or more thermistors electrically coupling the electrochemical cell assembly to a battery management system while loading circuitry electrically coupled to the thermistors is deactivated;
  sensing a second voltage via the one or more thermistors while the loading circuitry is activated; and
  determining the temperature characteristic of the electrochemical cell assembly at least partially from the first and second voltages.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the one or more thermistors are thermally coupled with electrochemical cells of the electrochemical cell assembly.
3. The method of claim 2, wherein the one or more thermistors are integrated with the electrochemical cell assembly.
4. The method of claim 1, further comprising activating the loading circuitry by causing the loading circuitry to draw an electric current through the one or more thermistors.
5. The method of claim 1, wherein the loading circuitry is configured to balance a state of charge of the electrochemical cell assembly.
6. The method of claim 1, wherein the first voltage is a voltage across one or more electrochemical cells of the electrochemical cell assembly.
7. The method of claim 6, further comprising determining a voltage of the electrochemical cell assembly at least partially based on the first voltage.
8. The method of claim 1, wherein determining the temperature characteristic of the electrochemical cell assembly at least partially from the first and second voltages comprises:
  determining a resistance of the one or more thermistors at least partially from the first and second voltages; and
  determining the temperature characteristic of the electrochemical cell assembly from the resistance of the one or more thermistors.
9. The method of claim 8, wherein:
 the one or more thermistors comprise a plurality of thermistors; and
  the resistance of the one or more thermistors is a total resistance of the one or more thermistors.
10. The method of claim 1, wherein the temperature characteristic of the electrochemical cell assembly is an absolute temperature of the electrochemical cell assembly.
11. The method of claim 1, wherein the temperature characteristic of the electrochemical cell assembly is a relative temperature of the electrochemical cell assembly.
12. A battery module, comprising:
 an electrochemical cell assembly configured for voltage and temperature sensing via a common pair of electrical terminals, including:
   one or more electrochemical cells electrically coupled between a first battery node and a second battery node,
   a first thermistor,
   a first electrical terminal for sensing voltage and temperature of the electrochemical cell assembly, the first electrical terminal being electrically coupled to the first battery node via the first thermistor, and
   a second electrical terminal for sensing voltage and temperature of the electrochemical cell assembly, the second electrical terminal being electrically coupled to the second battery node; and
  a battery management system (BMS) electrically coupled to each of the first and second electrical terminals,
  the electrochemical cell assembly and the BMS being collectively configured such that the BMS is capable of sensing at least both of a temperature characteristic of the electrochemical cell assembly and a voltage of the electrochemical cell assembly solely via the first and second electrical terminals.
13. The battery module of claim 12, wherein the electrochemical cell assembly further includes a second thermistor, and wherein the second electrical terminal is electrically coupled to the second battery node via the second thermistor.
14. The battery module of claim 13, wherein each of the first and second thermistors is thermally coupled with the one or more electrochemical cells.
15. The battery module of claim 12, wherein the BMS is further configured to balance a state of charge of the electrochemical cell assembly.
16. A method for determining a temperature characteristic of an electrochemical cell assembly, comprising:
  sensing a plurality of first voltages via thermistors electrically coupling electrochemical cells of the electrochemical cell assembly to a battery management system while loading circuitry electrically coupled to the thermistors is deactivated;
  sensing a plurality of second voltages via the thermistors while the loading circuitry is activated; and
  determining the temperature characteristic at least partially from the plurality of first voltages and the plurality of second voltages.
17. The method of claim 16, wherein the temperature characteristic is a relative temperature of the electrochemical cell assembly.
18. The method of claim 17, wherein the relative temperature of the electrochemical cell assembly is a temperature of the electrochemical cell assembly relative to a temperature of one or more other electrochemical cell assemblies.
19. The method of claim 17, wherein the relative temperature of the electrochemical cell assembly is a temperature of the electrochemical cell assembly relative to a mathematical function of respective temperatures of two or more other electrochemical cell assemblies.
20. The method of claim 17, wherein the relative temperature of the electrochemical cell assembly is a current temperature of the electrochemical assembly relative to a previous temperature of the electrochemical assembly.

Title: A method for estimating state of charge and state of health of a battery and a system thereof
Inventor:
PABBU SURAJ KUMAR 
WADEGAONKAR AMEY P 
JOSHI ANAYKUMAR
Abstract: A Method for Estimating State of Charge and State of Health of Battery and a System thereof The present invention relates to a method (200) and system (100) for estimating state of charge and state of health of a battery (10). A first vector (x) and a second vector (?) are initialised. The first vector (x) is estimated and updated by a first state-space filter based first equivalent circuit solver by assuming a fixed value of the second vector (?). the second vector (?) is estimated and updated based on an Electrochemical Model and then by a second state-space filter based second equivalent circuit solver. The updated values of the second vector (?) by the Electrochemical Model and the second state-space filter based equivalent circuit solver are merged. The state of charge is obtained from the updated value of the first vector (x), and the state of the health is obtained from the merged and updated value of the second vector (?).
Claims:
CLAIMS:
1. A method (200) for estimating state of charge and state of health of a battery (10), comprising the steps of: initialising a first vector (x) and a second vector (0) based on typically known values of voltage, state of charge of the battery, impedance and charge capacity (Q) of the battery (10); estimating and updating the first vector (x) by a first state-space filter based first equivalent circuit solver by assuming a fixed value of the second vector (0); estimating and updating the second vector (0), fully or partly, based on an Electrochemical Model; estimating and updating the second vector (0), fully or partly, by a second state-space filter based second equivalent circuit solver; merging the updated values of the second vector (0) by the Electrochemical Model and the second state-space filter based equivalent circuit solver; and obtaining the state of charge of the battery (10) from the updated value of the first vector (x), and obtaining the state of the health of the battery (10) from the merged and updated value of the second vector (0).
2. The method (200) as claimed in claim 1 , wherein the first vector (x) is a state vector comprising voltage variables and state of charge of the battery (10).
 The method (200) as claimed in claim 1 , wherein the second vector (0) is a parameter vector comprising impedance elements and charge capacity (Q) of the battery (10). The method (200) as claimed in claim 1 , wherein an equivalent circuit corresponding to the first equivalent circuit solver and the second equivalent circuit solver comprises one or more RC elements having a known estimated impedance, and a voltage source representing the open circuit voltage (Voc) of a cell. The method (200) as claimed in claim 4, wherein the open circuit voltage (Voc) of the cell in the equivalent circuit is a non-linear function of the state of the charge of the cell. The method (200) as claimed in claim 1 , wherein the first state-space filter is a Kalman filter. The method (200) as claimed in claim 1 , wherein the second statespace filter is a Kalman filter. The method (200) as claimed in claim 1 , wherein the electrochemical model is an electrolyte Enhanced Single Particle Model.
 18. A system (100) for estimating state of charge and state of health of a battery (10), comprising: a voltage sensing circuitry (110) for sensing the voltage across cells of the battery (10); a current sensing circuitry (120) for sensing the current passing through cells of the battery (10); and a central processing unit (140) configured for initialising a first vector (x) and a second vector (0) based on typically known values of voltage, state of charge of the battery (10), impedance and charge capacity (Q) of the battery (10), estimating and updating the first vector (x) by a first state-space filter based first equivalent circuit solver by assuming a fixed value of the second vector, estimating and updating the second vector (0), fully or partly, based on an Electrochemical Model, estimating and updating the second vector (0), fully or partly, by a second state-space filter based second equivalent circuit solver, merging the updated values of the second vector (0) by the Electrochemical Model and the second state-space filter based equivalent circuit solver, and obtaining the state of charge of the battery (10) from the updated value of the first vector (x), and obtaining the state of the health of the battery (10) from the merged and updated value of the second vector (0).
 19 
10. The system (100) as claimed in claim 9, wherein the first vector (x) is a state vector comprising voltage variables and state of charge of the battery (10).
 11. The system (100) as claimed in claim 9, wherein the second vector(0) is a parameter vector comprising impedance elements and charge capacity (Q) of the battery (10).
 12. The system (100) as claimed in claim 9, wherein an equivalent circuit corresponding to the first equivalent circuit solver and the second equivalent circuit solver comprises one or more RC elements having a known estimated impedance, and a voltage source representing the open circuit voltage (Voc) of a cell.
 13. The system (100) as claimed in claim 12, wherein the open circuit voltage (Voc) of the cell in the equivalent circuit is a non-linear function of the state of the charge of the cell.
 14. The system (100) as claimed in claim 9, wherein the first state-space filter is a Kalman filter.
 15. The method (100) as claimed in claim 9, wherein the second statespace filter is a Kalman filter.
 20 
16. The system (100) as claimed in claim 9, wherein the electrochemical model is electrolyte Enhanced Single Particle Model.

Title: Storage battery consistency screening device and screening method
Parent Assignee: ELECTRIC POWER SCIENCE RES INSTITUTE OF HENAN POWER OF STATE GRID, STATE GRID CORP
Assignee:
ELECTRIC POWER RESEARCH INSTITUTE OF STATE GRID HENAN ELECTRIC POWER 
SGCC - STATE GRID CORPORATION OF CHINA
Inventor:
WANG FANGFANG
ZHAO GUANGJIN
HU YUXIA
DONG RUIFENG
Abstract: The invention discloses a storage battery consistency screening device and method.The screening device comprises an excitation source, a filtering and amplifying circuit and a signal collecting circuit, the excitation source is used for outputting sine excitation current to a tested storage battery, and the filtering and amplifying circuit is used for amplifying the alternating-current component of voltage at the two ends of the tested storage battery; and the signal acquisition circuit is used for acquiring the voltage value output by the filtering and amplifying circuit, calculating the voltage component of the measured storage battery under the specific frequency through Fourier transform, and further calculating the AC impedance value. According to the method, the matching condition of the tested storage batteries can be obtained only through one round of charging, the storage batteries which can be matched into groups can be quickly screened, the matching method fully considers the difference between the capacities of the batteries and also considers the difference between the impedances of different batteries in the operation period, and the matching accuracy is improved. The scientificity and accuracy of the consistency of the storage battery monomers are ensured, the screening time is saved, and the screening efficiency is improved.
Claims:
1. The utility model provides a battery uniformity sieving mechanism for filter the battery, its characterized in that, the sieving mechanism includes excitation source, filtering amplification circuit and signal acquisition circuit, the excitation source is used for being surveyed the battery output sinusoidal exciting current, filtering amplification circuit is used for enlargiing the alternating current component of being surveyed battery both ends voltage, signal acquisition circuit is used for gathering the voltage value of filtering amplification circuit output, calculates through Fourier transform and reachs the voltage component of being surveyed the battery under specific frequency, and then calculates and obtain the alternating current impedance value.
2. A screening method using the battery conformity screening apparatus according to claim 1, characterized by comprising the steps of:
 s1: respectively measuring the alternating current impedance values of at least two storage batteries by using the storage battery consistency screening device;
 s2: calculating the consistency of the alternating-current impedance values of the two storage batteries;
 s3: and judging that the two storage batteries are consistent if the alternating current impedance values of the two storage batteries are consistent, and the two storage batteries are not consistent if the alternating current impedance values of the two storage batteries are not consistent.
3. The battery uniformity screening apparatus of claim 1, wherein the excitation source outputs a current at a frequency of 90 Hz.
4. The storage battery consistency screening method according to claim 2, wherein the step S2 specifically comprises: respectively drawing alternating current impedance curves of the two storage batteries according to the alternating current impedance values of the two storage batteries, normalizing the time parameters and the impedance parameters of the alternating current impedance curves, calculating the shortest distance from each point on the alternating current impedance curve with long duration to the other alternating current impedance curve, and if the sum average value of all the shortest distances is smaller than a distance threshold value, the alternating current impedance values of the two storage batteries are consistent.
5. The method for screening consistency of storage batteries according to claim 2, wherein in step S1, the ac impedance value of the storage battery is measured by inputting a sinusoidal excitation current with a specific frequency to the storage battery, sampling an ac component of a voltage across the storage battery, performing fourier transform on the sampled ac component, converting the ac component to obtain a voltage component of the storage battery at the frequency, and calculating the ac impedance value.

Title: EIS online measurement method based on digital twinning and programmable resistors
Inventor:
YANG SHICHUN
SHEN HAICHI
LI QIANGWEI
ZHOU XINAN
YAN XIAOYU
CAO YAOGUANG
CHEN FEI
Abstract: The invention discloses an EIS online measurement method based on digital twinning and programmable resistors, and the method comprises the steps: achieving the online measurement of medium and high frequency bands of an EIS through a programmable resistor at a vehicle end and an IGBT switch, and transmitting the impedance information of the medium and high frequency bands to a cloud battery management system; and inputting the medium and high frequency band information into a neural network algorithm deployed in the digital twin model of the cloud battery management system, estimating the low frequency band information of the EIS, and forming an electrochemical impedance spectrum of a complete frequency band to update the digital twin battery model of the cloud battery management system to obtain accurate battery state information. The state detection of the mechanism level of the power battery and the iterative updating of the digital twinborn model are realized. According to the technical scheme, an external excitation source is not needed, online measurement can be achieved, and needed equipment is simple, reliable and small in size; and real-time updating can be realized, and the cost is low.

Title: Battery pack having improved swelling measurement accuracy
Inventor: SONG HYEON-JIN
Abstract: Disclosed is a battery pack, which may accurately detect swelling of a battery cell according to a situation. The battery pack includes a battery cell having an electrode assembly, an electrolyte, a battery case and an electrode terminal; a deformation measuring unit at least partially attached to an outer surface of the battery case of the battery cell and configured to measure whether the battery case is deformed; an impedance measuring unit connected to the electrode terminal of the battery cell and configured to measure impedance inside the battery cell; and a control unit configured to determine whether the battery cell is swelled by using a deformation measurement result of the deformation measuring unit and an impedance measurement result of the impedance measuring unit.
Claims:
1. A battery pack, comprising:
  a battery cell having an electrode assembly, an electrolyte, a battery case and an electrode terminal;
  a deformation measuring unit at least partially attached to an outer surface of the battery case of the battery cell and configured to measure whether the battery case is deformed;
  an impedance measuring unit connected to the electrode terminal of the battery cell and configured to measure impedance inside the battery cell; and
  a control unit configured to determine whether the battery cell is swelled by using a deformation measurement result of the deformation measuring unit and an impedance measurement result of the impedance measuring unit.
2. The battery pack according to claim 1,
 wherein the control unit is configured to determine that the battery cell is not swelled when the impedance measured by the impedance measuring unit is less than a reference impedance, even though the deformation amount measured by the deformation measuring unit is equal to or greater than a reference deformation amount.
3. The battery pack according to claim 1,
 wherein the control unit is configured to determine whether the impedance increases, when the impedance measured by the impedance measuring unit is less than a reference impedance.
4. The battery pack according to claim 1,
 wherein the control unit is configured to transmit an impedance measurement start signal to the impedance measuring unit, when the deformation amount measured by the deformation measuring unit is equal to or greater than a reference deformation amount.
5. The battery pack according to claim 1, further comprising:
  a temperature measuring unit located around the battery cell and configured to measure temperature of the battery cell,
  wherein the control unit is configured to determine whether the battery cell is swelled by further considering the temperature measurement result of the temperature measuring unit.
6. The battery pack according to claim 5,
 wherein the control unit is configured to determine that the battery cell is swelled, only when the deformation amount measured by the deformation measuring unit is equal to or greater than a reference deformation amount, the impedance measured by the impedance measuring unit is equal to or greater than a reference impedance, and the temperature measured by the temperature measuring unit is equal to or greater than a reference temperature.
7. The battery pack according to claim 1,
 wherein the battery cell is a pouch-type battery that includes an accommodation portion in which the electrode assembly and the electrolyte are accommodates, and a sealing portion disposed around the accommodation portion,
  the deformation measuring unit is at least partially attached to the accommodation portion, and
 the impedance measuring unit is configured to be at least partially placed on the sealing portion.
8. The battery pack according to claim 7,
 wherein the battery cell is configured such that the sealing portion is at least partially folded toward the accommodation portion, and
  the impedance measuring unit is configured to be at least partially interposed between the accommodation portion and the folded sealing portion of the battery cell.
9. The battery pack according to claim 8,
 wherein the deformation measuring unit is elongated in one direction to be partially bent, so that one end of the deformation measuring unit is attached onto the printed circuit board and the other end of the deformation measuring unit is attached onto the accommodation portion of the battery cell.
10. A vehicle, comprising the battery pack according to any one of claims 1 to 9.

Title: Temperature detection equipment of power battery and electric automobile
Inventor:
YU ZHENXING
CHEN TAO
DAI, Kangwei
SHENG JUN
Abstract: The invention discloses a temperature detection device of a power battery, and relates to the technical field of electric automobiles, the temperature detection device of the power battery comprises a plurality of temperature detection branches, each temperature detection branch comprises a plurality of temperature detection elements connected in series, and each temperature detection element is arranged on a battery cell; the data acquisition board comprises a plurality of groups of data interfaces, and each group of data interfaces is in communication connection with one temperature detection branch and is used for acquiring current parameters of the temperature detection branch; and the controller is in communication connection with the data acquisition board, receives the current value acquired by the data acquisition board and outputs a temperature value corresponding to the current value. According to the scheme of the invention, the coverage and timeliness of temperature monitoring of the power battery are improved, and the possibility of thermal runaway of the power battery is reduced.
Claims:
1. A temperature detection device for a power battery, comprising:
 the temperature detection device comprises a plurality of temperature detection branches, a plurality of temperature detection units and a control unit, wherein each temperature detection branch comprises a plurality of temperature detection elements connected in series, and each temperature detection element is arranged on one battery cell;
 the data acquisition board comprises a plurality of groups of data interfaces, each group of data interfaces is in communication connection with one temperature detection branch, and the data acquisition board acquires current parameters of the temperature detection branches;
 and the controller is in communication connection with the data acquisition board, receives the current value acquired by the data acquisition board and outputs a temperature value corresponding to the current value.
2. The apparatus of claim 1, wherein the temperature sensing element is a non-linear temperature sensing element.
3. The apparatus according to claim 2, wherein the temperature detecting element is a Positive Temperature Coefficient (PTC) type thermistor or a Negative Temperature Coefficient (NTC) type thermistor.
4. The apparatus of claim 3, wherein the rate of change of impedance of the temperature sensing element over a first temperature range is less than the rate of change of impedance over a second temperature range; wherein the highest temperature in the first temperature range is less than or equal to the lowest temperature in the second temperature range.
5. The apparatus of claim 1, wherein the temperature sensing element is located on a negative tab of the cell.
6. The device of claim 1, wherein the controller further comprises a communication module, and the controller transmits the temperature value to a vehicle-side platform and/or a cloud-side big data platform through the communication module.
7. The apparatus of claim 1, wherein the controller is a controller of a Battery Management System (BMS).
8. An electric vehicle characterized by comprising the temperature detection device of a power battery according to any one of claims 1 to 7.

Title: Impedance measurement and control device and method for vehicle-mounted fuel cell
Inventor:
ZHAO XINGWANG
SHENG YOUDONG
LI FEIQIANG
ZHANG GUOQIANG
FANG CHUAN
Abstract: The invention provides an impedance measurement and control device and method for a vehicle-mounted fuel cell, belongs to the technical field of fuel cell impedance measurement, and solves the problem that the alternating current impedance of a single cell cannot be effectively measured and the operation of an electric pile cannot be effectively controlled in the prior art. The device comprises the electric pile, a DC-DC converter, a current sensor, a voltage inspection device and a controller. The DC-DC converter and the voltage inspection device are connected through a signal synchronization line; the current sensor is arranged in the DC-DC converter; and each electrode of the voltage inspection device is connected with the output end of one single battery of the electric pile. And the controller is used for starting the DC-DC converter, sending an alternating current excitation signal to the electric pile when the electric pile runs normally, starting the voltage inspection device after the numerical value of the current sensor is stable, obtaining the alternating current impedance of each single battery according to the feedback voltage of each single battery in the electric pile at the same moment and the detected current, and enabling the electric pile to run. The functions of measuring and controlling the impedance of the single battery of the electric pile are realized.

Title: Battery pack monitoring device, management system and vehicle
Inventor:
XIE XIKE
LI QIFENG
YANG YUN
CHEN GANG
Abstract: The invention relates to a battery pack monitoring device, a management system and a vehicle. The device comprises a multi-way switch selector which is used for transmitting a first starting instruction to an alternating current signal generator according to an internal resistance monitoring operation instruction, and is also used for controlling the on-off of a plurality of switches according to the internal resistance monitoring operation instruction; the alternating current signal generator which is used for generating a preset alternating current signal according to the first starting instruction under the condition that the first starting instruction is received, and injecting the preset alternating current signal into the battery pack; and an internal resistance determination module which is used for acquiring alternating-current voltage signals at the two ends of the battery corresponding to the switch in the conducting state, and determining the internal resistance of the battery corresponding to the switch in the conducting state according to the alternating-current voltage signals. Therefore, the working state of a battery pack is not interfered or damaged, factors influencing the monitoring precision of the internal resistance of the battery pack are reduced, real-time monitoring of the internal resistance of the vehicle-mounted battery pack is facilitated, the evaluation process of the battery pack is simplified, and the energy consumption for evaluating the battery pack is reduced.

Title: Self-adaptive current source impedance measuring device and method
Assignee:
JIANGSU ELECTRIC POWER RESEARCH INSTITUTE
STATE GRID JIANGSU ELECTRIC POWER
SICHUAN UNIVERSITY
Inventor:
ZHAO JINGBO
SUN RONG
MA JUNPENG
WANG WEITAO
ZHU YUMENG
YANG WENLI
LIU TIANQI
LI WENBO
Abstract: The invention provides a self-adaptive current source impedance measuring device and method, a parallel injection current impedance measuring device is composed of a three-phase uncontrolled rectifier, a bidirectional DC-DC and a single-phase inverter, and the alternating current side of the three-phase uncontrolled rectifier is connected with a power grid to supply power to a post-stage bidirectional DC-DC circuit; the DC-DC circuit adopts a PI controller to realize constant voltage, and provides stable voltage for the single-phase inverter; the control part of the single-phase inverter comprises a fundamental wave controller and a disturbance controller, the fundamental wave controller is used for preventing fundamental wave signal interaction between the system to be tested and the measuring device, and the disturbance controller is used for outputting disturbance current in a set form. According to the invention, stable operation of the impedance measurement device in a full frequency band can be realized without avoiding resonance points of the to-be-measured system.
Claims:
1. An adaptive current source impedance measuring device, comprising: the three-phase uncontrolled rectifier is connected with a power grid on the alternating current side, and the direct current side is connected with the bidirectional DC-DC circuit to supply power to the bidirectional DC-DC circuit on the later stage; the bidirectional DC-DC circuit provides a constant voltage to the single-phase inverter; the single-phase inverter outputs a disturbance current.
2. The adaptive current source impedance measuring device according to claim 1, wherein the bidirectional DC-DC circuit implements a constant voltage through a PI controller to provide a stable DC voltage for the three-phase inverter.
3. The adaptive current source impedance measuring device according to claim 2, wherein the three-phase inverter comprises a fundamental wave controller and a disturbance controller, the fundamental wave controller is used for preventing fundamental wave signal interaction between a system to be measured and the measuring device, and the disturbance controller is used for outputting a set form disturbance current.
4. An adaptive current source impedance measuring device according to claim 3, wherein the fundamental controller adopts a constant current control strategy oriented with the grid voltage of the system to be measured under the dq axis, and the dq axis current references are all set to 0.
5. The adaptive current source impedance measuring device according to claim 3, wherein the disturbance controller adopts a current control strategy oriented with disturbance voltage under dq axis, and the disturbance current amplitude is adaptively adjusted through feedforward disturbance voltage amplitude.
6. An adaptive current source impedance measuring method based on the measuring device according to any one of claims 1 to 5, characterized by comprising the steps of:
 step 1: determining a direct-current side voltage reference value of a bidirectional DC-DC circuit according to the voltage grade of a system to be tested
 Step 2: before impedance measurement, constant voltage control is carried out on the bidirectional DC-DC circuit;
 and step 3: when receiving an impedance measurement signal, starting an inverter controller to control an inverter circuit, wherein the output frequency is f1The disturbance current is adjusted in a self-adaptive mode, voltage and current data of a measuring point are collected at the same time, and f is calculated through the following formula1The impedance of (a):
 
 and 4, step 4: after a time of delta t, changeChanging the frequency of the disturbance current to f1+ delta f, collecting voltage and current data of the measuring point;
 and 5: and (4) repeating the step (4) until the disturbance current frequency covers the full measurement frequency band.

Title: Battery health state monitoring method and device, vehicle and storage medium
Inventor: HU GAOFENG
Abstract: The embodiment of the invention provides a battery health state monitoring method and device, a vehicle and a storage medium, and relates to the technical field of vehicles. The method is applied to a battery circuit comprising a battery, a controller and a preset load. The method comprises the following steps: acquiring first measurement data of a battery and first voltage of a controller after a preset load is accessed for a first preset duration; obtaining second voltage of the controller after the preset load is removed for a second preset duration and second measurement data of the battery after a third preset duration, wherein the second preset duration is smaller than the first preset duration, and the third preset duration is smaller than the first preset duration and larger than the second preset duration; and calculating the internal resistance of the battery according to the first measurement data, the second measurement data, the first voltage and the second voltage so as to calculate the internal resistance of the battery on line, and monitoring the health state and the service life of the battery according to the internal resistance so as to timely give an early warning or inform a user of reserving to replace the battery of the vehicle before the battery is scrapped.
Claims:
1. The battery health state monitoring method is applied to a battery circuit, the battery circuit comprises a battery, a controller and a preset load, the battery is connected with the controller in parallel, the controller controls the preset load to be connected into the battery circuit or to be disconnected from the preset load in the battery circuit, wherein when the preset load is connected into the battery circuit, the preset load, the battery and the controller are connected in parallel, the battery supplies power for the preset load, and the method comprises the following steps:
 acquiring first measurement data of the battery and first voltage of the controller after the battery is accessed to the preset load for a first preset time;
 acquiring second voltage of the controller after the preset load is removed for a second preset time, and second measurement data of the battery after the preset load is removed for a third preset time, wherein the second preset time is shorter than the first preset time, and the third preset time is shorter than the first preset time and longer than the second preset time; and
 and calculating the internal resistance of the battery according to the first measurement data, the second measurement data, the first voltage and the second voltage.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the battery circuit further comprises a dc-to-dc controller adapted to power the charging circuit, and wherein the method further comprises, prior to obtaining the first measurement data of the battery and the first voltage of the controller after the battery is connected to the preset load for a first preset duration:
 after the battery circuit is electrified through the DC-DC converter controller, the battery circuit is connected to the preset load, so that the preset load works at rated power, wherein the voltage provided by the DC-DC converter controller is greater than the voltage of the battery; and
 and reducing the voltage of the direct current-to-direct current controller, so that the reduced voltage of the direct current-to-direct current controller is lower than the voltage of the battery when the battery is independently used for the preset load to run at rated power.
3. The method of claim 1, wherein the obtaining the first measurement data of the battery accessed to the preset load for the first preset duration comprises:
 acquiring the voltage and the first current of the battery after the battery is connected to the preset load for a first preset time;
 the obtaining of the second measurement data of the battery after the preset load is removed for a third preset duration includes:
 acquiring a second current of the battery after the preset load is removed for a third preset time;
 the calculating the internal resistance of the battery according to the first measurement data, the second measurement data, the first voltage, and the second voltage includes:
 calculating a first resistance from the voltage of the battery, the first current, and the first voltage;
 calculating a second resistance from the first current, the second current, the first voltage, and the second voltage; and
 and calculating the internal resistance of the battery according to the first resistance and the second resistance.
4. The method of claim 1, wherein the obtaining the first measurement data of the battery accessed to the preset load for the first preset duration comprises:
 acquiring a first current of the battery after the battery is connected to the preset load for a first preset time;
 the obtaining of the second measurement data of the battery after the preset load is removed for a third preset duration includes:
 acquiring a second current of the battery after the preset load is removed for a third preset time;
 the calculating the internal resistance of the battery according to the first measurement data, the second measurement data, the first voltage, and the second voltage includes:
 and calculating the internal resistance of the battery according to the first current, the second current, the first voltage and the second voltage.
5. The method of claim 1, wherein after calculating the internal resistance of the battery from the first measurement data, the second measurement data, the first voltage, and the second voltage, the method further comprises:
 and determining the health state of the battery according to the internal resistance.
6. The method of claim 5, wherein said determining the state of health of the battery based on the internal resistance comprises:
 calculating a difference value between the internal resistance and the initial internal resistance of the battery;
 acquiring the ambient temperature of the vehicle, and correcting the difference value based on the ambient temperature; and
 and determining the state of health of the battery according to the correction result.
7. The method according to any one of claims 1 to 6, wherein before acquiring the first measurement data of the battery and the first voltage of the controller after accessing the preset load for a first preset time period, the method further comprises:
 detecting whether the vehicle is in a dormant state; and
 and if the vehicle is detected to be in the dormant state, acquiring first measurement data of the battery and first voltage of the controller after the battery is accessed to the preset load for a first preset time.
8. The utility model provides a battery state of health monitoring device, its characterized in that is applied to the battery circuit, the battery circuit includes battery, controller and predetermines the load, the battery with the controller is parallelly connected, controller control predetermine the load and insert the battery circuit or remove in the battery circuit predetermine the load, wherein, work as when predetermine the load and insert during the battery circuit, predetermine the load respectively with the battery with the controller is parallelly connected just the battery does predetermine the load power supply, include:
 the first acquisition module is used for acquiring first measurement data of the battery and first voltage of the controller after the battery is accessed to the preset load for a first preset time;
 a second obtaining module, configured to obtain a second voltage of the controller after the preset load is removed for a second preset duration and second measurement data of the battery after a third preset duration, where the second preset duration is shorter than the first preset duration, and the third preset duration is shorter than the first preset duration and longer than the second preset duration; and
 and the internal resistance calculation module is used for calculating the internal resistance of the battery according to the first measurement data, the second measurement data, the first voltage and the second voltage.
9. A vehicle, characterized by comprising:
 the battery circuit comprises a battery, a controller and a preset load, wherein the battery is connected with the controller in parallel, the controller controls the preset load to be connected into the battery circuit or removes the preset load from the battery circuit, when the preset load is connected into the battery circuit, the preset load, the battery and the controller are connected in parallel, and the battery supplies power for the preset load;
 one or more processors;
 a memory; and
 one or more applications, wherein the first one or more applications are stored in the memory and configured to be invoked by the one or more processors to perform the battery state of health monitoring method of any of claims 1-7.
10. A computer-readable storage medium having stored thereon program code that can be invoked by a processor to perform the battery state of health monitoring method according to any one of claims 1 to 7.

Title: Systems and methods for impedance measurement of a battery cell
Inventor:
KONOPKA DANIEL A 
HOWLETT III JOHN RICHARD 
HOLT JEFFREY J
Abstract: A system is disclosed for determining complex impedance characteristics of one or more battery cells based on the charge signal applied, or to be applied, to the battery cell. Implementations may include measuring the impedance of a battery cell to, in some instances, determine a frequency component or harmonic that defines, at least a portion, of a waveform shape for charging the battery cell. In one implementation, the impedance at the battery cell may be measured or estimated from a discrete charge period being applied to the battery cell or from multiple discrete charge periods applied to the battery cell. The measured differences between the amplitude and time components of the voltage and current waveforms may be used to determine or estimate the magnitude, phase shift, real, and/or imaginary values of the impedance at the battery cell.
Claims:
We claim:
1. A method for monitoring an electrochemical device comprising: 
 obtaining, via a processing device, a plurality of measurements of a voltage amplitude and a current amplitude of charge waveform applied to an electrochemical device; 
 calculating a plurality of impedance ratios each comprising a voltage amplitude measurement and a corresponding current amplitude measurement; and 
 obtaining, based on a sum of a subset of the plurality of ratios, complex impedance characteristics of the electrochemical device.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the complex impedance characteristics comprise at least one of a real impedance value, an imaginary impedance value, a magnitude impedance value, or a phase shift impedance value.
3. The method of claim 1, wherein first charge waveform comprises a discrete charge period comprising a sinusoidal leading edge portion and a body portion, different than the leading edge portion, following the leading edge portion.
4. The method of claim 3 further comprising: 
 estimating a real impedance value of the leading edge portion of the charge waveform by summing a subset of the plurality of impedance ratios corresponding to the leading edge portion.
5. The method of claim 4, wherein the real impedance value corresponds to a voltage amplitude measurement at the electrochemical device obtained at a first time and a current amplitude measurement through the electrochemical device obtained at a second time later than the first time.
6. The method of claim 5 further comprising: 
 estimating the second time based on a determined inflection point of a current component of the leading edge portion of the charge waveform.
7. The method of claim 3 further comprising: 
 estimating an imaginary impedance value corresponding to the leading edge portion of the charge waveform, the imaginary impedance determined from a difference of the first time and the second time.
8. The method of claim 3 further comprising: 
 estimating a real impedance value corresponding to the body portion of the charge waveform by summing a subset of the plurality of impedance ratios corresponding to the body portion.
9. The method of claim 3 further comprising 
 determining, based on the plurality of measurements of the voltage amplitude, a first transition a voltage component within the charge waveform from the leading edge portion to the body portion.
10. The method of claim 9 further comprising: 
 determining, based on the plurality of measurements of the current amplitude, a second transition a current component within the charge waveform from the leading edge portion to the body portion, the second transition occurring after the first transition.
11. The method of claim 1, wherein the first charge waveform comprises one or more discrete charge periods, the measurements of the first charge waveform obtained from a first discrete charge period and a second discrete charge period different than the first discrete charge period.
12. The method of claim 3 further comprising: 
 calculating a centroid of the leading edge portion of the charge waveform, the complex impedance characteristics of the electrochemical device further based on the calculated centroid of the leading edge portion.
13. The method of claim 3 further comprising: 
 calculating a centroid of the body portion of the charge waveform, the complex impedance characteristics of the electrochemical device further based on the calculated centroid of the body portion.
14. A method of charging an electrochemical device comprising: 
 for a charge waveform for charging an electrochemical device, the charge waveform comprising a defined harmonic component; 
 obtaining a representative value indicative of a flow of current to the electrochemical device responsive to the charge waveform, the obtained representative value related to the defined harmonic; and 
 altering an attribute of the charge waveform based on the representative value.
15. The method of claim 14 wherein the representative value is at least one of impedance, admittance, and power.
16. The method of claim 14 wherein the charge waveform includes a shaped leading edge.
17. The method of claim 16 wherein the representative value is impedance, the shaped leading edge is associated with a frequency defined based on a relationship between the frequency and the impedance of the electrochemical device to the frequency of the shaped leading edge of the charge waveform.
18. The method of claim 17 wherein the representative value is based on the impedance of the frequency, and wherein altering the attribute comprises altering a frequency attribute of a shaped leading edge to reduce the impedance of the electrochemical device to the charge waveform.
19. The method of claim 14 wherein the representative value is impedance, the charge waveform defines a body portion, the impedance associated with the body portion, and altering an attribute of the charge waveform comprises altering a period of the body portion based on the impedance.
20. The method of claim 19 wherein the altered period of the body portion is based on maintaining the impedance of the body portion within a threshold.
21. The method of claim 14 wherein the representative value is impedance, the charge waveform defines a body portion, the impedance associated with the body portion, and altering an attribute of the charge waveform comprises altering a frequency of a leading edge harmonic to reduce the impedance associated with the body portion.
22. The method of claim 14 wherein the charge waveform defines a trailing edge with a voltage component and a current component, a following charge waveform applied after the current component of the charge waveform reaches zero.
23. The method of claim 14 wherein obtaining a representative value indicative of the flow of current to the electrochemical device responsive to the charge waveform comprises obtaining a ratio between a voltage component and a current component of the charge waveform to determine a real component of an impedance.
24. The method of claim 23 wherein the ratio is associated with a peak value of a leading edge harmonic of the voltage component of the charge waveform.
25. The method of claim 23 wherein the ratio is associated with a value of a body portion of the charge waveform.
26. The method of claim 23 further comprising: 
 obtaining the ratio at a point of the harmonic of the voltage component of the charge waveform; and 
 determining an imaginary component of the impedance based on a time difference between the point of the harmonic of the voltage component and a related point of the current component.

Title: Impedance compensation method and device for automobile grounding wire harness
Inventor:
ZHU HAN
ZHANG KAI
GAO ZHANGSHENG
HAN HONGJI
JIA JIA
FU YINGDA
LIN YANPING
LIU XINYU
Abstract: The invention discloses an impedance compensation method and device for an automobile grounding wire harness. The grounding wire harness is electrically connected between the vehicle grounding plane and the output end of an electronic device. The method comprises the following steps: when a control signal is provided for the electronic device, acquiring the frequency of the control signal, the wire harness parameter of a grounding wire harness, the circuit measurement impedance from a vehicle-mounted power supply end to a vehicle grounding plane and the maximum theoretical output voltage of the electronic device; determining the wiring harness theoretical impedance of the grounding wiring harness according to the frequency of the control signal and the wiring harness parameters; determining the value range of the wire harness target impedance of the grounding wire harness according to the power supply voltage of the vehicle-mounted power supply, the maximum theoretical output voltage and the circuit measurement impedance; and according to the frequency of the control signal, the value range of the target impedance of the wiring harness, the wiring harness parameters and the theoretical impedance of the wiring harness, determining the compensation capacitance and the compensation inductance of the grounding wiring harness, so that impedance compensation of the grounding wiring harness is achieved. Therefore, the level of the electronic device is output stably, and control failure of the electronic device due to unstable level is avoided.

Title: Battery impedance life estimation method and system
Inventor:
HUANG WEIPING
ZHANG JIUCAI
WANG JUN
SHANG JIN
GUO SICHAO
Abstract: The invention provides a battery impedance life estimation method which comprises the following steps that before a battery is put into use, SOC, temperature and internal resistance of battery discharge change are collected to construct a new battery impedance table; after a battery is put into use, SOC, temperature and battery state information of current discharge of the battery are collected to detect the stable state of the internal resistance of the battery, and voltage, current, SOC and temperature of the battery before and after the voltage drop is generated every time are collected after the battery generates the voltage drop every time when the internal resistance is in the stable state; according to the collected voltage, current, SOC and temperature before and after the voltage drop, the direct-current internal resistance, SOC and temperature in each internal resistance stable state are calculated; credibility is calculated, internal resistance is selected from the new battery impedance table according to the credibility to obtain new battery impedance, and current service life battery impedance is obtained according to direct-current internal resistance in an internal resistance stable state; and the discharge impedance life of the battery is calculated according to the two impedances. On-line estimation is realized based on the ACB technology, and the robustness and reliability are good.

Title: Lithium battery online aging diagnosis method based on two-point impedance aging characteristics
Inventor:
CHEN JIAN
LIU HAO
Abstract: The invention discloses a lithium battery online aging diagnosis method based on two-point impedance aging characteristics. The method comprises the following steps: 1, measuring an electrochemical impedance spectrum of a brand-new lithium battery in a specific charging state of charge in each charge-discharge cycle and the total capacity of the lithium battery; 2, calculating two-point impedance aging characteristics corresponding to different frequency combinations of the current lithium battery in each charge-discharge cycle; 3, repeating the steps 1-2 to obtain impedance aging characteristics and total capacity of all two points of each lithium battery in each charge-discharge cycle; 4, selecting the optimal two-point impedance aging characteristics of all the lithium batteries in each charge-discharge cycle and the total capacity of the corresponding lithium batteries to form a training set; 5, obtaining a trained lithium battery aging diagnosis regression model; and 6, during online diagnosis, measuring and calculating the optimal two-point impedance aging characteristics of the lithium battery to be diagnosed, and obtaining the total capacity of the lithium battery to be diagnosed after diagnosis so as to judge the aging state. Accurate lithium battery aging diagnosis is realized, and safer and more reliable operation is facilitated.

Title: Method for determining the state of charge of at least one traction battery of a motor vehicle
Inventor:
MOHRMANN BJRN 
KURZWEIL DENNIS 
OPREE PATRICK 
SCHMIDT CHRISTIAN
Abstract: The invention relates to a method for determining the state of charge of at least one traction battery (6) of a motor vehicle (2), comprising the following steps: (S100) detecting a startup (IB) of the motor vehicle (2), (S600) upon detection of the commissioning (IB) of the motor vehicle (2), generating a high-voltage side measurement signal (hMS) for electrochemical impedance spectroscopy with a bidirectional DC/DC converter (10) of the motor vehicle (2), and (S600) evaluating the electrical output voltage provided by the bidirectional DC/DC converter (10) and the electrical terminal voltage of the traction battery (6) in order to determine the traction battery charge state (T-LZ) of the traction battery (6).
Claims:
1. Method for determining the state of charge of at least one traction battery (6) of a motor vehicle (2), having the steps of: (S100) detecting a startup (IB) of the motor vehicle (2), (S500) upon detection of the commissioning (IB) of the motor vehicle (2), generating a high-voltage side measurement signal (hMS) for electrochemical impedance spectroscopy with a bidirectional DC/DC converter (10) of the motor vehicle (2), and (S600) evaluating the electrical output voltage provided by the bidirectional DC/DC converter (10) and the electrical terminal voltage of the traction battery (6) in order to determine the traction battery charge state (T-LZ) of the traction battery (6).
2. Method according to Claim 1, wherein electrical input and output currents of the bidirectional DC/DC converter (10) and of the traction battery (6) are additionally detected and evaluated in order to determine the traction battery charge state (T-LZ) of the traction battery (6).
3. Method according to Claim 1 or 2, wherein an open-circuit voltage of the traction battery (6) is additionally detected and evaluated in order to determine the traction battery charge state (T-LZ) of the traction battery (6).
4. Method according to Claim 1, 2 or 3, wherein, in a further step (S200) for determining the traction battery charge state (T-LZ) of the traction battery (6), the bidirectional DC/DC converter (10) and the traction battery (6) are galvanically isolated from electrical components of the motor vehicle (2).
5. Method according to one of Claims 1 to 4, wherein in a further step (S300) a low-voltage-side measurement signal (nMS) for electrochemical impedance spectroscopy is generated with the bidirectional DC-DC converter (10) of the motor vehicle (2) and in a further step (S400) the measurement signal (nMS) generated by the bidirectional DC/DC converter (10) and the electrical terminal voltage of the low-voltage battery (14) is evaluated in order to determine the low-voltage battery charge state (N-LZ) of the low-voltage battery (14).
6. Method according to Claim 5, wherein electrical input and output currents of the bidirectional DC/DC converter (10) and of the low-voltage battery (14) are additionally detected and evaluated in order to determine the low-voltage battery charge state (N-LZ) of the low-voltage battery (14).
7. Method according to Claim 5 or 6, wherein an open-circuit voltage of the low-voltage battery (14) is additionally detected and evaluated in order to determine the low-voltage battery charge state (N-LZ) of the low-voltage battery (14).
8. Method according to Claim 5, 6 or 7, wherein, in a further step for determining the low-voltage battery charge state (N-LZ) of the low-voltage battery (14), the bidirectional DC/DC converter (10) and the low-voltage battery (14) are electrically isolated from an electrical load (8) of the motor vehicle (2).
9. A computer program product adapted to perform a method according to any one of claims 1 to 8.
10. Battery management system (4), wherein the battery management system (4) is designed to detect a startup (IB) of the motor vehicle (2), upon detection of the startup (IB) of the motor vehicle (2), to generate a high-voltage side measurement signal (hMS) for electrochemical impedance spectroscopy with a bidirectional DC/DC converter (10) of the motor vehicle (2), and to evaluate the electrical output voltage provided by the bidirectional DC/DC converter (10) and the electrical terminal voltage of the traction battery (6) in order to determine the traction battery charge state (T-LZ) of the traction battery (6).
11. Battery management system (4) according to Claim 10, wherein the battery management system (4) is designed to additionally detect and evaluate electrical input and output currents of the bidirectional DC/DC converter (10) and of the traction battery (6) in order to determine the traction battery charge state (T-LZ) of the traction battery (6).
12. Battery management system (4) according to Claim 10 or 11, wherein the battery management system (4) is additionally designed to detect and evaluate an open-circuit voltage of the traction battery (6) in order to determine the traction battery charge state (T-LZ) of the traction battery (6).
13. Battery management system (4) according to Claim 10, 11 or 12, wherein the battery management system (4) is designed to galvanically isolate the bidirectional DC/DC converter (10) and the traction battery (6) from an electrical component of the motor vehicle (2) in order to determine the traction battery charge state (T-LZ) of the traction battery (6).
14. Battery management system (4) according to one of Claims 10 to 13, wherein battery management system (4), wherein the battery management system (4) is designed to generate a low-voltage-side measurement signal (nMS) for electrochemical impedance spectroscopy with the bidirectional DC/DC converter (10) of the motor vehicle (2), and evaluate the electrical output voltage provided by the bi-directional DC-DC converter (10) and the electrical terminal voltage of the low voltage battery (14) to determine the low voltage battery state of charge (N-LZ) of the low voltage battery (14).
15. Battery management system (4) according to Claim 14, wherein the battery management system (4) is designed to additionally detect and evaluate electrical input and output currents of the bidirectional DC/DC converter (10) and of the low-voltage battery (14) in order to determine the low-voltage battery charge state (N-LZ) of the low-voltage battery (14).
16. Battery management system (4) according to Claim 14 or 15, wherein the battery management system (4) is additionally designed to detect and evaluate an open-circuit voltage of the low-voltage battery (14) in order to determine the low-voltage battery charge state (N-LZ) of the low-voltage battery (14).
17. Battery management system (4) according to Claim 14, 15 or 16, wherein the battery management system (4) is designed to galvanically isolate the bidirectional DC/DC converter (10) and the low-voltage battery (14) from an electrical load (8) of the motor vehicle (2) in order to determine the low-voltage battery charge state (N-LZ) of the low-voltage battery (14).
18. Bidirectional DC-DC converter (10), wherein the bidirectional DC/DC converter (10) is designed to provide a high-voltage side measurement signal (hMS) for electrochemical impedance spectroscopy for determining the state of charge of a traction battery (6) of a motor vehicle (2) and/ or to provide a low-voltage-side measurement signal (nMS) for electrochemical impedance spectroscopy for determining the state of charge of a low-voltage battery (14) of the motor vehicle (2).
19. Motor vehicle (2) having a battery management system (4) according to one of Claims 10 to 17 and a DC/DC converter (10) according to Claim 18.
1. Method for determining the state of charge of at least one traction battery (6) of a motor vehicle (2), having the steps of: (S100) detecting a startup (IB) of the motor vehicle (2), (S500) carrying out a self-test with a state of charge determination with the motor vehicle (2) stopped upon detection of the commissioning (IB) of the motor vehicle (2) by generating a high-voltage side measurement signal (hMS) for electrochemical impedance spectroscopy with a bidirectional DC/DC converter (10) of the motor vehicle (2), and (S600) evaluating the electrical output voltage provided by the bidirectional DC/DC converter (10) and the electrical terminal voltage of the traction battery (6) in order to determine the traction battery charge state (T-LZ) of the traction battery (6), wherein an open-circuit voltage of the traction battery (6) is detected and evaluated in order to determine the traction battery charge state (T-LZ) of the traction battery (6).

Method according to one of Claims 1 to 3, wherein in a further step (S300) a low-voltage-side measurement signal (nMS) for electrochemical impedance spectroscopy is generated with the bidirectional DC-DC converter (10) of the motor vehicle (2) and in a further step (S400) the measurement signal (nMS) generated by the bidirectional DC/DC converter (10) and the electrical terminal voltage of the low-voltage battery (14) is evaluated in order to determine the low-voltage battery charge state (N-LZ) of the low-voltage battery (14).

6. Method according to Claim 4 or 5, wherein an open-circuit voltage of the low-voltage battery (14) is additionally detected and evaluated in order to determine the low-voltage battery charge state (N-LZ) of the low-voltage battery (14).

Method according to Claim 4, 5 or 6, wherein, in a further step for determining the low-voltage battery charge state (N-LZ) of the low-voltage battery (14), the bidirectional DC/DC converter (10) and the low-voltage battery (14) are electrically isolated from an electrical load (8) of the motor vehicle (2).
8. A computer program product adapted to perform a method according to any one of claims 1 to 7.
9. Battery management system (4), wherein the battery management system (4) is designed to detect a startup (IB) of the motor vehicle (2), upon detecting the startup (IB) of the motor vehicle (2), to carry out a self-test with a state of charge determination with the motor vehicle (2) stopped by generating a high-voltage side measurement signal (hMS) for electrochemical impedance spectroscopy with a bidirectional DC/DC converter (10) of the motor vehicle (2), and to evaluate the electrical output voltage provided by the bidirectional DC/DC converter (10) and the electrical terminal voltage of the traction battery (6) in order to determine the traction battery charge state (T-LZ) of the traction battery (6), wherein the battery management system (4) is designed to detect and evaluate an open-circuit voltage of the traction battery (6) in order to determine the traction battery charge state (T-LZ) of the traction battery (6).

Battery management system (4) according to Claim 9, wherein the battery management system (4) is designed to additionally detect and evaluate electrical input and output currents of the bidirectional DC/DC converter (10) and of the traction battery (6) in order to determine the traction battery charge state (T-LZ) of the traction battery (6).

Battery management system (4) according to Claim 9 or 10, wherein the battery management system (4) is designed to galvanically isolate the bidirectional DC/DC converter (10) and the traction battery (6) from an electrical component of the motor vehicle (2) in order to determine the traction battery charge state (T-LZ) of the traction battery (6).

Battery management system (4) according to one of Claims 9 to 11, wherein the battery management system (4) is designed to generate a low-voltage-side measurement signal (nMS) for electrochemical impedance spectroscopy with the bidirectional DC/DC converter (10) of the motor vehicle (2), and to evaluate the electrical output voltage provided by the bidirectional DC-DC converter (10) and the electrical terminal voltage of the low-voltage battery (14) in order to determine the low-voltage battery charge state (N-LZ) of the low-voltage battery (14).
13. Battery management system (4) according to Claim 12, wherein the battery management system (4) is designed to additionally detect and evaluate electrical input and output currents of the bidirectional DC/DC converter (10) and of the low-voltage battery (14) in order to determine the low-voltage battery charge state (N-LZ) of the low-voltage battery (14).
14. Battery management system (4) according to Claim 12 or 13, wherein the battery management system (4) is designed to additionally detect and evaluate an open-circuit voltage of the low-voltage battery (14) in order to determine the low-voltage battery charge state (N-LZ) of the low-voltage battery (14).

Battery management system (4) according to Claim 12, 13 or 14, wherein the battery management system (4) is designed to galvanically isolate the bidirectional DC/DC converter (10) and the low-voltage battery (14) from an electrical load (8) of the motor vehicle (2) in order to determine the low-voltage battery charge state (N-LZ) of the low-voltage battery (14).

Motor vehicle (2) having a battery management system (4) according to one of Claims 9 to 15 and a DC/DC converter (10), wherein the bidirectional DC/DC converter (10) is designed, to provide a high-voltage side measurement signal (hMS) for electrochemical impedance spectroscopy for determining the state of charge of a traction battery (6) of a motor vehicle (2) and/or to provide a low-voltage-side measurement signal (nMS) for electrochemical impedance spectroscopy for determining the state of charge of a low-voltage battery (14) of the motor vehicle (2).

Title: Energy storage battery impedance identification method and system based on driving inverter and application
Inventor:
JIANG DONG
QU HONGYAN
XIE YUANHAO
ZHOU MIN
Abstract: The invention discloses an energy storage battery impedance identification method and system based on a driving inverter and an application, and belongs to the field of energy storage batteries. The working scene of an energy storage battery based on the driving inverter is considered, and the switching frequency of the driving inverter is updated according to a target frequency value fi; then, current signals of a branch where the energy storage battery is located and current signals of a branch where the shunt capacitor is located are collected in real time and subjected to Fourier transform, after current components of the two current signals under the target frequency value fi are obtained, and the impedance of the energy storage battery under the target frequency value fi is obtained through calculation based on the parallel shunt principle; and calculation is simple, whether the energy storage battery is in an off-line state or not is not limited, and the impedance of the energy storage battery under a relatively high frequency can be directly, quickly and accurately identified on line. Moreover, the method is based on the power supply topology of the energy storage battery connected with the driving inverter, almost no hardware needs to be added, and the battery impedance at a high frequency can be accurately identified in real time at a lower cost.
