A battery management system, comprising: a case forming a body; a battery module disposed in the case and including a plurality of batteries connected in at least one of series and parallel connection; and a battery management module managing states of the plurality of batteries by adjusting impedances of the plurality of batteries, Wherein some of the plurality of batteries have different characteristics and performance equal to or less than a normal reference value of a battery, and wherein the battery management module comprises: a monitoring unit configured to monitor a state of the battery module through each sensor and obtain state information of the battery module according to a monitoring result; And an impedance adjusting unit configured to receive impedance information of each battery from the state information of the battery module from the monitoring unit and adjust impedance of each battery based on the received impedance information of each battery, Compare the impedance information of each of the batteries with the predetermined impedance reference information, and adjust the impedance of each of the batteries by matching the impedance so that the impedance value of each of the batteries falls within a predetermined impedance reference value range according to a comparison result.

Title: Insulation detection circuit and method
Inventor:
DU BAOHAI 
WU GUOXIU 
LI WEIQIANG 
LI QIANDENG
Abstract: The present disclosure provides an insulation detection circuit, a detection method and a battery management system. The insulation detection circuit includes an isolated power module (Y1), a first positive sampling module (F11), a first negative sampling module (F12), a second positive sampling module (F21), a second negative sampling module (F22), and a processor (C1), wherein: a first end of the second positive sampling module (F21) is respectively connected to a positive electrode of the isolated power module (Y1) and a second end of the positive switch module (K+), a second end of the second positive sampling module (F21) is connected to a second reference voltage terminal (GND2); a first end of the second negative sampling module (F22) is connected to the second reference voltage terminal (GND2), a second end of the second negative sampling module (F22) is respectively connected to a negative electrode of the isolated power module (Y1) and a second end of the negative switch module (K-); and the processor (C1) is respectively connected to the first sampling point (S11), the second sampling point (S12), the third sampling point (S21), and the fourth sampling point (S22).

Title: Impedance measurement device
Inventor: NEEL CHRISTIAN
Abstract: The present invention relates to an electronic impedance measurement device (300) comprising: - a branch (102), called measurement branch, having an impedance to be measured (Zm); and - at least one branch (104), called reference branch, having an impedance (Zr), called reference impedance; characterized in that it furthermore comprises: - electronics (106), called detection electronics, configured so as to supply an error signal (Vs) depending on an algebraic sum of a current (Ir) flowing in the at least one reference branch (104) and of a current (Im) flowing in the measurement branch (102); and - at least one means (402;602,604), called adjustment means, modifying the current (Ir) in at least one of said reference branches in a manner inversely proportional to a control variable (k).

Title: Battery management device, method and chip
Inventor:
LI JIANFENG 
LI HAI
Abstract: The disclosure provides a battery management device, method, and a chip. The device includes: an analogue-digital conversion module connected with a first power supply access terminal, a second power supply access terminal and an impedance measuring module: wherein the analogue-digital conversion module is configured to achieve analog-digital conversion between an accessed power supply and the impedance measuring module; the accessed power supply is, when the battery management device works, a power supply to which the first power supply access terminal and the second power supply terminal are accessed; the impedance measuring module is further connected with a comparator module and a driving module; the impedance measuring module is configured to test an impedance of the accessed power supply; the comparator module is configured to compensate delay generated by the driving module and an excitation signal generating module; and the driving module is configured to drive the battery management device to work; and the excitation signal generating module is connected with the comparator module, the driving module, the first power supply access terminal and the second power supply access terminal. According to embodiments of the disclosure, performance indexes of a power supply to be measured can be accurately measured in an accurate impedance testing mode.
Claims:
1. A battery management device, comprising: an analog-digital conversion module, an impedance measuring module, a comparator module, a driving module, an excitation signal generating module, a first power supply access terminal and a second power supply access terminal, wherein: 
 the analogue-digital conversion module is connected with the first power supply access terminal, the second power supply access terminal and the impedance measuring module; the analogue-digital conversion module is configured to achieve analog-digital conversion between an accessed power supply and the impedance measuring module; and the accessed power supply is: when the battery management device works, a power supply to which the first power supply access terminal and the second power supply terminal are accessed; 
 the impedance measuring module is further connected with the comparator module and the driving module; the impedance measuring module is configured to test an impedance of the accessed power supply; the comparator module is configured to compensate a delay generated by the driving module and the excitation signal generating module; and the driving module is configured to drive the battery management device to work; and 
 the excitation signal generating module is connected with the comparator module, the driving module, the first power supply access terminal and the second power supply access terminal, and the excitation signal generating module is configured to generate an excitation signal.
2. The battery management device according to claim 1, wherein the excitation signal generating module comprises a field effect unit and a resistor;
 a gate terminal of the field effect unit is connected with the driving module;
 a drain terminal of the field effect unit is connected with the comparator module and one terminal of the resistor;
 a source terminal of the field effect unit is connected with the second power supply access terminal; and
 the other terminal of the resistor is connected with the first power supply access terminal.
3. The battery management device according to claim 2, wherein a parasitic parameter capacitance value of the field effect unit satisfies a first preset condition.
4. The battery management device according to claim 2, wherein a drain source resistance of the field effect unit satisfies a second preset condition, and the drain source resistance is a resistance between the source terminal and the drain terminal of the field effect unit.
5. The battery management device according to claim 2, wherein a driving power of the driving module satisfies a third preset condition.
6. The battery management device according to claim 1, wherein the comparator module comprises a register unit, and the accessed power supply comprises a preset direct current power supply, and a power supply to be measured;
 the impedance measuring module is further configured to calculate a delay value when the first power supply access terminal and the second power supply access terminal are accessed to the preset direct current power supply;
 the register unit is configured to set a register value to be the delay value; and
 the impedance measuring module is further configured to calculate an impedance value of the power supply to be measured when the first power supply access terminal and the second power supply access terminal are accessed to the power supply to be measured.
7. The battery management device according to any one of claims 1-6, wherein the battery management device is applied to an automobile battery management system.
8. A battery management method, wherein, the method is applied to the battery management device according to any one of claims 1 to 7, the method comprising: 
 calculating a delay value when the first power supply access terminal and the second power supply access terminal are accessed to a preset direct current power supply; 
 setting a register value of a register unit to be the delay value; and 
 calculating an impedance value of a power supply to be measured when the first power supply access terminal and the second power supply access terminal are accessed to the power supply to be measured.
9. The battery management method according to claim 8, further comprising:
 managing the power supply to be measured according to the impedance value of the power supply to be measured.
10. A battery management chip, wherein, comprising at least one battery management device according to any one of claims 1 to 5, wherein at least one of the battery management devices is connected in cascade; and each of the battery management device correspondingly manages a power supply to be measured.

Title: Predictive model for estimating battery states
Inventor: HOLME TIM
Abstract: A battery management system (BMS) for a vehicle includes a module for estimating the state of a rechargeable battery, such as its state of charge, in real time. The module includes a learning model for predicting the state of a battery based on the vehicle's usage and related factors unique to the vehicle, in addition to a sensed voltage, current and temperature of a battery.
Claims:
What is claimed is:
1. A management system for electrochemical batteries, comprising 
 at least one series string of battery cells; 
 one or more sensors configured to provide sensor data obtained from the series string of battery cells, the sensor data comprising at least one of a measured voltage, current, impedance, pressure, or temperature; and 
 a prediction module for a battery type, coupled to the one or more sensors, the prediction module comprising: 
  a battery model that includes a plurality of input parameters and at least one target, wherein the plurality of input parameters include at least one of a voltage, current, impedance, pressure, and temperature input parameter, and the target is at least one battery state, 
  a learning component that trains the battery model using training sets comprising values for the input parameters and targets, the learning component providing a trained battery model, and 
  a prediction component that uses the trained battery model and a new set of values for the input parameters to predict a battery state; 
 wherein the predicted battery state is at least one of a 
  (a) state-of-charge (SOC), 
  (b) state-of-health (SOH), 
  (c) voltage response to current demand, 
  (d) power available, 
  (e) energy available, 
  (f) energy available with respect to a planned route, 
  (g) presence of a safety condition, 
  (h) presence of a repair condition, 
  (i) battery life, 
  (j) battery temperature, 
  (k) battery voltage, 
  (l) battery impedance, and 
  (m) battery cell pressure.
2. The management system of claim 1, wherein the sensor data is obtained from one or more of, or a combination of, a measured voltage, current, impedance, pressure, or temperature of one or more of 
 (a) a battery cell, 
 (b) a stack of battery cells, 
 (c) a pouch comprising battery cells, 
 (d) a can comprising battery cells, 
 (e) a module comprising cans, and 
 (f) a battery pack.
3. The management system of claim 1, wherein the battery model includes additional input parameters, the additional input parameters comprising one or more of 
 (a) the age of the battery, 
 (b) a last battery, or power train servicing date, 
 (c) a vehicle identification number (VIN), or make and model, 
 (d) a driving pattern, 
 (e) a geographic location or predicted weather forecast, 
 (f) an age of a registered driver, 
 (g) number of discharge cycles, or average percentage of battery discharges between charges using an external power source, 
 (h) number of warning conditions issued on the battery, 
 (i) manufacturer inputs selected from rated capacity, voltage window, and thermal characteristics; 
 wherein the prediction model is trained on both the one or more sensor data and the additional parameters.
4. The management system of claim 1, the one or more sensors comprising 
 one or more sensors configured to measure pressure of the series string of battery cells, a module of batteries, and/or individual battery cells, 
 a sensor configured to measure voltage of the series string of battery cells, 
 a sensor configured to measure total charge passed through the series string of battery cells, and/or 
 temperature sensors configured to measure ambient temperature and battery series temperature in at least one location.
5. The management system of claim 4, wherein the sensor configured to measure voltage of the series string of battery cells, the sensor configured to measure total charge passed through the series string of battery cells, and/or the temperature sensors configured to measure ambient temperature and battery series temperature in at least one location is a single sensor.
6. The management system of claim 4, wherein the sensor configured to measure voltage of the series string of battery cells, and/or the temperature sensors configured to measure ambient temperature and battery series temperature in at least one location is a single sensor.
7. The management system of claim 5, wherein the single sensor is integrated into a bus bar.
8. The management system according to claim 1, wherein 
 the at least one series string of battery cells and the one or more sensors are located on a vehicle, 
 the vehicle further comprising a processor capable of being coupled to a server accessible over one or more networks, and 
 the prediction module is accessible to the processor through the server.
9. A vehicle comprising the management system according to claim 1.
10. The vehicle of claim 9, wherein the vehicle further comprises: 
 a processor; and 
 a computer readable, non-transitory medium comprising the prediction module stored as computer readable code configured for being executed by the processor; 
 wherein the prediction module is coupled to the sensors through the processor.
11. The vehicle of claim 10, further including a Battery Management System (BMS), the BMS comprising: 
 the processor, 
 the computer readable, non-transitory medium, and 
 the one or more sensors.
12. The vehicle of claim 8, wherein the vehicle further comprises 
 an electronic control unit (ECU); 
 a vehicle information storage unit accessible by the ECU and providing vehicle data comprising one or more of 
  (a) a last battery, or power train servicing date, 
  (b) a vehicle identification number (VIN), or make and model, 
  (c) a driving pattern based on, e.g., samples of real-time battery discharge and regenerative charging data corresponding to a vehicle powertrain delivered torques and braking sequences, 
  (d) a geographic location(s) of vehicle use, and 
  (e) the vehicle data listed in TABLE 4; 
 wherein the battery model input parameters include the at least one of a voltage, current, impedance, pressure, and temperature input parameter, and at least one of the vehicle data input parameter.
13. The vehicle of claim 12, wherein the vehicle information storage unit is a telematics device.
14. A method, comprising: 
 using a vehicle; 
 using a battery model having input parameters including at least one of a voltage, current, impedance, pressure, or temperature input parameter for a battery type, and at least one target for the battery type; 
 using at least one or more sensors located on the vehicle, obtaining data on at least one physical state of at least one series string of battery cells of the vehicle, wherein the data obtained comprises at least one of a measured voltage, current, impedance, pressure, or temperature of the at least one series string of battery cells; 
 making a trained battery model, including training the battery model using training sets comprising values for each one of the input parameters and a corresponding value for the at least one target using at least the obtained data; 
 wherein the obtaining data step occurs while the series string of battery cells is 
  (a) in an open circuit condition, 
  (b) under an operating load, 
  (b) during a charging event, 
  (c) during a diagnostic event, 
  (d) during a repair event, or 
  (e) during a safety event.
15. The method of claim 14, further comprising: 
 receiving new training sets for the battery type over a network; and 
 re-training the battery model on the new training sets.
16. The method of claim 14, wherein the vehicle has a processor and a non-transitory memory medium, the battery model residing in the non-transitory memory medium, the method further including 
 using the vehicle processor to predict a battery state using the trained battery model and a new training set, and 
 producing an output based on the predicted battery state.
17. The method of claim 16, wherein the output is displayed on a user interface (UI) such as a vehicle user interface (VUI) or a mobile device.
18. The method of claim 17, wherein the UI displays one or more of the following information in the output, 
 (a) repair battery when the predicted battery state predicts the SOH is below 50%, 
 (b) warning message when the predicted battery state predicts an unsafe battery condition, 
 (c) warning message when the predicted battery state predicts energy available is insufficient for predicted event, such as trip entered into navigation system, and 
 (d) warning message when the predicted battery state predicts power available insufficient for a predicted event, such as hill climb or acceleration needed to enter high-speed highway.
19. The method of claim 16, wherein the output is sent to a vehicle control system, and wherein the vehicle control system performs one or more of the following tasks based on the predicted state of the battery: 
 when SOC is about 80%, battery is allowed to discharge at maximum operating power rate, 
 limit the power availability when the SOC is below 20% or below 15% or below 10%, 
 notify driver when the predicted power availability is below 6 kW or 5 kW or 4 kW or 3 kW or 2 kW or 1 kW, and 
 limit power to auxiliary systems when the predicted power availability is below 6 kW or 5 kW or 4 kW or 3 kW or 2 kW or 1 kW.
20. The method of claim 14, wherein the vehicle has a processor configured for being coupled to a server located over one or more networks and the battery model is accessible through the server, the method further comprising: 
 uploading to the server the obtained data, and 
 receiving the trained battery model from the server.
21. The method of claim 14, wherein the prediction module is configured to retrain the battery model on a continuous basis, optionally second-by-second, as the sensor data provides the prediction module with time varying values for the at least one of a measured voltage, current, impedance, pressure, or temperature.

Title: Battery impedance measurement apparatus, method and chip
Inventor:
ZHENG PENGFEI
LI JIANFENG
Abstract: The embodiments of the invention provide a battery impedance measurement apparatus, method and chip. The apparatus includes: one end of an excitation signal generation unit is connected to a first power connection end, and the other end of the excitation signal generation unit is connected to a second power connection end; one end of a response channel is connected to the first power connection end, and the other end of the response channel is connected to a response analysis unit; the other end of the response analysis unit is connected to an impedance measurement and calculation unit; one end of a phase compensation unit is connected to the other end of the excitation signal generation unit, and the other end of the phase compensation unit is connected to the impedance measurement and calculation unit; a control module is connected to a measurement module; and when the first power connection end and the second power connection end are connected to a power supply, the measurement module is controlled to perform impedance measurement. In the battery impedance measurement apparatus, method and chip provided by the embodiments of the invention, when an electrochemical impedance spectroscopy of a battery is measured and calculated, the phase compensation unit can compensate a delay phase, and the compensated delay phase does not cause a measurement deviation to the measurement ofthe battery, so that the accuracy of the electrochemical impedance spectroscopy of the battery is improved.

Title: Ground fault detection of ups battery
Inventor:
AGGELER DANIEL 
PAATERO ESA-KAI 
FURLAN IVAN 
NOTARI NICOLA 
MARET YANNICK
Abstract: The present invention provides a method for detecting a ground fault (60) in a battery (22) of a uninterrupted power supply (10, 40), the battery (22) comprises at least one string (26) with multiple battery cells, the method comprising the steps of defining multiple individual battery blocks (28) of battery cells along the at least one string (26), performing an reference impedance measurement for the multiple individual battery blocks (28) at a first point of time, performing a verification impedance measurement for the multiple individual battery blocks (28) at a second point of time, evaluating a change of measured impedance between the reference impedance and the verification impedance for the multiple individual battery blocks (28) of the at least one string (26), and identifying a ground fault (60) based on a correlated change of measured impedance of the multiple individual battery blocks (28) along the at least one string (26). The present invention also provides a battery management system (36) for managing a battery (22) of a uninterrupted power supply (10, 40), which is adapted to perform the above method. The present invention further provides a UPS device (10) and a UPS system (40), each of which comprising an above battery management system (36).

Title: Electrical architecture for electrochemical impedance spectroscopy
Assignee:
GOVERNING COUNCIL OF THE UNIVERSITY OF TORONTO 
ELEAPPOWER
Inventor:
GONG ZHE 
TRESCASES OLIVIER
Abstract: The present disclosure provides electrical architecture for electrochemical impedance spectroscopy (EIS). An EIS circuit comprises at least two current regulators and an electrical energy storage device, which are connected with one or more electrochemical cells in a configuration that decouples power flowing into the respective current regulators. The presence of the electrical energy storage device enables each regulator to operate simultaneously at lower power levels while inducing the desired EIS perturbation current. Operation at low power allows lower volume and cost for the same current compared to only dissipative or non-dissipative current regulators. Further, the electrical energy storage device allows the power flowing through the current regulators to be varied independently in order to achieve the desired EIS perturbation current while a minimum amount of heat is generated in the circuit, thus allowing the circuit to occupy minimal size and incur minimal cost.

Title: Battery status of health judgment method and device
Assignee: TIANJIN RISESUN MGL NEW ENERGY TECHNOLOGY
Inventor:
WU NINGNING
WEN BIN
LIU JIANHONG
LIU YULONG
Abstract: The invention discloses a battery status of health judgment method and device. The method includes the following steps that: the electrochemical impedance of a new battery at one or a plurality of characteristic frequency points and characteristic frequency sites are acquired, wherein the characteristic frequency points can reflect the internal state of the battery; an old battery is excited according to characteristic frequencies corresponding to the characteristic frequency points of the new battery, so that the current electrochemical impedance of the old battery can be determined; and theelectrochemical imaginary part impedance of the new battery and the old battery at the characteristic frequency sites are compared with each other, so that the aging degree of the old battery can be judged. According to the prior art, the aging condition of an electrochemical reaction inside a battery can be hardly embodied, and the aging conditions of the external characteristics of the battery are just embodied, with the method and device of the invention adopted, high test difficulty, high cost, short service lives and other defects in the prior art can be eliminated. The battery status ofhealth judgment method and device have the advantages of low test difficulty, low cost and long service life.

Title: Test system of direct current charging pile
Inventor:
LIU MINGZHONG
JIAO YONGJIE
YAO WENBIN
Abstract: The invention discloses a test system of a direct current charging pile. The direct current charging pile is tested by arranging a power-on safety inspection unit, an insulation test unit, a vehicle BMS simulation unit and a circuit impedance test unit. A main control unit is arranged and separately connected with the power-on safety inspection unit, the insulation test unit, the vehicle BMS simulation unit and the circuit impedance test unit to control the work of the power-on safety inspection unit, the insulation test unit, the vehicle BMS simulation unit and the circuit impedance test unit, and the automatic test of the direct current charging pile is realized. The test system of the direct current charging pile solves the technical problem that manual test leads to low test efficiencyof the charging pile and high price of special test equipment in the prior art, effectively improves the test efficiency of the direct current charging piles, and reduces the test cost.
Claims:
1. The direct current charging pile testing system is characterized by comprising a main control unit, a power-on safety inspection unit, an insulation testing unit, a vehicle BMS simulation unit and a loop impedance testing unit, wherein the direct current charging pile is respectively connected with the power-on safety inspection unit, the insulation testing unit, the vehicle BMS simulation unit and the loop impedance testing unit, and the main control unit is respectively connected with the power-on safety inspection unit, the insulation testing unit, the vehicle BMS simulation unit and the loop impedance testing unit so as to control the work of the power-on safety inspection unit, the insulation testing unit, the vehicle BMS simulation unit and the loop impedance testing unit.
2. The system for testing the direct-current charging pile according to claim 1, wherein the power-on safety inspection unit comprises a first direct-current power supply and a short-circuit detection unit connected with an alternating-current power supply input end of the direct-current charging pile, and the alternating-current power supply input end comprises an A-phase input end, a B-phase input end and a C-phase input end; the short circuit detection unit comprises a first short circuit detection module connected with the phase A input end, a second short circuit detection module connected with the phase B input end and a third short circuit detection module connected with the phase C input end;
 the first short-circuit detection module comprises a first relay, a first isolation optocoupler and a first pull-up resistor, wherein the output end of the first direct-current power supply is connected with a first movable contact of the first relay, a second movable contact of the first relay is connected with an input end of an A phase, the input end of the A phase is connected with an input positive end of the first isolation optocoupler, an output positive end of the first isolation optocoupler is connected with one end of the first pull-up resistor, one end of the first pull-up resistor is connected with the input end of the main control unit, the other end of the first pull-up resistor is connected with the power supply, and the input negative end and the output negative end of the first isolation optocoupler are grounded; the output end of the main control unit is connected with the control end of the first relay to control the on-off of the first relay;
 the second short circuit detection module comprises a second relay, a second isolation optocoupler and a second pull-up resistor, the third short circuit detection module comprises a third relay, a third isolation optocoupler and a third pull-up resistor, the connection structure of the first short circuit detection module, the A-phase input end, the first direct-current power supply and the main control unit is the same as the connection structure of the second short circuit detection module, the B-phase input end, the first direct-current power supply and the main control unit, the connection structure of the third short circuit detection module, the C-phase input end, the first direct-current power supply and the main control unit, and the main control unit is used for detecting one end of the first pull-up resistor, one end of the second pull-up resistor and level signals of one end of the third pull-up resistor.

The system of claim 2, wherein the ac power input terminal further includes an N-phase input terminal, the short circuit detection unit further includes a fourth short circuit detection module connected to the N-phase input terminal, the fourth short circuit detection module includes a fourth relay, a fourth isolation optocoupler and a fourth pull-up resistor, and a connection structure of the first short circuit detection module and the a-phase input terminal, the first dc power supply, and the main control unit is the same as a connection structure of the fourth short circuit detection module and the N-phase input terminal, the first dc power supply, and the main control unit.

Title: Battery impedance evaluation device and battery impedance evaluation method
Inventor: HIRANO, Takayuki
Abstract:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide a battery impedance evaluation device for highly accurately identifying electrochemical impedance of a battery to be measured.
SOLUTION: A battery impedance evaluation device 10 includes: a storage section 13 for holding impedance data Zm(?); an input section 11 for acquiring time domain current data I(t) and time domain voltage data V(t); a frequency domain conversion section 12 for converting the time domain current data I(t) into frequency domain current data I(?) by Fourier transform; a voltage data calculation section 15 for calculating frequency domain voltage data Vm(?) from the frequency domain current data I(?) and the impedance data Zm(?); a time domain conversion section 16 for converting the frequency domain voltage data Vm(?) into time domain voltage data Vm(t) by inverse Fourier transform; a difference calculation section 17 for calculating a difference ? between the time domain voltage data Vm(t) and the time domain voltage data V(t); and a search section 18 for searching the impedance data which decreases the difference ?.
SELECTED DRAWING: Figure 1
COPYRIGHT: (C)2020,JPO&INPIT
Claims:
1. A battery impedance evaluation device that evaluates an electrochemical impedance of a battery to be measured, the device comprising: a storage unit that holds impedance data for at least one battery, the impedance data indicating an electrochemical impedance expressed in a frequency domain; a calculation unit that calculates the electrochemical impedance of the battery to be measured, An input unit configured to acquire time-domain current data and time-domain voltage data, which are time series data of current and voltage; and a processor configured to perform Fourier transform on the time-domain current data acquired by the input unit, A frequency-domain converter configured to convert the current data into frequency-domain current data, which is current data expressed in a frequency domain; and A voltage data calculation unit that calculates frequency-domain voltage data, which is voltage data expressed in the frequency domain, by calculating the impedance data stored in the storage unit; and A time domain conversion unit that converts the frequency-domain voltage data calculated by the voltage data calculation unit into time domain voltage data, which is voltage data expressed in the time domain, by inverse Fourier transform; and A difference calculating unit that calculates a difference between the time domain voltage data converted by the time domain converting unit and the time domain voltage data acquired by the input unit; and a searching unit that searches for impedance data that reduces the difference calculated by the difference calculating unit and outputs the searched impedance data.
2. The impedance data stored in the storage unit is an equivalent circuit model constituted by circuit elements, and the search unit changes constants of the circuit elements constituting the equivalent circuit model so as to reduce the difference; and The device according to claim 1, wherein the modified equivalent circuit model is output as the searched impedance data.
3. The device according to claim 2, wherein the equivalent circuit model includes CPE (Constant Phase Element) as a circuit element.
4. The device according to claim 2 or 3, wherein the equivalent circuit model includes a Warburg impedance as a circuit element, the Warburg impedance including an arbitrary parameter Phi.
5. The impedance data for a plurality of types of batteries is stored in the storage unit, and the search unit is configured to, for each of at least two pieces of the plurality of pieces of impedance data stored in the storage unit, The device according to claim 1, wherein processing is performed by the voltage data calculating unit, the time domain converting unit, and the difference calculating unit to search for impedance data having the smallest difference calculated by the difference calculating unit.
6. The device according to claim 5, wherein the plurality of impedance data stored in the storage unit includes alternating current impedance data, which is electrochemical impedance expressed in the frequency domain, obtained by actual measurement.
7. The searching unit selects, from among the plurality of impedance data held in the storage unit, impedance data of a battery closest to the battery to be measured as an initial value for battery operating conditions that include at least one of a state of charge, a number of charge-discharge cycles, a battery temperature, an environmental temperature, and a battery capacity; and The device according to claim 6, wherein the selected impedance data is processed by the voltage data calculating unit, the time domain converting unit, and the difference calculating unit to search for impedance data having the smallest difference calculated by the difference calculating unit.
8. The battery impedance evaluation device according to any one of claims 1 to 7, wherein the input unit acquires, as the time domain current data, time series data of current obtained when a current application pattern is changed in this order from a state in which current application is paused, a state in which current application is paused, and a state in which current application is paused to the battery to be measured.
9. The battery impedance evaluation device according to any one of claims 1 to 8, wherein the difference calculating unit calculates, as the difference, a ratio between an amount of change in the time domain voltage data converted by the time domain converting unit in a predetermined time and an amount of change in the time domain voltage data acquired by the input unit in the predetermined time.
10. A battery impedance evaluation method for evaluating electrochemical impedance of a battery to be measured, the method comprising: An input step of acquiring time domain current data and time domain voltage data which are time series data of current and voltage; and a Fourier transform of the time domain current data acquired in the input step by using the Fourier transform to convert the time domain current data by Converting into frequency-domain current data, which is current data expressed in the frequency domain; and calculating the frequency-domain current data converted in the frequency-domain conversion and impedance data held in a storage unit, the impedance data indicating electrochemical impedance expressed in the frequency domain for at least one battery; A voltage data calculating step of calculating frequency-domain voltage data, which is voltage data expressed in a frequency domain; a time-domain converting step of converting the frequency-domain voltage data calculated in the calculating step into time-domain voltage data, which is voltage data expressed in a time domain, by an inverse Fourier transform; and A difference calculating step of calculating a difference between the time domain voltage data converted in the time domain converting step and the time domain voltage data acquired in the input step; and A searching step of searching for impedance data that minimizes the difference calculated in the calculating step and outputting the searched impedance data.
11. A program that causes a computer to execute the battery impedance evaluation method according to claim 10.

Title: Detect equipment, driving system and car of insulating nature of power battery package
Inventor: SUN PINGCHAO
Abstract: The utility model discloses a detect equipment, driving system and car of insulating nature of power battery package, this equipment includes: first switch, second switch and insulation detection circuit, wherein, insulation detection circuit's output is connected to the first end of first switch, and the power battery package is connected to the second end of first switch, insulation detection circuit's output is connected to the first end of second switch, and high voltage component is connected to the second end of second switch. Insulation detection circuit through the off state that openswho controls first switch and second switch, realizes carrying out solitary detection to the insulating nature outside insulating nature in the power battery package and the power battery package. And then, utilize the electric automobile of the insulating nature equipment of this detection power battery package, the trouble that detects the power battery package that can be comprehensive, it issafer to make this electric automobile use, promotes user experience.

Title: Battery measurement method
Inventor:
BU FANG
LIN JINFANG
LAI CAITING
YUAN ZHONGZHI
ZHU YUAN
LIU JINCHENG
Abstract: The invention provides a battery measurement method. The battery measurement method includes the steps that electrochemical impedance full-frequency scanning is conducted on a to-be-measured battery to obtain an electrochemical impedance spectrum of the to-be-measured battery; according to the electrochemical impedance spectrum, a first characteristic impedance of a high-frequency area, a second characteristic impedance of a median-frequency area and a third characteristic impedance of a low-frequency area are obtained; when the first characteristic impedance is located at a first impedance preset range of the high-frequency area, the second characteristic impedance is located at a second impedance preset range of the median-frequency area, and the third characteristic impedance is locatedat a third impedance preset range of the low-frequency area, the to-be-measured battery is determined as a qualified battery. According to the technical scheme, the problem is solved in the prior artthat only batteries with single performance is screened and batteries with poor perforamce and hidden dangers can not be fully screened, and the purpose of fully identifying the batteries with poor performance and hidden dangers is realized.

Title: Equipment for detecting insulating property of power battery pack, power system and automobile
Inventor: SUN PINGCHAO
Abstract: The invention discloses equipment for detecting insulating property of a power battery pack, a power system and an automobile. The equipment comprises a first switch, a second switch and an insulatingdetection circuit, wherein a first end of the first switch is connected with an output end of an insulating detection circuit; a second end of the first switch is connected with the power battery pack; a first end of the second switch is connected with the output end of an insulating detection circuit; and a second end of the second switch is connected with a high-voltage component. According tothe insulating detection circuit, by controlling on-off states of the first switch and the second switch, the insulating property in the power battery pack and the insulating property outside the power battery pack can be independently detected. Furthermore, by utilizing an electric automobile with the equipment for detecting the insulating property of the power battery pack, failure of the powerbattery pack can be comprehensively detected, so that the electric automobile is safe to use, and user experience is improved.

Title: Electronic device, battery module and charging and discharging method
Inventor:
LIANG SHIH-HAO 
LING SHOU-HUNG 
CHIUEH TZI-CKER
Abstract: A battery module includes a crystal lattice type battery, a detection circuit, a control circuit and an excitation circuit. The detection circuit is electrically coupled to the battery. The control circuit is electrically coupled to the detection circuit. The excitation circuit is electrically coupled to the control circuit and the battery. When the battery is charged or discharged, the detection circuit is configured to detect an impedance of the battery. The control circuit is configured to compare the impedance and a threshold. And the control circuit is configured to produce a control signal. The excitation circuit is configured to selectively provide an excitation signal to the battery according to the control signal.
Claims:
1. A battery module (10), characterized in, comprising: 
 a crystal lattice type battery (101); 
 a detection circuit (103) electrically coupled to the crystal lattice type battery (101) and configured to detect an impedance of the crystal lattice type battery (101) when the crystal lattice type battery (101) is charged or discharged; 
 a control circuit (105) electrically coupled to the detection circuit (103) and configured to compare the impedance to a threshold and generate a control signal; and 
 an excitation circuit (107) electrically coupled to the control circuit (105) and the crystal lattice type battery (101) and configured to provide an excitation signal to the crystal lattice type battery (101) according to the control signal.
2. The battery module (10) according to claim 1, wherein the excitation signal have an excitation frequency substantially equal to a natural frequency of the battery, and the excitation frequency is less than or equal to 500 kilohertz (kHz) and greater than or equal to 300 kilohertz (kHz).
3. The battery module (10) according to claim 2, wherein the excitation frequency is less than or equal to 410 kilohertz (kHz) and greater than or equal to 350 kilohertz (kHz).
4. The battery module (10) according to claim 1, wherein the excitation circuit (107) has a switch unit (SW) and a load (rosc), the switch unit (SW) is connected to the load (rosc) in series, the switch unit (SW) and the load (rosc) connected in series are connected to the crystal lattice type battery (101) in parallel, and the switch unit (SW) is configured to be turned on and off repeatedly based on an excitation frequency according to the control signal.
5. The battery module (10) according to claim 1, wherein the excitation circuit (107) has an inductor and a switch unit (SW), the switch unit (SW) is selectively turned on according to the control signal, and the inductor is electrically coupled to the crystal lattice type battery (101) when the switch unit (SW) is turned on.
6. The battery module (10) according to claim 1, wherein the threshold is 1.1 times a minimum value of the impedance.
7. A electronic device (40) adapted to provide power via a crystal lattice type battery (301), characterized in, comprising: 
 a control circuit (401) configured to compare an impedance of the crystal lattice type battery (301) to a threshold and generate a control signal; and 
 an excitation circuit (403) electrically coupled to the control circuit (401) and the crystal lattice type battery (301) and configured to provide an excitation signal to the crystal lattice type battery (301) according to the control signal.
8. The electronic device (40) according to claim 7, wherein the excitation signal have an excitation frequency substantially equal to a natural frequency of the battery, and the excitation frequency is less than or equal to 500 kilohertz (kHz) and greater than or equal to 300 kilohertz (kHz).
9. The electronic device (40) according to claim 8, wherein the excitation frequency is less than or equal to 410 kilohertz (kHz) and greater than or equal to 350 kilohertz (kHz).
10. The electronic device (40) according to claim 7, wherein the excitation circuit (403) has a switch unit (SW) and a load (rosc), the switch unit (SW) is connected to the load (rosc) in series, the switch unit (SW) and the load (rosc) connected in series are connected to the crystal lattice type battery (301) in parallel, and the switch unit (SW) is configured to be turned on and off repeatedly based on an excitation frequency according to the control signal.
11. The electronic device (40) according to claim 7, wherein the excitation circuit (403) has an inductor and a switch unit (SW), the switch unit (SW) is selectively turned on according to the control signal, and the inductor is electrically coupled to the crystal lattice type battery (301) when the switch unit (SW) is turned on.
12. A charging and discharging method, characterized in, comprising: 
 detecting an impedance of a crystal lattice type battery when the crystal lattice type battery is charged or discharged; and 
 providing a excitation signal to the crystal lattice type battery when the impedance is greater than or equal to a threshold.
13. The charging and discharging method according to claim 12, wherein the excitation signal have an excitation frequency substantially equal to a natural frequency of the battery, and the excitation frequency is less than or equal to 500 kilohertz (kHz) and greater than or equal to 300 kilohertz (kHz).
14. The charging and discharging method according to claim 13, wherein the excitation frequency is less than or equal to 410 kilohertz (kHz) and greater than or equal to 350 kilohertz (kHz).
15. The charging and discharging method according to claim 12, wherein the threshold is 1.1 times a minimum value of the impedance.

Title: Lithium ion battery internal health feature extraction method based on impedance spectrum
Inventor:
L CHAO
LIU HAIYANG
CONG, Wei
ZHANG TAO
Abstract: A lithium ion battery internal health feature extraction method based on an impedance spectrum, and relates to the new energy research field; an existing method uses an EIS to analyze and estimate a SOH, wherein the EIS is long in measuring time, and cannot realize online measurements; the lithium ion battery internal health feature extraction method comprises the following steps: building a lithium ion battery electrochemistry impedance spectrum mathematics model; fast measuring a lithium ion battery electrochemistry impedance spectrum, and obtaining the lithium ion battery electrochemistry impedance spectrum; using the lithium ion battery electrochemistry impedance spectrum mathematics model to identify the lithium ion battery electrochemistry impedance spectrum parameters respectively under high, medium and low frequency stages, thus obtaining the lithium ion battery model parameters; periodically measuring the electrochemistry impedance spectrum of the aged lithium ion battery, using the lithium ion battery electrochemistry impedance spectrum mathematics model to identify the lithium ion battery electrochemistry impedance spectrum parameters of the aged lithium ion battery, thus obtaining the model parameter changing rules in the lithium ion battery aging process, and serving as the features that evaluate the battery health states. The lithium ion battery internal health feature extraction method is used for evaluating the battery health states.

Title: PRBS disturbance injection-based power grid impedance online identification method and device
Inventor:
SONG SHAOJIAN
TAO YUNFENG
LIU BIN
LIAO BILIAN
SONG CHUNNING
Abstract: The present invention relates to the technical field of electrical engineering and discloses a PRBS disturbance injection-based power grid impedance online identification device. The device is mainly composed of a grid-connected inverter, a current loop controller, a sampling device and an impedance identification unit. The device is characterized in that the grid-connected inverter is connected with the current loop controller. When the grid-connected state is stable, the grid-connected inverter injects the PRBS disturbance into the power grid. During the injection process of a PRBS signal, a built-in output voltage THD is fed back to the controller, so that the THD value of the output voltage of the inverter is ensured to be smaller than 5%. The sampling device is connected with the PCC part of the power grid and is used for sampling and recording the voltage and the current at the PCC part of the power grid. The impedance identification unit is used for subjecting the sampled data of the sampling device to DFT analysis, and taking the average value of the amplitude and the average value of the phase of each harmonic component of the voltage and the current during the current sampling period. The method of the invention is high in precision, high in speed, strong in real-time property, wide in frequency range, lower in measuring cost and difficulty, and better in stability.
Claims:
1. The utility model provides a grid impedance online identification device based on PRBS disturbance injection, mainly comprises grid-connected inverter, current loop controller, sampling device and impedance identification unit, its characterized in that: the grid-connected inverter is connected with the current loop controller, the grid-connected inverter can be used for injecting PRBS disturbance into a power grid under the condition of grid connection stability, and in the PRBS signal injection process, an output voltage THD feedback controller is arranged in the grid-connected inverter to ensure that the THD value of the output voltage of the inverter is less than 5%; the sampling device is connected with a PCC (point of charge controller) of the power grid, and is used for sampling and recording the voltage and the current at the PCC; the impedance identification unit performs DFT analysis on the data obtained by the sampling device, averages the amplitudes and phases of harmonic components of voltage and current in the sampling period, and calculates the frequency sequence of the power grid impedance by using the average values of the amplitudes and phases of harmonic components of the PRBS disturbance excitation and voltage response; the device adopts a least square curve fitting method to predict the impedance of the power grid, and improves the identification precision in a high frequency band.
2. An identification device according to claim 1 wherein: the grid-connected inverter is a single-phase grid-connected inverter, and the injection mode of PRBS disturbance to the power grid is superposition in the reference input of the current loop controller.
3. An identification device according to claim 1 wherein: the grid-connected inverter is a three-phase grid-connected inverter, and the injection mode of PRBS disturbance to the power grid is superposition in d-axis reference input of the current loop controller.
4. The method for the online identification of the impedance of the power grid by using the identification device of claim 1 comprises the following basic steps:
 (1) adding a PRBS disturbance signal channel in amplitude reference input of a grid-connected inverter current loop controller, and performing periodic superposition of PRBS disturbance; the frequency of the PRBS disturbing signal is the frequency of the fundamental frequency of the power grid or is set according to specific requirements, and the bit number N can be any integer between 5 and 11 according to the requirement of measurement precision; the amplitude of the PRBS disturbing signal is less than 10% of the rated output of the inverter;
 (2) outputting a superposed PRBS disturbance signal by a grid-connected inverter, periodically injecting the PRBS disturbance signal and stopping injecting the PRBS disturbance signal, so that the inverter is in two stable states including disturbance and no disturbance periodically;
 (3) the sampling device measures and samples the output voltage and the output current of the PCC points in two stable states containing disturbance and no disturbance respectively, then the impedance identification unit performs discrete Fourier analysis on the sampling result to obtain a frequency domain sequence of the voltage and the current, the vector difference operation is performed on the frequency domain sequence to obtain PRBS excitation disturbance and voltage response to a power grid under each frequency, and the power grid impedance value of the time period is obtained; meanwhile, total harmonic distortion analysis is carried out on the voltage in a disturbance state to obtain the THD value of the output voltage of the inverter, and the THD of the output voltage is ensured to be less than 5%;
 (4) the device is internally provided with a program for periodically carrying out the steps (2) to (3), and continuously updating the measured impedance frequency characteristic of the power grid in real time to finish the online identification of the power grid impedance.
5. The identification method according to claim 4, wherein: the grid-connected inverter is a single-phase grid-connected inverter, and the PRBS disturbance superposition mode in the step (1) is that PRBS disturbance signals are superposed in the reference input of the current loop controller.
6. The identification method according to claim 4, wherein: the grid-connected inverter is a three-phase grid-connected inverter, and the PRBS disturbance superposition mode PRBS disturbance signals in the step (1) are superposed in d-axis reference input of the current loop controller.
7. The identification method according to claim 4, wherein: the period of the grid-connected inverter for outputting the superimposed PRBS disturbing signal can be selected to be 5 power grid waveforms, and the period is 0.1 s.

Title: Device, system, and method for measuring internal impedance of a test battery using frequency response
Inventor:
CHRISTOPHERSEN JON P 
MORRISON WILLIAM H 
MORRISON JOHN L
Abstract: Battery impedance testing devices, circuits, systems, and related methods are disclosed. An impedance measurement device includes a current driver configured to generate an excitation current signal to be applied to a test battery responsive to a control signal, and a processor operably coupled with the current driver. The processor is configured to generate the control signal during an auto ranging mode and a measuring mode. The auto ranging mode applies the excitation current signal to the test battery over a plurality of different amplitudes to measure a response to the excitation current signal at each amplitude. The measuring mode applies the excitation current signal to the test battery for an amplitude responsive to the results of the auto ranging mode. Improved sensitivity and resolution may be achieved for low impedance batteries with a rapid measurement time.
