Title: Capacitive sensor device with EMI-robust capacitive measurement circuit
Inventor: LAMESCH LAURENT
Abstract: A capacitive sensor device configured for being connected between an electric heating member and a heating current supply and for using the electric heating member as an antenna electrode. The sensor device includes a common mode choke for connecting between the heating member and the current supply, and a control and evaluation circuit for determining an electrical impedance between the electric heating member and a counter electrode via a measurement node. The control and evaluation circuit includes: a third winding inductively coupled to the first and second windings of the common mode choke, a periodic signal voltage source directly connected to the third common mode choke winding, an electrical quantity measurement circuit configured to determine an electrical quantity across the measurement node, and an EMI filter network that is connected across a signal input port of the third winding and a reference input port connected to AC ground potential.
Claims:
The invention claimed is:
1. A capacitive sensor device, configured for being connected between an electric heating member and a heating current supply and for using the electric heating member as an antenna electrode, comprising: 
 a common mode choke having first and second inductively coupled windings, wherein the first winding is configured for being connected between a first terminal of the heating current supply and a first terminal of the electric heating member, and wherein the second winding is configured for being connected between a second terminal of the electric heating member and a second terminal of the heating current supply; and 
 a control and evaluation circuit that is configured for injecting a periodic alternating measurement signal into the electric heating member via a measurement node, to measure an electrical quantity across the measurement node, and to derive, based on the measured electrical quantity, an electrical impedance between the electric heating member and a counter electrode; 
 the control and evaluation circuit including: 
  a third common mode choke winding inductively coupled to the first winding and the second winding of the common mode choke; 
  a periodic signal voltage source that is configured for providing an alternating measurement voltage at an output port, wherein the output port is electrically directly connected to a first terminal connection of the third common mode choke winding; 
  an electrical quantity measurement circuit having a signal input port and a reference input port and being configured to determine, with reference to a reference electric quantity provided to the reference input port, the electrical quantity across the measurement node, wherein the signal input port is electrically connected to a second terminal connection of the third common mode choke winding, and the reference input port is electrically connected to a ground conductor that provides an AC ground potential; and 
 an EMI filter network that is electrically connected across the signal input port and the reference input port of the electrical quantity measurement circuit.
2. The capacitive sensor device as claimed in claim 1, wherein the third common mode choke winding is inductively coupled in the same winding sense as the first winding and the second winding.
3. The capacitive sensor device as claimed in claim 1, wherein the first winding and the second winding of the common mode choke and the third common mode choke winding are arranged within a common housing.
4. The capacitive sensor device as claimed in claim 1, wherein the third winding has a number of turns that is equal to a number of turns of the first winding and the second winding.
5. The capacitive sensor device as claimed in claim 1, wherein the third winding has a number of turns that is different to a number of turns of the first winding and the second winding.
6. The capacitive sensor device as claimed in claim 1, wherein the electrical quantity measurement circuit is designed as a current measurement circuit that is configured to determine, with reference to a reference voltage, a sense current that is flowing through the third common mode choke winding and is indicative of a position of an object relative to the electric heating member.
7. The capacitive sensor device as claimed in claim 6, wherein the sense current measurement circuit comprises a transimpedance amplifier, and the signal input port and the reference input port form part of the transimpedance amplifier.
8. The capacitive sensor device as claimed in claim 1, wherein the electrical quantity measurement circuit is configured to measure a voltage at the measurement node and to derive the impedance between the electric heating member and the counter electrode on the basis of the measured voltage.
9. The capacitive sensor device as claimed in claim 1, wherein the first terminal of the heating current supply and the second terminal of the heating current supply are electrically AC-coupled to the ground conductor.
10. The capacitive sensor device as claimed in claim 1, wherein the EMI filter network comprises at least one capacitor.
11. A seat occupancy detection system for detecting an occupancy of a seat, in particular a vehicle seat, the seat occupancy detection system comprising: 
 a capacitive sensor device as claimed in claim 1, 
 an electric heating member that is arranged at a cushion or a backrest forming part of the seat and that is employable as an antenna electrode, and 
 a heating current supply for providing electric current to the electric heating member.
12. The seat occupancy detection system as claimed in claim 11, wherein the heating current supply is configured to provide a DC current to the electric heating member, wherein the first winding is galvanically connected between the first terminal of the heating current supply and the first terminal of the electric heating member, and the second winding is galvanically connected between the second terminal of the electric heating member and the second terminal of the heating current supply.
13. A hands-on or hands-off detection device for a steering wheel, comprising: 
 a capacitive sensor device as claimed in claim 1, 
 an electric heating member that is arranged at the steering wheel and that is employable as an antenna electrode, and 
 a heating current supply for providing electric current to the electric heating member.

Title: SOH (State of Health) estimation method of power cell system based on fractional order model
Inventor:
XIONG RUI
TIAN JINPENG
HE HONGWEN
SUN FENGCHUN
Abstract: The invention provides an SOH estimation method of a power cell system based on a fractional order model. A cell open-circuit voltage is obtained on the basis of the fractional order model, and a capacity incremental method is further combined to estimate the SOH online; the problem that the cell capacity is hard to estimate online via a present power cell life estimation method is solved, the cell open-circuit voltage can be obtained needless of charging/discharging a cell in weak current or keeping the cell standby for a long time, online estimation of the SOH is realized by further combining the capacity incremental method, and the obtained open-circuit voltage can be used for SOC calibration.

Title: Simulation apparatus and method of battery and simulation system using the same
Inventor:
LEE, JONG-HAK
IN, DONG SEOK
Abstract: The present invention relates to a battery simulation apparatus, simulation method, and simulation system using the same. The battery simulation apparatus capable of simulating a DC voltage by reflecting internal impedance characteristics of a battery according to an aspect of the present invention comprises: an inverter providing an output voltage to an object to be tested; a reference voltage output part calculating a reference voltage by using internal impedance of a battery to be simulated and an open circuit voltage (OCV) of the battery; and a control part outputting a control signal for the output voltage to follow the reference voltage to the inverter.
Claims:
1. A power management apparatus, comprising: An inverter configured to provide an output voltage to a power management apparatus managing charging and discharging of a battery; a reference voltage output unit configured to calculate a reference voltage using an internal impedance of the battery and an open circuit voltage (OCV) of the battery; And a control unit that outputs a control signal for causing the output voltage to follow the reference voltage to the inverter, wherein the control unit compensates for an output current of the power management device with the reference voltage to generate the control signal.
2. The battery simulator according to claim 1, wherein the reference voltage output unit includes a reference voltage calculation unit configured to calculate the reference voltage by adding an impedance voltage calculated by reflecting the output current of the inverter to the internal impedance and the open circuit voltage.
3. The charging system of claim 1, wherein the reference voltage output unit is a state of charge (SOC) of the battery SOC) and the open circuit voltage, and the control unit calculates the reference voltage corresponding to the battery charge amount using internal impedance having different values for each battery, SOC, and the open circuit voltage, and outputs a control signal for making the reference voltage follow the charge amount of the battery to the inverter.
4. The battery charger according to claim 1, wherein the reference voltage output unit extracts a parameter calculation function for calculating a parameter constituting the internal impedance of the battery, obtains the parameter value for each amount of charge of the battery using the parameter calculation function, Generates a look-up table in which the internal impedance and the open circuit voltage are stored for each charge amount of the battery using the parameter values.
5. The battery simulation device according to claim 4, wherein the reference voltage output unit calculates a trend function of the parameter that varies the charge amount of the battery from the parameter values acquired for each charge amount of the battery, and generates a lookup table in which the internal impedance and the open circuit voltage are stored for each charge amount of the battery based on the trend function of the parameter.
6. The battery simulator according to claim 4, wherein the parameter of the internal impedance includes a first resistance formed by an internal resistance and a charge-transition resistance of the battery, a second resistance caused by a diffusion phenomenon inside the battery, and a capacitor caused by a diffusion phenomenon inside the battery.
7. The battery circuit of claim 6, wherein the reference voltage output unit extracts a function defined by a ratio between a first voltage value of the battery increased due to the interruption of the first current applied to the battery and the first current value as a calculation function of the first resistor, Extracting a function defined by a ratio between a first voltage value of the battery which is raised due to the interruption of the first current applied to the battery and a second voltage value at which the voltage of the battery converges with an exponential increase, and the first current value as a calculation function of the second resistor, And extracts a function defined by a ratio between a time constant in a case where a voltage of the battery increases exponentially from a first voltage value increased due to interruption of a first current applied to the battery and the second resistance as a calculation function of the capacitor.
8. The battery simulation device according to claim 5, wherein the reference voltage output unit generates a trend line using the parameter values acquired for each of the amounts of charge of the battery, and calculates the parameter trend function with the amount of charge of the battery as a variable from the generated trend line.
9. A power management device connected to a system for converting an alternating current voltage provided in the system into a direct current voltage or converting a direct current voltage into an alternating current voltage and outputting the converted current voltage to the system; and a power management device having an input terminal connected to the system, An output terminal is connected to the direct current terminal of the power management device and includes a battery simulation device outputting an output voltage of a battery to the power management device based on an output voltage of the battery to be connected to the direct current terminal of the power management device, and the battery simulation device includes: An impedance voltage calculation unit calculating an impedance voltage by reflecting an output current output to the power management device in an internal impedance of the battery; A reference voltage calculating unit configured to calculate a reference voltage using the impedance voltage and an open circuit voltage (OCV) of the battery; And a control unit that generates a control signal for causing the output voltage of the battery to follow the reference voltage, wherein the control unit generates the control signal by compensating an output current of the power management device for the reference voltage.
10. A simulation system using a battery simulation device as set forth in claim 9, wherein said battery simulation device includes: An inverter for converting an alternating current voltage input from said system into a direct current voltage; and a smoothing capacitor for smoothing the direct current voltage output from said inverter and outputting the smoothed voltage to a direct current end of said power management device.
11. The simulation system using the battery simulation system according to claim 9, wherein the battery simulation device further includes a battery charge calculation unit configured to calculate a state of charge (SOC) of the battery based on an output current output to the power management device, and the impedance voltage calculation unit calculates the impedance voltage using an internal impedance corresponding to the calculated state of charge of the battery.
12. A method for controlling charging and discharging of a battery, the method comprising: Calculating a charge amount of the battery to be simulated based on an output current output to a power management apparatus for managing charging and discharging of the battery; calculating an impedance voltage using a parameter of an internal impedance of the battery corresponding to the charge amount of the battery; Calculating and outputting a reference voltage for output to a test object using the impedance voltage and an open circuit voltage; and generating a control signal for causing the output voltage of the battery to follow the reference voltage, wherein the control signal is generated by compensating for an output current of the power management device for the reference voltage.
13. The method of claim 12, further comprising: Before calculating the charge amount of the battery, generating a look-up table in which the parameter of the internal impedance and the open circuit voltage are stored for each charge amount of the battery to be simulated, wherein the calculating of the impedance voltage includes calculating the impedance voltage by extracting the parameter of the internal impedance of the battery from the look-up table, And said obtaining the open circuit voltage comprises obtaining the open circuit voltage from the look-up table.
14. The battery simulation method according to claim 12, wherein the parameter of the impedance for calculating the internal impedance voltage of the battery includes a first resistance formed of the internal resistance of the battery and a charge transfer resistance, a second resistance caused by a diffusion phenomenon inside the battery, and a capacitor caused by a diffusion phenomenon inside the battery.

Title: A method for estimating an internal impedance of a battery
Inventor:
SEO, YONG SEOK
KIM, Heung il
Abstract: According to the present invention, a method for estimating the internal impedance of a battery includes: an input voltage applying process of inputting an input voltage of a first frequency to positive and negative electrode terminals of a battery; a response voltage measuring process of measuring a response voltage of the battery for responding to the input voltage in the positive and negative electrode terminals; a frequency increasing process of increasing the frequency of the input voltage to a second frequency increased from the first frequency by a predetermined frequency gap; and a frequency determination process of determining whether the second frequency is equal to or greater than a preset frequency. When the second frequency is equal to or less than the preset frequency, the input voltage applying process and response voltage measuring process are repeatedly executed with respect to the input voltage of the second frequency to measure the response voltage of the battery in accordance with a change in the frequency, thereby accurately measuring the internal resistance of the battery.
Claims:
1. A method for estimating internal impedance of a battery, comprising: an input voltage applying step of applying an input voltage having a first frequency as an input frequency to positive and negative terminals of the battery; A response voltage measuring process of measuring a response voltage of the battery in response to the input voltage at the positive and negative terminals; a frequency increasing process of increasing the input frequency to a second frequency which is increased from the first frequency by a predetermined frequency interval; And a frequency determination process of determining whether the second frequency is greater than or equal to a predetermined frequency, wherein when the second frequency is less than or equal to the predetermined frequency, the input voltage application process and the response voltage measurement process are performed again on an input voltage having the second frequency as an input frequency as a result of the frequency determination process, an impedance calculation process of calculating an internal impedance of the battery based on the input voltage and the response voltage according to a frequency change of the input voltage when the second frequency is equal to or greater than the predetermined frequency as a result of the frequency determination process; An impedance change rate determination process of calculating a change rate of the internal impedance according to a change in frequency of the input voltage based on a result of the calculation of the internal impedance; And a battery state determination process of determining a state of the battery based on the internal impedance change rate, wherein the battery state determination process determines that the battery operates normally within a frequency range of the input voltage corresponding to the internal impedance change rate that is equal to or less than a specific value.
2. AMEND STATUS: Delete
3. AMEND STATUS: Delete
4. AMEND STATUS: Delete
5. The method of claim 1, wherein the first frequency and the predetermined frequency are 1 KHz and 100 KHz, respectively, and the constant frequency interval is 100 Hz.
6. An apparatus for estimating internal impedance of a battery, comprising: a power supply unit configured to apply an input voltage having a first frequency as an input frequency to positive and negative terminals of the battery; And a voltage measuring unit configured to measure a response voltage of the battery in response to the input voltage at the positive and negative terminals; and a control unit configured to control the input frequency to be increased to a second frequency increased by a predetermined frequency interval from the first frequency, And a controller configured to determine whether the second frequency is greater than or equal to a predetermined frequency and, if the second frequency is less than or equal to the predetermined frequency, control the power supply unit and the voltage measurement unit to apply an input voltage having the second frequency as an input frequency and measure a response voltage again, an impedance calculation module configured to calculate an internal impedance of the battery based on the input voltage and the response voltage according to a frequency change of the input voltage when the second frequency is greater than or equal to the predetermined frequency; an impedance change rate determination module configured to calculate a change rate of the internal impedance according to a frequency change of the input voltage based on a result of the calculation of the internal impedance; And a battery state determination module configured to determine a state of the battery based on the internal impedance change rate, wherein the battery state determination module determines that the battery operates normally within a frequency range of the input voltage corresponding to the internal impedance change rate that is equal to or less than a specific value.
7. AMEND STATUS: Delete
8. AMEND STATUS: Delete
9. AMEND STATUS: Delete
10. The apparatus for estimating internal impedance of a battery according to claim 6, wherein the first frequency and the predetermined frequency are 1 KHz and 100 KHz, respectively, and the constant frequency interval is 100 Hz.

Title: Apparatus and method for monitoring auxiliary battery of vehicle
Inventor:
LEE, Keun Pyo
JEONG, JIN HYEOK
Abstract: The present invention proposes an apparatus and a method for monitoring an auxiliary battery for a vehicle configured to monitor an inner state of an auxiliary battery by using a discharge circuit. The apparatus according to the present invention includes: a battery discharger configured to discharge an auxiliary battery installed in a vehicle by using a circuit including a switching element; a battery state generator configured to generate information on an inner state of the auxiliary battery when the auxiliary battery is discharged; a battery replacement determiner configured to determine whether the auxiliary battery is required to be replaced based on the information on the inner state of the auxiliary battery; and a battery replacement requester configured to request for the replacement of the auxiliary battery if it is determined that the auxiliary battery is required to be replaced.
Claims:
1. A battery discharge apparatus comprising: a battery discharge unit configured to discharge an auxiliary battery provided in a vehicle using a circuit including a switching element; a battery state generation unit configured to generate internal state information of the auxiliary battery when discharging the auxiliary battery; A battery replacement determination unit configured to determine whether the auxiliary battery is to be replaced based on the internal state information of the auxiliary battery; and a battery replacement request unit configured to request replacement of the auxiliary battery when it is determined that the auxiliary battery is to be replaced.
2. The auxiliary battery monitoring device according to claim 1, wherein the battery discharging unit uses, as the circuit, a circuit including a GND located at one end of the switching element and at least one charge flow impeding element located at the other end of the switching element or between the switching element and the GND.
3. The auxiliary battery monitoring device according to claim 1, wherein the battery discharge unit uses a transistor as the switching element.
4. The battery state generating device according to claim 1, wherein the battery state generating unit comprises: an impedance estimating unit configured to estimate an internal impedance of the auxiliary battery based on voltages across both ends of a charge flow impeding element included in the circuit; And an impedance-based information generation unit configured to generate internal state information of the auxiliary battery based on an internal impedance of the auxiliary battery.
5. The auxiliary battery monitoring device of claim 1, wherein the battery replacement determination unit determines whether the auxiliary battery should be replaced based on whether the internal impedance of the auxiliary battery is equal to or greater than a first reference value when the internal impedance of the auxiliary battery is generated as the internal state information of the auxiliary battery.
6. The auxiliary battery monitoring device of claim 5, wherein the battery replacement determination unit determines the first reference value based on an internal impedance of the auxiliary battery initially generated.
7. The battery state generator according to claim 1, wherein the battery state generator comprises: a first voltage measuring unit configured to measure a first voltage output from the auxiliary battery when starting to discharge the auxiliary battery; a second voltage measuring unit configured to measure a second voltage output from the auxiliary battery after a predetermined time elapses; A voltage difference calculating unit configured to calculate a voltage difference between the first voltage and the second voltage; and a voltage difference-based information generating unit configured to generate internal state information of the auxiliary battery based on the voltage difference.
8. The auxiliary battery monitoring device of claim 1, wherein when a difference value between voltages measured at a predetermined time is generated as the internal state information of the auxiliary battery, the battery replacement determination unit determines whether the auxiliary battery should be replaced based on whether the difference value is greater than or equal to a second reference value.
9. The auxiliary battery monitoring device according to claim 1, further comprising: a battery temperature measuring unit configured to measure a surface temperature of the auxiliary battery; and a battery discharge determining unit configured to determine whether to discharge the auxiliary battery based on whether the surface temperature of the auxiliary battery is within a predetermined range.
10. The auxiliary battery monitoring device of claim 1, wherein the auxiliary battery monitoring device uses a battery provided in an e-call (e-call) system of the vehicle as the auxiliary battery.
11. A method of discharging an auxiliary battery provided in a vehicle, the method comprising: discharging an auxiliary battery provided in a vehicle using a circuit including a switching element; generating internal state information of the auxiliary battery when discharging the auxiliary battery; Determining whether the auxiliary battery should be replaced based on the internal state information of the auxiliary battery; and requesting replacement of the auxiliary battery if it is determined that the auxiliary battery should be replaced.

Title: Electric vehicle battery management system with AC internal resistance inspection function and detection method
Parent Assignee: FJ MOTOR GROUP YUDO NEW ENERGY AUTOMOBILE CO LTD
Inventor:
CAI JIANBING
LIU XINWEN
ZHAO MING
Abstract: The invention discloses an electric vehicle battery management system with an AC internal resistance inspection function, comprising an AC module, a battery circuit module, a data acquisition module and a main control unit module. According to the battery management system, an excitation signal generation module generates an external sine excitation signal under control of the main control unit module, the sine excitation signal is injected into the battery circuit module, and the data acquisition module acquires and analyzes the information of the battery circuit module and calculates the internal resistance of the battery. The AC internal resistance of the battery is detected to judge whether damage to the battery or breakage of a sampling wiring harness is caused. When the wiring harness is broken, the battery management system does not report battery damage mistakenly. Thus, the battery management system makes diagnosis more reliably.

Title: Status detection device and status detection method for fuel cell
Inventor:
KOTAKA TOSHIKAZU 
AOKI TETSUYA
Abstract: A state detection device for fuel cell includes a supposed high-frequency impedance value setting unit configured to set a supposed high-frequency impedance value on the basis of an impedance measurement value belonging to an arc region of an impedance curve of the fuel cell, an actually measured high-frequency impedance value calculation unit configured to obtain an actually measured high-frequency impedance value on the basis of an impedance measurement value belonging to a non-arc region of the impedance curve of the fuel cell, and an ionomer resistance estimation unit configured to estimate a value obtained by subtracting the actually measured high-frequency impedance value from the supposed high-frequency impedance value as an ionomer resistance value. The supposed high-frequency impedance value setting unit sets a value of an intersection of an equivalent circuit impedance curve set on the basis of the impedance measurement value belonging to the arc region and a real axis as the supposed high-frequency impedance value.
Claims:
1. A state detection device for fuel cell, comprising: 
 a supposed high-frequency impedance value setting unit configured to set a supposed high-frequency impedance value on the basis of an impedance measurement value belonging to an arc region of an impedance curve of the fuel cell; 
 an actually measured high-frequency impedance value calculation unit configured to obtain an actually measured high-frequency impedance value on the basis of an impedance measurement value belonging to a non-arc region of the impedance curve of the fuel cell; and 
 an ionomer resistance estimation unit configured to estimate a value obtained by subtracting the actually measured high-frequency impedance value from the supposed high-frequency impedance value as an ionomer resistance value; 
 the supposed high-frequency impedance value setting unit setting a value of an intersection of an equivalent circuit impedance curve set on the basis of an impedance measurement value belonging to the arc region and a real axis as the supposed high-frequency impedance value.
2. The state detection device for fuel cell according to claim 1, wherein: 
 the equivalent circuit impedance curve is set by applying the impedance measurement value belonging to the arc region to an equation for impedance obtained from an equivalent circuit of the fuel cell.
3. The state detection device for fuel cell according to claim 2, wherein: 
 the equivalent circuit impedance curve is set by applying real parts and imaginary parts of impedance measurement values at two or more frequencies in the arc region to an equation for impedance real part:
Rcell sup= Zrc?Ract1+?2Cdl2Ract2
 and 
 an equation for imaginary part obtained from the equivalent circuit:
?1?Zim=1?2CdlRact2+Cdl
 (where Zre, Zim respectively denote the real part and the imaginary part of the impedance of the fuel cell, ? denotes an angular frequency of an alternating-current signal, Rcell,sup denotes the supposed high-frequency impedance value, Ract denotes a reaction resistance of a cathode electrode and Cdl denotes an electrical double layer capacitance of the cathode electrode).
4. The state detection device for fuel cell according to any one of claims 1 to 3, further comprising;
an ionomer resistance correction unit,
wherein the ionomer resistance correction unit: 
 obtains an increase of an ionomer resistance value by comparing a reference value of the ionomer resistance value estimated under a reference operating condition and a post-deterioration ionomer resistance value estimated after the fuel cell is operated for a predetermined time from an estimated value under the reference operating condition; and 
 makes a correction by subtracting the increase from a current estimated value of the ionomer resistance value.
5. The state detection device for fuel cell according to claim 4, wherein: 
 a deteriorated state of the fuel cell is a deteriorated state of a catalyst layer.
6. The state detection device for fuel cell according to any one of claims 1 to 4, further comprising: 
 an electrolyte membrane resistance estimation configured to estimate an electrolyte membrane resistance value, 
 wherein the electrolyte membrane resistance estimation unit: 
  compares a reference electrolyte membrane resistance value set on the basis of a relationship between the estimated ionomer resistance value and a wet/dry state of the fuel cell and a post-deterioration actually measured high-frequency impedance value estimated after the fuel cell is operated for a predetermined time from the set to obtain a difference between these; and 
  makes a correction by subtracting the difference from a current measurement value of the actually measured high-frequency impedance value.
7. The state detection device for fuel cell according to any one of claims 1 to 6, wherein the supposed high-frequency impedance value setting unit: 
 obtains two or more candidates for the supposed high-frequency impedance value on the basis of two or more impedance measurement values belonging to the arc region; and 
 sets an average value of the two or more candidates for the supposed high-frequency impedance value as the supposed high-frequency impedance value.
8. The state detection device for fuel cell according to any one of claims 1 to 6, wherein the actually measured high-frequency impedance value calculation means: 
 obtains two or more candidates for the actually measured high-frequency impedance value on the basis of two or more impedance measurement values belonging to the non-arc region; and 
 sets an average value of the two or more candidates for the actually measured high-frequency impedance value as the actually measured high-frequency impedance value.
9. The state detection device for fuel cell according to any one of claims 1 to 6, wherein the supposed high-frequency impedance value setting unit: 
 obtains two or more candidates for the supposed high-frequency impedance value on the basis of two or more impedance measurement values belonging to the arc region; and 
 sets each higher value out of the two or more candidates for the supposed high-frequency impedance value as the supposed high-frequency impedance value.
10. The state detection device for fuel cell according to any one of claims 1 to 6, wherein the actually measured high-frequency impedance value calculation means: 
 obtains two or more candidates for the actually measured high-frequency impedance value on the basis of two or more impedance measurement values belonging to the non-arc region; and 
 sets a lower value out of the two or more candidates for the actually measured high-frequency impedance value as the actually measured high-frequency impedance value.
11. The state detection device for fuel cell according to any one of claims 1 to 6, wherein the supposed high-frequency impedance value setting unit: 
 obtains two or more candidates for the supposed high-frequency impedance value on the basis of two or more impedance measurement values belonging to the arc region; and 
 sets each lower value out of the two or more candidates for the supposed high-frequency impedance value as the supposed high-frequency impedance value.
12. The state detection device for fuel cell according to any one of claims 1 to 6, wherein the actually measured high-frequency impedance value calculation means: 
 obtains two or more candidates for the actually measured high-frequency impedance value on the basis of two or more impedance measurement values belonging to the non-arc region; and 
 sets a higher value out of the two or more candidates for the actually measured high-frequency impedance value as the actually measured high-frequency impedance value.
13. The state detection device for fuel cell according to any one of claims 1 to 12, further comprising: 
 frequency region determination means for comparing a value of an intersection of a straight line connecting impedance measurement values measured at two or more frequencies and a real axis and the actually measured high-frequency impedance value to determine whether each of the two or more frequencies belongs to the non-arc region or to the arc region.
14. The state detection device for fuel cell according to claim 13, wherein:

Title: Apparatus for forecasting life cycle of battery based on AC impedance by using very low current
Inventor:
BAE,JungHyo
BAI ZHI GUO
Abstract: The present invention relates to an apparatus for predicting a battery life based on AC impedance using a micro current, and more specifically, to an apparatus for predicting a battery life based on AC impedance using a micro current, which predicts the battery life that is basic information for a battery management system (BMS) operation. The battery life predicting apparatus according to the present invention comprises: an AC signal generating unit which generates an AC signal and applies the generated AC signal to a battery pack including a plurality of battery cells; a cell selecting unit which selects a battery cell, of which the life is to be predicted, among the plurality of battery cells; an impedance calculating unit which calculates AC impedance of the selected battery cell using an AC voltage output from the selected battery cell by the AC signal; and a stage of charge (SOC) calculating unit which calculates an SOC of the selected battery cell using the AC impedance, and predicts the life of the selected battery cell using the SOC. According to the present invention, the battery life predicting apparatus measures AC impedance of each battery cell constituting the battery pack by applying the AC signal having a single frequency, and predicts the life of each battery cell using the measured AC impedance, thereby significantly reducing an equipment price through a simple apparatus configuration.
Claims:
1. An apparatus for estimating a life span of a battery cell, the apparatus comprising: an AC signal generator configured to generate an AC signal having a single frequency value and apply the generated AC signal to a battery pack including a plurality of battery cells; An impedance calculator configured to calculate an AC impedance of the selected battery cell using an AC voltage output from the selected battery cell by the AC signal; And an SOH calculator configured to calculate a state of charge (SOH) of the selected battery cell by substituting the AC impedance into a predetermined AC impedance characteristic curve and predict a life of the selected battery cell using the SOH.
2. AMEND STATUS: Delete
3. The apparatus of claim 1, wherein the SOH calculator transmits the SOH and the predicted life of the selected battery cell to an external battery management system (BMS).
4. The apparatus of claim 1, further comprising a display unit configured to display the SOH and the predicted life of the selected battery cell.
5. The apparatus of claim 4, wherein the display unit receives temperature, voltage, or state of charge (SOC) information of each of the plurality of battery cells from an external battery management system (BMS) and further displays the received information.
6. The device of claim 1, wherein the impedance calculation unit further comprises an amplification circuit unit configured to amplify the AC voltage output from the selected battery cell, and a noise removal circuit unit configured to remove noise from the amplified AC voltage.
7. The apparatus of claim 1, wherein the AC signal has a predetermined current and frequency value.

Title: Fuel cell system and control method of fuel cell system
Inventor:
OGAWA TOMOHIRO 
NAGANUMA YOSHIAKI
Abstract: An object is to provide a technique that a current state of a fuel cell may be detected more accurately. A fuel cell system includes a controller, a fuel cell, and an impedance measurer that may measure an impedance of the fuel cell. The controller obtains a first impedance value that expresses the impedance of the fuel cell in a predetermined state, acquires a second impedance value that expresses the impedance of the fuel cell that is measured by the impedance measurer during operation control of the fuel cell, and performs operation control of the fuel cell using the first impedance value and the second impedance value.
Claims:
What is claimed is:
1. A fuel cell system, comprising: 
 a fuel cell; 
 an impedance measurer that measures an impedance of the fuel cell; and 
 a controller configured to perform an operation control of the fuel cell, wherein the controller is further configured to obtain a first impedance value expressing the impedance of the fuel cell when the fuel cell is generating electric power in a in a predetermined reference condition where the electrolyte membrane is confirmed to be in a wet state, 
 acquire a second impedance value expressing the impedance of the fuel cell by measuring the impedance measurer when the fuel cell is generating the electric power, and perform operation control of generating electric power in the fuel cell using the first impedance value and the second impedance value.
2. The fuel cell system according to claim 1, wherein 
 the controller is further configured to correct the second impedance value by using the first impedance value, and perform the operation control of the fuel cell on the basis of the second impedance value after correction.
3. The fuel cell system according to claim 1, further comprising: 
 a storage portion for storing the first impedance value, wherein 
 the controller is further configured to execute an update process that updates the first impedance value stored in the storage portion when the fuel cell reaches the predetermined reference condition during the operation control of the fuel cell, 
 the controller, in the update process, reacts the first impedance from the storage portion as an original value, 
 obtains the impedance of the fuel cell by the impedance measurer as a present value, calculates an updated first impedance value by using the original value and the present value, and stores the updated first impedance value in the storage portion as the first impedance value.
4. The fuel cell system according to claim 3, further comprising: 
 a temperature detect portion that detects an operating temperature of the fuel cell, wherein 
 the controller is further configured to determine that the fuel cell reaches the predetermined reference condition when the operating temperature of the fuel cell is within a predetermined temperature range, and execute the update process.
5. The fuel cell system according to claim 4, 
 wherein 
 the controller is further configured to determine that the fuel cell reaches the predetermined reference condition when the operating temperature of the fuel cell is within the predetermined temperature range during a predetermined time period, and execute the update process.
6. The fuel cell system according to claim 3, wherein 
 the controller is further configured to update the first impedance value with reflecting a difference between the present value and the original value so that a difference between the present value and the updated first impedance value is reduced.
7. The fuel cell system according to claim 6, wherein 
 the controller is further configured to update the first impedance value by using a correction strength that expresses an extent of reflection of the difference between the present value and the original value in the update process.
8. The fuel cell system according to claim 7, further comprising: 
 an initialization detector configured to detect a history of initialization of the storage portion, wherein 
 the controller is further configured to change the correction strength so that the extent of reflection of the difference between the present value and the original value becomes large when the history of initialization of the storage portion is detected by the initialization detector.
9. The fuel cell system according to claim 6, wherein 
 the storage portion is a first storage portion, and the fuel cell system further comprises 
 a second storage portion configured to store an initial value of the first impedance value; and 
 an initialization detector configured to detect a history of initialization of the first storage portion, wherein 
 the controller is further configured to set a value that is larger than the initial value of the first impedance value stored in the second storage portion as the original value, and restart the update of the first impedance value in the update process, when a history of initialization of the first storage portion is detected by the initialization detector.
10. The fuel cell system according to claim 1, further comprising: 
 a reaction gas supply portion for supplying reaction gas to the fuel cell, wherein 
 the controller is further configured to control the reaction gas supply portion in the operation control of the fuel cell using the first impedance value and the second impedance value.
11. A control method of a fuel cell system, comprising: 
 a first impedance acquisition process of obtaining a first impedance value that expresses an impedance of a fuel cell when the fuel cell is generating electric power in a predetermined reference condition where the electrolyte membrane is confirmed to be in a wet state; 
 a second impedance acquisition process of acquiring a second impedance value expressing the impedance of the fuel cell by measuring the impedance of the fuel cell when the fuel cell is generating the electric power; and 
 a control process of executing the operation control of generating electric power in the fuel cell by using the first impedance value and the second impedance value.
12. The control method according to claim 11, further comprising: 
 a correct process of correcting the second impedance value by using the first impedance value, wherein 
 the control process executes the operation control of the fuel cell on the basis of the second impedance value after correction.
13. The control method according to claim 11, further comprising: 
 an update process of updating the first impedance value, which is stored in a storage portion when the fuel cell reaches the predetermined reference condition during the operation control of the fuel cell, wherein 
 the update process includes reading the first impedance value from the storage portion as an original value, 
 obtaining the impedance of the fuel cell by measuring the fuel cell as a present value, 
 calculating an updated first impedance value by using the original value and the present value, and 
 storing the updated first impedance value in the storage portion as the first impedance value.
14. The control method according to claim 13, further comprising: 
 a temperature detect process of detecting an operating temperature of the fuel cell, and 
 a determine process of determining that the fuel cell reaches the predetermined reference condition which causes updating the first impedance value, when the operating temperature of the fuel cell is within a predetermined temperature range.
15. The control method according to claim 14, wherein the determine process of determining that the fuel cell reaches the predetermined reference condition which causes updating the first impedance value, when the operating temperature of the fuel cell is within the predetermined temperature range during a predetermined time period.
16. The control method according to claim 13, wherein the update process is a process of updating the first impedance value with reflecting a difference between the present value and the original value in order to reduce a difference between the present value and the updated first impedance value.
17. The control method according to claim 16, wherein 
 the update process is a process of updating the first impedance value by using a correction strength that express a extent of reflection of the difference between the present value and the original value.
18. The control method according to claim 17, further comprising: 
 an initialization history detection process of detecting a history of initialization of the storage portion; and 
 a correction strength change process of changing the correction strength so that the extent of reflection of the difference between the present value and the original value becomes large when the history is detected in the initialization history detection process.
19. The control method according to claim 16, wherein 
 the storage portion is a first storage portion, and the control method further comprises 
 an initialization history detection process of detecting a history of initialization of the first storage portion; and 
 a setting value process of setting a secondary initial value, which is larger than an initial value of the first impedance value that is stored in a second storage portion in advance, as the original value when a history of initialization of the first storage portion is detected, wherein 
 the update process is restarted and uses the secondary initial as the initial value of the first impedance value after the history of initialization of the first storage portion is detected.
20. The control method according to claim 11, wherein 
 the control process includes a process of controlling a supply of a reaction gas to the fuel cell on the basis of the first impedance value and the second impedance value.

Title: Used battery sieving method
Assignee: NATIONAL INSTITUTE CHUNG SHAN SCIENCE & TECHNOLOGY
Inventor:
FANG FUMIN
WEN SHU-HSIEN
REN GUOGUANG
LI TONGJIN
Abstract: The invention provides an used battery sieving method used for sieving the single cell, in which the performance is not aged cells, from a used battery set and for taking these single cells that are worthy of use as a power storage system or other power sources after reassembling.
Claims:
1. A method of screening a battery for service, comprising the steps of: measuring an open circuit voltage of the battery, determining that the battery is removed if the open circuit voltage of the battery is below a minimum allowable open circuit voltage value; If the actual capacity of the battery is lower than the available capacity, the battery is determined to be removed; the battery is subjected to an AC impedance test, the curve of the AC impedance frequency response of the battery is examined, and if the curve does not conform to a standard curve, the battery is determined to be removed; and a battery is formed by combining a plurality of batteries determined to be available after screening with a battery management system.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the battery is a lithium iron phosphate battery.
3. The method of claim 1, wherein the step of measuring an internal resistance of the battery further comprises determining the battery outfit when the internal resistance of the battery is greater than 1.3 to 1.6 times a standard internal resistance value.
4. The method of claim 1 or 2, wherein the step of performing a charge-discharge test further comprises: examining a discharge step voltage of the battery and determining that the battery is subdivided if the discharge step voltage of the battery is too low.
5. The method of claim 4, wherein when the discharge step voltage of the battery is less than 3.0 V, it is determined that the battery is removed.
6. The method of claim 1, wherein the available capacity is 70% of a standard capacity of the battery in a completely new state.
7. The method of claim 2, wherein the minimum allowable open circuit voltage value is 2.0 V.
8. The method of claim 1, wherein prior to measuring the open circuit voltage of the battery, the external appearance of the battery is examined and the battery is judged to be removed if the external appearance of the battery exhibits deformation, expansion, liquid leakage, rust or other damage.
9. The method of claim 1, wherein the sequence of steps of the charge-discharge test and the AC impedance test is adjustable.

Title: Fuel battery internal state-estimating device
Inventor:
AOKI, Tetsuya
MATSUMOTO, Michihiko
Abstract:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide an internal state-estimating device which makes possible to calculate a resistance of an electrolyte film of a fuel battery without increasing the cost.
SOLUTION: An internal state-estimating device for estimating an internal state of a fuel battery which is supplied with an anode gas and a cathode gas and generates an electric power comprises: impedance calculation means for calculating an internal impedance of the fuel battery for each frequency on the basis of two or more AC signals of different frequencies output by the fuel battery; state amount calculation means for calculating a state amount of a fuel battery electrode on the basis of an imaginary part component of the internal impedance for each frequency; and film resistance calculation means for calculating a resistance of an electrolyte film of the fuel battery on the basis of the state amount of the fuel battery electrode and a real part component of the internal impedance at a predetermined frequency.
SELECTED DRAWING: Figure 7
COPYRIGHT: (C)2016,JPO&INPIT
Claims:
1. An internal state estimation device for estimating an internal state of a fuel cell that generates power by being supplied with anode gas and cathode gas, the device comprising: impedance calculation means for calculating an internal impedance of the fuel cell at each frequency on the basis of alternating current signals of two or more different frequencies output from the fuel cell; State quantity calculation means for calculating a state quantity of an electrode of the fuel cell on the basis of imaginary component of internal impedance at each frequency; membrane resistance calculation means for calculating an electrolyte membrane resistance of the fuel cell on the basis of the state quantity of the electrode of the fuel cell and a real component of the internal impedance at a predetermined frequency; Setting means for setting a measured value of an electrolyte membrane resistance of the fuel cell on the basis of the electrolyte membrane resistance calculated by the membrane resistance calculating means, wherein the membrane resistance calculating means uses real component components of the internal impedance of two or more different frequencies to calculate the measured value of the electrolyte membrane resistance of the fuel cell; Calculate two or more electrolyte membrane resistances, wherein when a maximum value of the plurality of electrolyte membrane resistances is greater than an upper limit value for wetting determination, the setting means sets the maximum value as the electrolyte membrane resistance measurement value.
2. An internal state estimation device for estimating an internal state of a fuel cell that generates power by being supplied with anode gas and cathode gas, the device comprising: impedance calculation means for calculating an internal impedance of the fuel cell at each frequency on the basis of alternating current signals of two or more different frequencies output from the fuel cell; State quantity calculation means for calculating a state quantity of an electrode of the fuel cell on the basis of imaginary component of internal impedance at each frequency; membrane resistance calculation means for calculating an electrolyte membrane resistance of the fuel cell on the basis of the state quantity of the electrode of the fuel cell and a real component of the internal impedance at a predetermined frequency; Setting means for setting a measured value of an electrolyte membrane resistance of the fuel cell on the basis of the electrolyte membrane resistance calculated by the membrane resistance calculating means, wherein the membrane resistance calculating means uses real component components of the internal impedance of two or more different frequencies to calculate the measured value of the electrolyte membrane resistance of the fuel cell; Calculate two or more electrolyte membrane resistances, wherein when a minimum value of the plurality of electrolyte membrane resistances is less than a lower limit value for wetting determination, the setting means sets the minimum value as the electrolyte membrane resistance measurement value.
3. An internal state estimation device for estimating an internal state of a fuel cell that generates power by being supplied with anode gas and cathode gas, the device comprising: impedance calculation means for calculating an internal impedance of the fuel cell at each frequency on the basis of alternating current signals of two or more different frequencies output from the fuel cell; State quantity calculation means for calculating a state quantity of an electrode of the fuel cell on the basis of imaginary component of internal impedance at each frequency; membrane resistance calculation means for calculating an electrolyte membrane resistance of the fuel cell on the basis of the state quantity of the electrode of the fuel cell and a real component of the internal impedance at a predetermined frequency; Setting means for setting a measured value of an electrolyte membrane resistance of the fuel cell on the basis of the electrolyte membrane resistance calculated by the membrane resistance calculating means, wherein the membrane resistance calculating means uses real component components of the internal impedance of two or more different frequencies to calculate the measured value of the electrolyte membrane resistance of the fuel cell; Calculate two or more electrolyte membrane resistances, wherein the setting means sets an average value of a plurality of the electrolyte membrane resistances as the electrolyte membrane resistance measurement values when the plurality of electrolyte membrane resistances are between an upper limit value for wetting determination and a lower limit value for wetting determination.
4. The device for estimating an internal state of a fuel cell according to any one of claims 1 to 3, whereinthe membrane resistance calculation means calculates a correction impedance from a state quantity of an electrode of the fuel cell, and calculates the electrolyte membrane resistance by correcting a real component of the internal impedance using the correction impedance.
5. Claims4The device for estimating an internal state of a fuel cell according to claim 1, wherein the membrane resistance calculation means calculates the electrolyte membrane resistance by subtracting the correction impedance from a real component of the internal impedance.
6. The fuel cell internal state estimation device according to any one of claims 1 to 3, whereinthe state quantities of the electrodes of the fuel cell calculated by the state quantity calculation means are electric double layer capacities and reaction resistances of the electrodes.
7. Claims6The fuel cell internal state estimation device according to claim 1, wherein the state quantity calculation means calculates the state quantity in a coordinate where 1/?2 (?=2?f) is represented on the horizontal axis and 1/?  Zim is represented on the vertical axis, Calculates, as the electric double layer capacity, an intercept of a straight line obtained from two or more points plotted based on imaginary components Zim of the internal impedance at each frequency f, and calculates the reaction resistance from the electric double layer capacity and the slope of the straight line.

Title: Battery internal state estimation device
Inventor:
MORIMOTO, Shinichi
KATO, Keiichi
KOIKE, Yuuji
SADA, Takeshi
ABE, Tetsuya
KAWAI, Toshiyuki
Abstract:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To highly accurately estimate details of an internal state of a secondary battery even in an operating system.
SOLUTION: A battery internal state estimation device comprises: a storage unit 54 storing detection values of a voltage sensor 31 detecting a voltage between terminals of a storage battery 10 and detection values of a current sensor 30 detecting a charging/discharging current flowing in the storage battery 10 in time series; a wavelet transform unit 60 calculating a voltage wavelet transform coefficient by performing wavelet transform on the detection values of the voltage between the terminals, and calculating a current wavelet transform coefficient by performing wavelet transform on the detection values of the charging/discharging current; and an internal impedance calculation unit 61 calculating a real part and an imaginary part of an internal impedance of the storage battery 10 per frequency by a ratio of the voltage wavelet transform coefficient to the current wavelet transform coefficient.
COPYRIGHT: (C)2016,JPO&INPIT
Claims:
1. Storage means for storing, in time series, values detected by voltage detection means (31) for detecting a voltage between terminals of a secondary battery (10) and current detection means (30) for detecting charging and discharging currents flowing in the secondary battery (55); a wavelet transform means (60) for calculating a voltage wavelet transform coefficient by performing a wavelet transform on the detected values of the inter-terminal voltage stored in time series, and for calculating a current wavelet transform coefficient by performing a wavelet transform on the detected values of the charge and discharge currents stored in time series; Internal impedance calculation means (61) for calculating a real part and an imaginary part of an internal impedance of the secondary battery for each frequency from a ratio of the voltage wavelet transform coefficient to the current wavelet transform coefficient;,The secondary battery is installed as a power source for a running motor in a vehicle, andCurrent or voltage simulating aperiodic charging and discharging of the secondary battery when the vehicle is operating and stopped is input to the secondary battery from a battery characteristic measurement device; andThe battery characteristic measurement device according to claim 1, wherein the wavelet transform means performs wavelet transform on detection values detected by the voltage detection means and the current detection means when the battery characteristic measurement device performs aperiodic charging and discharging.In accordance with the determination that the user input satisfies the determination that the user input satisfies the predetermined condition.

Title: Device for estimating parameter of equivalent circuit of secondary battery for vehicle
Inventor:
KOIKE, Yuuji
KATO, Keiichi
Abstract:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide a device for estimating a parameter of an equivalent circuit model of a secondary battery that is designed to be able to precisely estimate the parameter of the equivalent circuit model while a vehicle is actually running.
SOLUTION: An arithmetic unit 8 calculates the parameter of an RC series-parallel circuit in an equivalent circuit model after calculating Warburg impedance Zw. When calculating Warburg impedance Zw, the arithmetic unit 8 calculates the impedance Zw0 of a predetermined frequency f0, calculates the impedance Zw1 of frequencies f1 gradually low from the frequency f0, and, assuming that the impedance Zw1 of a first frequency f1 where the sum of a difference in the real part (Re(Zw1)-Re(Zw0)) and a difference in the imaginary part (Im(Zw1)-Im(Zw0)) of these is greater than or equal to a prescribed value Ze is a curved portion on a Nyquist diagram, calculates diffusion resistance Rd and time constant ?d by using the impedance Zw1 of this frequency f1 (S11-S19).
