A power generation apparatus comprising: a battery mounted in a vehicle; a generator that charges the battery or a vehicle load to which power is supplied from the battery; charge/discharge control means that variably control an operation period of charging from the generator or discharging to the vehicle load; A battery sensor that detects a voltage and a current of the battery; and when charging to or discharging from the battery by the charging/discharging control means is controlled by the operation cycle, Impedance calculating means for calculating an internal impedance of the battery for each frequency of the operation cycle on the basis of the voltage and the current; and A first deterioration level determination unit that determines a deterioration state of the battery with reference to a deterioration detection map that detects deterioration of the battery, the deterioration detection map being a predetermined deterioration level;Frequency selection means for selecting a characteristic frequency at which a rate of variation of a difference B relative to a difference A is greatest on the basis of a difference A between a previous internal impedance of the previous internal impedance and a difference B between a current internal impedance of the previous internal impedance of the previous internal impedance on the basis of the previous internal impedance calculated the previous time,The charging/discharging control means drives the vehicle load at a higher frequency than other frequencies using the characteristic frequency selected by the frequency selection means.The charging device is configured to charge the charging device.
2. A power generation apparatus comprising: a battery mounted in a vehicle; a generator that charges the battery or a vehicle load to which power is supplied from the battery; charge/discharge control means that variably control an operation period of charging from the generator or discharging to the vehicle load; A battery sensor that detects a voltage and a current of the battery; and when charging to or discharging from the battery by the charging/discharging control means is controlled by the operation cycle, Impedance calculating means for calculating an internal impedance of the battery for each frequency of the operation cycle on the basis of the voltage and the current; and A first deterioration level determination unit that determines a deterioration state of the battery with reference to a deterioration detection map that detects deterioration of the battery, the deterioration detection map being a predetermined deterioration level;Frequency ranking means for ranking the frequencies in ascending order of a rate of variation of a difference B relative to a difference A on the basis of a difference A between a previous internal impedance relative to the previous internal impedance and a difference B between a current internal impedance relative to the previous internal impedance on the basis of the previous internal impedance calculated the previous time,The charging/discharging control means drives the vehicle loads at higher frequencies in the order of the frequencies assigned by the frequency ranking means.The charging device is configured to charge the charging device.
3. Change amount calculating means for calculating a difference from the internal impedance previously measured for each frequency on the basis of the internal impedance calculated by the impedance calculating means; Second degree of deterioration determination means for determining a deterioration state of the battery on the basis of the difference calculated by the change amount calculation means or a change amount from an initial state.Claim 1-2The battery state detecting device according to any one of claims 1 to 6.
4. The second deterioration degree determination means determines the deterioration state of the battery on the basis of the difference or the displacement amount of a real part or an imaginary part of the internal impedance.Claim 3The battery state detecting device according to any one of claims 1 to 6.
5. The charging/discharging control means charges the generator or discharges the generator to the vehicle load twice at an operating cycle of the same frequency, and when the internal impedances calculated by the impedance calculation means for the two times at the same frequency are equal, The first or second deterioration degree determination unit determines a deterioration state of the battery on the basis of either one of two internal impedances, and enters a failsafe mode when the two internal impedances calculated by the impedance calculation unit at the same frequency are not equal.Claim 3The battery state detecting device according to any one of claims 1 to 3.
6. Internal impedance prediction means for predicting a future internal impedance on the basis of a plurality of internal impedances in which the internal impedance calculated by the impedance calculation means is only a real part; and Battery life prediction means for predicting, on the basis of the internal impedance predicted by the internal impedance prediction means, a battery life of the battery until the battery reaches an internal impedance that reaches a predetermined starting limit.Claims 1-5The battery state detecting device according to any one of claims 1 to 3.
7. A battery state detecting method for detecting a state of a battery by driving a vehicle load to which power is supplied from the battery installed in the vehicle, or by controlling charging to the battery, the method comprising: Discharging control for variable-controlling an operation cycle of discharging to the vehicle load or charging to a battery; and when discharging from the battery or charging to the battery is controlled by the operation cycle, Calculating an internal impedance of the battery for each frequency of the operation cycle; and determining a deterioration state of the battery with reference to a deterioration detection map that detects deterioration of the battery, the deterioration detection map being predetermined, on the basis of a value of the internal impedance calculated in the calculating an impedance;Selecting a characteristic frequency at which a rate of variation of a difference B relative to the difference A is greatest on the basis of a difference A between a previous internal impedance relative to the previous internal impedance and a difference B between a current internal impedance relative to the previous internal impedance on the basis of the previous internal impedance calculated last time;Driving the vehicle load more frequently than other frequencies with the characteristic frequency selected by the frequency selection step;Performing a determination on the state of the battery.
8. A battery state detecting method for detecting a state of a battery by driving a vehicle load to which power is supplied from the battery installed in the vehicle, or by controlling charging to the battery, the method comprising: Discharging control for variable-controlling an operation cycle of discharging to the vehicle load or charging to a battery; and when discharging from the battery or charging to the battery is controlled by the operation cycle, Calculating an internal impedance of the battery for each frequency of the operation cycle; and determining a deterioration state of the battery with reference to a deterioration detection map that detects deterioration of the battery, the deterioration detection map being predetermined, on the basis of a value of the internal impedance calculated in the calculating an impedance;A frequency ranking step of ranking the frequencies in ascending order of a rate of variation of a difference B relative to the difference A on the basis of a difference A between a previous internal impedance relative to the previous internal impedance and a difference B between the current internal impedance relative to the previous internal impedance on the basis of the previous internal impedance calculated last time;Driving the vehicle loads at a higher frequency in the order of the frequencies assigned in the frequency ranking step;Performing a determination on the state of the battery.

Title: Methods of discharge control for a battery pack of a cordless power tool system, a cordless power tool system and battery pack adapted to provide over-discharge protection and discharge control
Inventor:
CARRIER DAVID A 
GORTI BHANUPRASAD V 
TRINH DANH THANH 
BAILEY R ROBY 
SEMAN ANDREW E JR 
BROTTO DANIELE C 
WATTS FRED S
Abstract: In a cordless power tool system, a battery pack (450) which may removably attachable to a cordless power tool and to a charger may include at least one battery cell (410) and a power limiting device (490). The power limiting device may be arranged in series with the at least one battery cell for limiting power output of the battery pack based on the component that is connected to the pack. Current and hence power out of the battery pack may be controlled as a function of total internal impedance in the battery pack, which may be adjusted depending on the component that is connected to the pack.
Claims:
1. A method of controlling discharge rate of a plurality of serially connected cells (410) in a battery pack (450), wherein the battery pack is removably attachable to a power tool (10, 20, 30), the method comprising: 
 raising total internal pack impedance of a first battery pack (450) to match an internal impedance of a second battery pack designed for a given power tool (10, 20, 30) so as to control discharge rate of serially-connected cells (410) in the first battery pack to prevent one or more cells in the first battery pack from reaching one of an over-discharge state and an over-current condition, when the first battery pack is operatively connected and providing power to the given power tool; 
characterised in that raising total internal pack impedance includes adding a series resistance (411, 413, 418, 419) between a series connection of the cells in the first battery pack and a terminal connection point of the first battery pack to increase total internal impedance of the first battery pack.
2. A method according to claim 1, wherein raising total internal pack impedance includes lengthening connecting wires (411) extending between each cell (410) and a terminal connection point to increase total internal impedance of the first battery pack.
3. A method according to claim 1, wherein raising total internal pack impedance includes modifying a cross-sectional area of battery straps (413) that connect the cells so as to increase total impedance of the first battery pack.
4. A method according to claim 1, wherein raising total internal pack impedance includes dynamically adding, as a function of power tool load on the first battery pack, a series resistance (600) between a series connection of the cells and a terminal connection point of the first battery pack, so as to increase total internal impedance of the first battery pack.
5. A method according to claim 4, wherein the dynamically adding of resistance is implemented by at least one semiconductor device of the first battery pack performing a current limiting function.
6. A method according to claim 4, wherein the dynamically adding of resistance is implemented by a positive temperature coefficient (PTC) element of the first battery pack.
7. A battery pack (450) operatively attachable to differently-rated cordless power tools (10, 20, 30), the battery pack adapted for controlling discharge rate therein, comprising: 
 at least one or more serially-connected battery cells (410) for providing one of a first current and first power to drive a first power tool that is designed to operate with the battery pack and for driving a second power tool configured to operate at one of a second current and second power lower than the first current or power; and 
 at least one power limiting device for raising internal impedance of the battery pack to match an internal impedance of another, second battery pack that is designed to operate with the second power tool to control discharge rate of cells in the battery pack, so as to prevent one or more cells from reaching one of an over-discharge state and an over-current state during operation with the second power tool; 
characterised in that at least one power limiting device comprises a series resistance (411, 413, 418, 419) disposable between a series connection of cells (410) in the battery pack and a terminal connection point of the battery pack.
8. A battery pack according to claim 7, wherein the at least one power limiting device includes a passive resistance device to raise total internal impedance of the battery pack.
9. A battery pack according to claim 8, wherein the passive resistance device is a resistor placed in series with the battery cells between one of the battery cells and a terminal of the battery pack.
10. A battery pack according to claim 8, wherein the passive resistance device is embodied by connecting wires (411) extending between each cell and a terminal, the connecting wires being lengthened to increase total internal impedance of the battery pack.
11. A battery pack according to claim 8, wherein the passive resistance device is embodied by modifying battery straps (413) connecting the cells to increase total internal impedance of the battery pack.
12. A battery pack according to claim 7, wherein the at least one power limiting device includes an active resistance device (600) to increase total internal impedance of the battery pack.
13. A battery pack according to claim 12, wherein the active resistance device dynamically adds a series resistance as a function of tool load between a series connection of the cells and a terminal connection point of the battery to increase total internal impedance of the battery pack.
14. A battery pack according to claim 12, wherein the active resistance device is at least one semiconductor device with current limiting function in series with at least one of the one or more serially-connected cells.
15. A battery pack according to claim 12, wherein the active resistance device is at least two semiconductor devices with current limiting function operating in parallel to form a parallel combination in series with at least one of the one or more serially-connected cells.
16. A battery pack according to claim 12, wherein the active resistance device is a positive temperature coefficient (PTC) element.
17. A battery pack according to any one of claims 7 to 16, wherein the battery pack is a lithium-ion battery pack, and the second battery pack having an internal impedance to be matched is a nickel cadmium or nickel metal hydride battery pack.
18. A battery pack according to claim 7, the battery pack adapted to power one of a first power tool and a second power tool, the first power tool configured to operate at a higher current or power than the second power tool, the battery pack characterized as providing a higher current and a higher power at a lower internal impedance than that of a second battery pack designed for operation with the second power tool, the battery pack further comprising: 
 a sensor (810) adapted to selectively add internal impedance in the battery pack based on a indicator signal indicating that the battery pack is connected to one of the first or second power tools, and 
 an active resistance (600, 800) device for dynamically adding a series resistance to increase total internal impedance of the battery pack, depending on the indicator signal.
19. A battery pack according to claim 18, wherein the active resistance device is bypassed when the indicator signal indicates that the first power tool is connected to the battery pack.
20. A battery pack according to claim 18 or 19, wherein the active resistance device is activated to add internal impedance in the battery pack the indicator signal indicates that the second power tool is connected to the battery pack, facilitating raising of the internal impedance in the battery pack to match an internal impedance of the second battery pack that is designed to operate with the second power tool.
21. A battery pack according to any one of claims 18 to 20, wherein the sensor is embodied as one of an inductive pick-up sensor, magnetic sensor, radio frequency sensor and optical sensor for sensing a corresponding induction signal, magnetic signal, RF signal or optical signal that is generated based on engagement of one of the first and second power tools with the battery pack.
22. A battery pack according to claim 7, the battery pack adapted to power a first power tool configured to operate at one of a higher current and power than a second power tool, the battery pack further comprising: 
 a positive terminal; 
 a negative terminal; 
 a third terminal (940) for sensing power operation of the first or second power tool to provide a sensed signal, when the pack is attached thereto; and 
 a control circuit (950) for determining a desired internal impedance mode for the battery pack based on the sensed signal received from an attached one of the first and second power tools via the third terminal.
23. A battery pack according to claim 22, wherein the battery pack is adapted to a higher current and a higher power at a lower total internal pack impedance than a second battery pack that is designed to operate with the second power tool.
24. A battery pack according to claim 23, wherein
 the third terminal is a thermistor (970) contact terminal that is open when the pack is connected to the second power tool, and
 the control circuit sets a high impedance mode based on lack of receipt of the sensed signal, adding resistance to raise the internal impedance of the pack to match an internal impedance of the second battery pack that is designed to operate with the second power tool.
25. A battery pack according to claim 24, wherein
 the thermistor contact terminal senses a signal from the first power tool when the pack is connected to the first power tool, and
 the control circuit sets a low impedance mode based on the received sensed signal.
26. A battery pack according to claim 23, wherein
 the third terminal is an additional power contact terminal, and
 the control circuit is a current limiting device (975) configured to selectively add resistance to raise total internal pack impedance based on connective engagement of the additional power contact terminal (960) with a corresponding power contact terminal on one of the first and second power tools.
27. A battery pack according to claim 26, wherein
 only the first power tool has a corresponding power contact terminal, and
 the current limiting device maintains a low impedance mode based on a signal received via the corresponding power contact terminal of the first power tool.
28. A battery pack according to claim 26, wherein the current limiting circuit selects a high impedance mode for adding resistance to raise the internal impedance of the pack to match an internal impedance of the second battery pack designed to operate with the second power tool, only when the battery pack is connected to the second power tool.
29. A battery pack according to claim 22, wherein the first and second power tools include a motor, semiconductor device and control circuit, the semiconductor device and control circuit adapted for providing variable speed control in the motor of the first or second power tool, and wherein the third terminal is adapted to receive an indicator from the semiconductor device of one of the first and second power tools; and
 the control circuit comprises a current limiting device (975) connected to the third terminal and configured to select a desired impedance mode to selectively add resistance to raise internal impedance of the battery pack, based on the received indicator.
30. A battery pack according to claim 29, wherein the battery pack is configured to provide a higher current and a higher power at a lower internal impedance than a second battery pack that is designed to operate with the second power tool.
31. A battery pack according to claim 30, wherein lack of receipt of the indicator signal when the second power tool is attached causes the current limiting device to select a high impedance mode for adding resistance, raising the internal impedance of the pack to match an internal impedance of the second battery pack.
32. A battery pack according to claim 29, wherein receipt of the indicator signal causes the current limiting device to select a low impedance mode for the pack, maintaining internal impedance of the pack.
33. A battery pack according to claim 32, wherein the indicator generated by the semiconductor device of the first power tool is embodied as one of a given resistance value, polarity setting, torque value, speed, temperature and motor field strength value of the first power tool.
34. A cordless power tool having a positive terminal, negative terminal, motor, semiconductor device and control circuit, the cordless power tool designed to operate with a battery pack according to any one of claims 29 to 33, the cordless power tool comprising: 
 a third terminal (960) sending an indicator generated by the semiconductor device to the corresponding third terminal of the battery pack indicating an impedance mode to be selected for the cordless power tool.

Title: Device and method for judging deterioration of accumulator / secondary cell
Inventor:
IWANE NORIYASU 
WATANABE YUICHI 
SUGIMURA TAKEZO 
SATOH TOSHIYUKI 
KIMURA ATSUSHI 
IWAHANA FUMIKAZU 
INANIWA KATSUMI 
KANOU TETSUYA
Abstract: A method for determining deterioration of accumulator battery based on results of measuring internal resistances of an accumulator battery and an apparatus adapted to perform said method: Internal resistance and temperature are measured and an approximation function of the temperature characteristic with cubic or higher order polynomial terms is determined and used for determining specific internal resistance at predetermined temperature. Determining deterioration of secondary battery is based on said specific internal resistance.
Claims:
1. A method for determining deterioration of secondary battery based upon internal resistances of the secondary battery, which comprises the steps of: 
 calculating the internal impedances from currents and voltages of the secondary battery measured in the condition that predetermined currents are applied to the secondary battery; 
 determining coefficients of respective terms of an approximate function which comprises a cubic or more polynomial expression and approximates the temperature characteristics of the secondary battery, based upon the calculated internal impedances and the measured temperature of the secondary battery; 
 calculating a specified internal impedance, which is a presumed internal impedance value at a predetermined specified temperature, with use of the cubic or more polynomial expression based upon the determined coefficients; and 
 determining deterioration of the secondary battery based upon the specified internal impedance.
2. The method for determining deterioration of secondary battery according to claim 1, wherein the coefficients of respective terms of the cubic or more polynomial expression are set in reference to a common specified factor, the common specified factor is calculated from the calculated internal impedance and the measured temperature, and the coefficients of respective terms is determined base upon the specified factor.
3. The method for determining deterioration of secondary battery according to claim 2, wherein the approximate function including the cubic or more polynomial expression is
Z=C+f?1C?Tp+f?2C?Tp2+?+fnC?Tpn,
 where Tp, Z and C respectively indicate temperature, the internal impedance and the specified factor, n indicates a integer of more than or equal to 3, and f1 to fn indicate predetermined function.
4. The method for determining deterioration of secondary battery according to claim 3, wherein the function f1 (C) to fn(C) included in the respective terms of the cubic or more polynomial expression are expressed in a linear expression of the specified factor C.
5. The method for determining deterioration of secondary battery according to anyone of claims 1 to 4, wherein a judging threshold is predetermined depending on the specified temperature, and deterioration of the secondary battery is determined depending on the magnitude relation between the calculated specified internal impedance and the judging threshold.
6. The method for determining deterioration of secondary battery according to anyone of claims 1 to 5, wherein the internal impedance is measured by a method comprising the the steps of: 
 obtaining respective amplitudes of the discharge currents at the various frequencies by means of applying Fourier transformation to the discharge current waveform when the frequency of the discharge current pulse is set up to various frequencies while the discharge currents are flowed; 
 obtaining respective amplitudes of the responsive voltages at the various frequencies by means of applying Fourier transformation to the responsive voltage waveform; 
 comparing internal impedances at the various frequencies each other after the internal impedances are obtained respectively at the various frequencies by means of dividing the amplitudes of the responsive voltages by the amplitudes of the discharge currents; and 
 determining the noise level in the measurement of the currents and the voltages as low when proportion of the data spread of the internal impedances is less than or equal to a predetermined value, and determining the noise level in the measurement of the currents and the voltages as high when proportion of the data spread of the internal impedances is more than the predetermined value.
7. The method for determining deterioration of secondary battery according to claim 6, wherein a set of discharges having at least three different time cycles is carried out repeatedly, internal impedances are calculated at not less than three different cycles, and desired internal impedance are calculated from at least the three impedances.
8. The method for determining deterioration of secondary battery according to anyone of claims 1 to 5,
 wherein the internal impedance is measured by
 measuring the input currents and the responsive voltages to the input currents at charge or discharge;
 acquiring plural of current measurement values and voltage measurement values on time axis;
 calculating amplitude of the input currents and amplitude of the responsive voltages at a predetermined frequency from the acquired plural current measurement values and the acquired plural voltage measurement values by means of Fourier transformation; and calculating internal impedances at the predetermined frequency as the result of dividing the amplitude of the responsive voltages at the predetermined frequency by the amplitude of the input currents at the predetermined frequency.
9. The method for determining deterioration of secondary battery according to claim 8, wherein the plural current measurement values and the plural voltage measurement values are respectively N measurement values with sampling intervals of a predetermined time interval ?t, and the amplitude of the input currents and the amplitude of the responsive voltages at the predetermined frequency are calculated by means of dispersion Fourier transformation.
10. The method for determining deterioration of secondary battery according to claim 9, wherein when F denotes the predetermined frequency, i(n?t) denotes N pieces of the input current measurement values, and v(n?t) denotes N pieces of the voltage measurement values, herein n is an integer from zero to N-1, the amplitude of the input currents I(?)and the amplitude of the responsive voltages V(w) are calculated with use of the following formulas;
I?=?t?n=0N-1in??t?expj??n??t?dt
V?=?t?n=0N-1vn??t?expj??n??t?dt,
 
herein w denotes 2?F,
and the internal impedance Z(w) is calculated with use of the following formula
Z?=V?I?
11. The method for determining deterioration of secondary battery according to anyone of claims 8 to 10, wherein at least M internal impedances are calculated correspondent to at least M different frequencies, and M circuit constants included in the equivalent circuit of the secondary battery are calculated with use of a simultaneous equation which includes the M circuit constants as a unknown quantity, based upon the internal impedances at the plural frequencies.
12. The method for determining deterioration of secondary battery according to anyone of claims 8 to 11, wherein the impedance is measured by using an equipment which comprises: 
 charge circuits which supply the secondary battery with charge currents when the secondary battery is charged; 
 discharge circuits which supply the secondary battery with discharge currents when the secondary battery is discharged;
 
 detection means which measure input currents of the secondary battery and responsive voltages when the input currents are the charge currents or the discharge currents; and
 
 control means which obtain the plural current measurement values and the plural voltage measurement values respectively on time axis from the measurement result of the detection means, calculate amplitudes of the input currents and the responsive voltage at a determined frequency from the plural current measurement values and the plural voltage measurement values with use of Fourier transformation, and calculate internal impedances of the secondary battery as the result of dividing the amplitude of the responsive voltages at the predetermined frequency by the amplitude of the input currents at the predetermined frequency.
13. The method for determining deterioration of secondary battery according to claim 12, wherein the control means of the used used equipment compose both of the current measurement values and the voltage measurement values of N measurement values with sampling intervals of a predetermined time interval ?t, and calculate the amplitude of the input currents and the amplitude of the responsive voltages at the predetermined frequency by means of dispersion Fourier transformation.
14. An equipment for determining deterioration of secondary battery based upon the internal resistances of the secondary battery supplying electric power with loads includes: 
 circuits which can apply current pulses to the secondary battery: 
  detection means which measures currents and voltages of the secondary battery; 
  temperature sensors which measure the temperature of the secondary battery; and 
  control means which calculates the internal impedances from the measurement results of the detection means in condition that the circuits apply current pulses to the secondary battery, determines coefficients of the respective terms of an approximate function which comprises a cubic or more polynomial expression and approximates the temperature characteristics of the secondary battery, calculates a specified internal impedance, which is a presumed internal impedance value at a predetermined specified temperature, with use of the cubic or more polynomial expression based upon the determined coefficients, and determines deterioration of the secondary battery based upon the calculated specified internal impedance.
15. The equipment for determining deterioration of secondary battery according to claim 14, which further includes nonvolatile storage means which stores in advance the configuration information about coefficients of the respective terms of the cubic or more polynomial expression, and wherein the control means calculates the coefficients of the terms from the configuration information to be read out from the nonvolatile storage means.
16. The equipment for determining deterioration of secondary battery according to claim 15, wherein the nonvolatile storage means stores the plural configuration information about plural combinations of the coefficients of the respective terms of the cubic or more polynomial expression, and the control means can selectively read out from the plural configuration information.
17. The equipment for determining deterioration of secondary battery according to claim 15 or 16, wherein the nonvolatile storage means stores judging threshold values predetermined depending on the specified temperature, and the control means determines deterioration of the secondary battery depending on the magnitude relation between the calculated specified internal impedance and the judging threshold to be read out from the nonvolatile storage means.
18. The equipment for determining deterioration of secondary battery according to claim 16, wherein the nonvolatile storage means stores the plural judging threshold values, and the control means can selectively read out from the plural judging threshold values.
19. An equipment for determining deterioration of secondary battery includes determining parts which calculates respective amplitudes of the discharge currents at the various frequencies from the discharge current waveforms by means of Fourier transformation when discharge currents are flowed at various frequencies by means of discharging continuously at various frequencies, calculates respective amplitudes of responsive voltages at the various frequencies from the responsive voltage waveforms by means of Fourier transformation, compares internal impedances at the various frequencies each other after the internal impedances are obtained respectively at the various frequencies as a result of dividing the magnitudes of responsive voltages by the magnitudes of the discharge currents respectively at the various frequencies, and determines the noise level in the measurement of the currents and the voltages as low when proportion of the data spread of the internal impedances is less than or equal to a predetermined value, and determines the noise level in the measurement of the currents and the voltages as high when proportion of the data spread of the internal impedances is more than the predetermined value.
20. The equipment for determining deterioration of secondary battery in which the deterioration of the secondary battery is determined based upon the internal impedances calculated with use of the equipment for measuring internal impedance of secondary battery according to claim 13.
21. A power supply system including the power supply system with the equipment for determining deterioration of secondary battery according to claim 3, 4, 6 or 18.
22. The power supply system including the equipment for measuring internal impedance of secondary battery according to claim 9.

Title: Diagnosis for expected life of emergency power apparatus
Inventor:
KIM DEUK-SOO 
KIM RAE-YOUNG 
KIM GI-TAEK
Abstract: An emergency power diagnosis system measures the exact value of impedance voltage (Vis) from an AC actual waveform (VSM) includes circuits and software operable to measure the effective resistance of battery internal impedance to determine the expected life of a battery string. The system is configured to determine the cause of aging progress in advance and determine by unmanned monitoring the real-time status of emergency power system at a remote site.
Claims:
The invention claimed is:
1. A battery diagnostic system configured to: measure the characteristic of a storage battery system (3) comprising a plurality of storage batteries; diagnose an aging status of the storage battery system, and manage history data relating to the characteristics of the storage battery system (3), the system comprising: 
 a main processor unit MPU (1) configured to: 
  control a storage battery cell to be measured, 
  control an amplifier of an automatic scaling circuit (7), 
  control the generation of a AC constant current (Is) applied to the storage battery cell, obtaining waveforms of an impedance voltage (Vis) and the AC constant current (Is) when the AC constant current (Is) is generated, 
  determine measurement data including a terminal voltage (VD), current (I), and temperature (t) of the storage battery cell, and 
  calculate internal impedance of the storage battery cell using the AC constant current (Is) and the impedance voltage (Vis); and 
 a constant current source (5) configured to generate the AC constant current (Is) applied to the storage battery cell, wherein the constant current source (5) is configured to turn on and off according under control of the MPU (1), wherein a frequency of the constant current source (5) is determined by the MPU (1); 
 an A/D converter (6) connected to the constant current source (5) and the automatic scaling circuit (7), the A/D converter configured to convert each signal output from the constant current source (5) and the automatic scaling circuit (7) into a digital signal; and 
 a communication port (8) configured to transmit the measurement data determined by the MPU (1) to a computer; 
 wherein the automatic scaling circuit (7) comprises: 
  a plurality of operational amplifiers (50) having different amplifying gains; and 
  a signal selector (51) connected to output ends of the plurality of operational amplifiers (50) and configured to select one of the plurality of operational amplifiers (50) and automatically scale a size of the impedance voltage (Vis) obtained when the AC constant current (Is) is generated.
2. The system according to claim 1 further comprising: 
 a group of relaying circuits (4) connected between the constant current source (5) and the storage battery system (3), the group of relaying circuits (4) having a plurality of relays connected in parallel to the plurality of storage battery cells, and configured to selectively switch and connect a measurement signal including the impedance voltage (Vis) obtained from the storage battery cell to the MPU (1) according to a select control signal of the MPU (1).
3. The system according to the claim 2 wherein: 
 the select control signal, configured to control the relay connections to the battery cells being composed of 6 bit signal; 
 one group among the up to four groups of relaying circuits being selected by 2 bits of the 6 bit signal; and 
 the remaining 4 bits being inputted to input terminals (D0-D3) of a decoder circuit (MUX), wherein the 4 bits are configured to select one of up to 16 relay assemblies among the group of relaying circuits selected by the 2 bit signal.
4. The system according to the claim 1 wherein: 
 a clock signal (CLK) driven from the MPU (1) is inputted to the constant current source (5); 
 the frequency of the AC constant current (Is) of the constant current source (5) is driven from the clock signal (CLK); 
 and wherein periods of impedance voltage (Vis) and AC constant current (Is) are determined based on the clock signal.
5. The system according to the claim 1, wherein the constant current source (5) comprises: 
 an operational amplifier (31) configured to generate a difference (?) signal between an AC output feedback signal (If) and a current set value by using the AC output feedback signal (If) as an input signal, and 
 a sinusoidal waveform generation circuit (33) receiving an output signal from the operational amplifier (31) and a clock signal (CLK) driven from a basic clock of the MPU (1) and generating an AC sinusoidal waveform, 
 wherein the clock signal (CLK) is input into a soft start circuit (39) to produce a soft start signal (ss), the soft start signal (ss) being coupled to an output of the operational amplifier (31).
6. The system according to the claim 5: 
 wherein an output signal of the sinusoidal waveform generation circuit (33) is differentially operated with an AC output current feedback signal (If) in an instantaneous value addition circuit (34), an output of circuit (34) being input into a No. 1 B class amplifier circuit (35), wherein the No. 1 B class amplifier circuit (35) comprises an NPN transistor (Q1), a PNP transistor (Q2), and an operational amplifier (U3); and 
 wherein an output of the operational amplifier (U3) is connected to each base of a NPN transistor (Q1) and a PNP transistor (Q2), 
 wherein a primary winding of a signal transformer (T2) is connected to a common point of each emitter of NPN transistor (Q1) and PNP transistor (Q2), and an amplified output signal is output through the signal transformer (T2) and is simultaneously feedback to an inverting (?) input of the operational amplifier (U3).
7. The system according to the claim 1 wherein the automatic scaling circuit (7) includes: 
 a measurement signal commonly connected with inputs of several operational amplifiers (50), operation amplifiers (50) having predetermined and different amplifying gains; 
 outputs of the several operational amplifiers (50) being connected to an input of the signal selector (51); 
 the signal selector (51) having a common output connected to an input terminal of the A/D converter (6); 
 the operational amplifier with proper amplifying gain being selected among the said operational amplifiers (50); 
 wherein the operational amplifier having maximum output without saturation being selected from among the several operational amplifiers (5) based upon a first checking of the output of the amplifier with the highest gain first, then the amplifier with the next highest gain until finding the amplifier without saturation.
8. The system according to the claim 2 wherein:

Title: Method and device for detecting battery state, and battery power system
Inventor:
IWANE Noriyasu
Yoshizo Sato
Michalfi Tammath
Abstract:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide a method and device for detecting a battery state that allow the battery, under discharging, to secure necessary charging capacity for operating a prescribed device, and to provide a battery power system.
SOLUTION: In the first step S21, a voltage drop calculation equation for calculating an amount of voltage drop ?V from a stable voltage is formed. In the fourth step S24, a current stable voltage OCV of the battery is estimated, and in the fifth step S25, the amount of voltage drop ?V is calculated. In the sixth step S26, a response voltage V is estimated by subtracting the amount of voltage drop ?V from the stable voltage OCV. In the seventh step S27, if the response voltage V is determined to be close enough to an operation limit voltage Vth, it is determined that the response voltage V has reached the operation limit voltage Vth, and a prescribed load control is performed.

Title: Apparatus and method for estimating battery internal state
Inventor:
MORIKAWA TAKAYUKI
TSUKISHIRO KAZUHIRO
Abstract: PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To exactly estimate an internal state of a battery.SOLUTION: The apparatus and method for estimating battery internal state includes measurement means (I/F10d) of measuring an impedance value of a battery at a predetermined period, storage means (RAM 10c) of storing an impedance value measured by measurement means, determination means (CPU 10a) of determining whether or not a difference value between an impedance value pair as a set of impedance values measured at some time interval is larger than a predetermined threshold value, exception means (CPU 10a) of excepting impedance values commonly included in the impedance value pair as the one including a measurement error when a plurality of impedance value pairs in which the determination means determines the difference value to be larger than the predetermined threshold value exist, and estimation means (CPU 10a) of estimating an internal state of the battery based on an impedance value not excepted by the exception means.
Claims:
1. A battery internal state estimation device for estimating an internal state of a battery, the device comprising: measurement means for measuring an impedance value of the battery at a predetermined period; storage means for storing the impedance value measured by the measurement means; A determination unit for determining whether or not a difference value between impedance value pairs as a set of impedance values measured before and after in time is greater than a predetermined threshold value; Excluding means for excluding impedance values commonly included in the impedance value pairs as including a measurement error, when there are a plurality of impedance value pairs for which the difference value is greater than the predetermined threshold value by the determining means; and An estimation unit that estimates an internal state of the battery on the basis of impedance values that have not been excluded by the exclusion unit.
2. The device according to claim 1, wherein the exclusion means, when an impedance value pair whose difference value is determined by the determination means to be greater than a predetermined threshold value exists independently and when the impedance value pair is the impedance value pair at the start of measurement or the end of measurement, Excludes a leading impedance value or a trailing impedance value included in the impedance value pair.
3. The battery internal state estimation device according to claim 1 or 2, wherein the measurement means causes current to be discharged into the battery and measures the impedance value on the basis of a voltage value and a current value at that time.
4. The battery internal state estimation device according to any one of claims 1 to 3, wherein: when two impedance value pairs exist continuously for which the difference value is determined to be greater than the predetermined threshold value, the exclusion unit excludes an impedance value commonly included in the two impedance value pairs as including a measurement error.
5. The device for excluding unit excludes impedance values constituting an impedance value pair existing between the two impedance value pairs as including a measurement error, the impedance value constituting the impedance value pair existing between the two impedance value pairs when the impedance value pairs are determined to have a difference value greater than a predetermined threshold value; The battery internal state estimation device according to any one of claims 1 to 4, wherein the two impedance value pairs are excluded from the latest impedance value and the latest impedance value.
6. The device according to claim 1, wherein bit information is associated with each impedance value pair, the determining unit inverts the corresponding bit information for each impedance value pair having a difference value greater than a predetermined threshold, and the excluding unit includes: The battery internal state estimation device according to any one of claims 1 to 5, wherein when there are a plurality of pairs of impedance values for which corresponding bit information is inverted, impedance values commonly included in the pairs of impedance values are excluded as including measurement errors.
7. A battery internal state estimation method for estimating an internal state of a battery, the method comprising the steps of: measuring an impedance value of the battery at a predetermined period; storing the impedance value measured in the measuring step in a memory; Determining whether a difference value of an impedance value pair as a set of impedances measured before and after in time is greater than a predetermined threshold value; An excluding step of excluding impedance values commonly included in the impedance value pairs as including a measurement error when there are a plurality of impedance value pairs whose difference values are determined to be greater than a predetermined threshold value in the determining step; and Estimating an internal state of the battery based on impedance values that were not excluded in the excluding step.

Title: Battery discharge duration prediction method, battery status detection method, battery status detection system, and battery power source system
Inventor:
IWANE Noriyasu
Yoshizo Sato
Michalfi Tammath
Abstract:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide a battery discharge duration prediction method, a battery status detection method, a battery status detection system, and a battery power source system which can ensure charged capacity required to operate a predetermined instrument for a battery during discharge.
SOLUTION: The battery discharge duration prediction method creates a voltage drop amount calculation formula for calculating a voltage drop amount .delta.V from stable voltage in a first step S1, predicts stable voltage SOC when a predetermined time t has elapsed after continued discharge from a predetermined point of time in a fifth step S5, calculates a voltage drop amount .delta.V in a sixth step S6, calculates response voltage V by subtracting the voltage drop amount .delta.V from the stable voltage SOC in a seventh step S7, and when it is determined that the response voltage V is sufficiently close to operating limit voltage Vth, determines that the response voltage V has reached the operating limit voltage Vth and sets discharge duration in an eighth step S8.
COPYRIGHT: (C)2010,JPO&INPIT
Claims:
1. A battery discharge duration prediction method for predicting a discharge duration until reaching a threshold voltage at which stable operation of a device can be ensured when discharge is continued in a predetermined current pattern from the battery and a predetermined device operating current is supplied, the method comprising: Creating, in advance, a voltage drop amount calculation formula for calculating an amount of voltage drop from a stable voltage due to discharge using a current value and an internal resistance or an internal impedance as variables; A stable voltage prediction calculation that measures an internal resistance or an internal impedance of the battery at a predetermined point in time, and predicts a change in the stable voltage in accordance with a change in a state of charge when only a time t elapses from the predetermined point in time continuing to discharge in the current pattern; and A voltage drop amount computation for calculating an amount of voltage drop by substituting the device operating current value and the internal resistance or the internal impedance into the voltage drop amount calculation formula, and a response voltage prediction computation for predicting a response voltage at the elapsed time t by subtracting the amount of voltage drop from the stable voltage prediction value at the elapsed time t. The elapsed time t is updated, and the elapsed time t at which the response voltage prediction value reaches a predetermined threshold value is determined and used as the discharge duration. Creating, in advance, a calculation correlation of the internal resistance or the internal impedance using a state of charge or a current value as a variable and having an adjustment parameter; Determines the adjustment parameter by substituting the measurement value of the internal resistance or internal impedance and the charge rate or discharge current value at the time of measurement of the internal resistance or internal impedance into the calculation correlation formula; and The internal resistance or the internal impedance is calculated by substituting a state of charge estimation value obtained by estimating a state of charge of the battery at the elapsed time t or the current value for device operation and an adjustment parameter that is decided into the calculation correlation formula, and in the voltage drop amount calculation, the internal resistance or the internal impedance is substituted into the voltage drop amount calculation formula; and,Upon comparing and determining that the discharging duration is shorter than a predetermined load control time, cause charging of the battery to commenceThe method according to any one of claims 1 to 3.
2. Determining the adjustment parameter by creating in advance a calculation correlation of the internal resistance or the internal impedance using a temperature as a variable and having the adjustment parameter, and substituting a measurement value of the internal resistance or the internal impedance and a temperature at the time of measurement of the internal resistance or the internal impedance into the calculation correlation; and The battery discharge duration prediction method according to claim 1, wherein the internal resistance or the internal impedance is calculated by substituting the temperature of the battery at the elapsed time t and the determined adjustment parameter into the calculation correlation formula, and in the voltage drop amount calculation, the internal resistance or the internal impedance is substituted into the voltage drop amount calculation formula.
3. A battery state measuring unit that measures at least an internal resistance or an internal impedance of a battery; a storage unit that stores a predetermined current pattern, a predetermined current value for device operation, and a minimum threshold voltage required for stable operation of the device; A stable voltage prediction calculation in which an internal resistance or an internal impedance of the battery at a predetermined time point is input from the battery state measurement unit, and in accordance with the current pattern read from the storage unit, predicts a change in the stable voltage in accordance with a change in charge rate when only a time t elapses after continuing discharging from the predetermined time point; and A voltage drop amount computation for calculating an amount of voltage drop by substituting the device operating current value and the internal resistance or the internal impedance read from the storage unit into a voltage drop amount calculation formula created in advance; a response voltage prediction computation for predicting a response voltage at the elapsed time t by subtracting the amount of voltage drop from the stable voltage prediction value at the elapsed time t; and The elapsed time t is updated, and the elapsed time t at which the response voltage prediction value reaches a predetermined threshold value is determined and used as the discharge duration; The device according to claim 1, wherein the arithmetic processing unit calculates, with respect to a calculation correlation formula created in advance for the internal resistance or the internal impedance using a state of charge or a current value as a variable and having an adjustment parameter, Determines the adjustment parameter by substituting the measurement value of the internal resistance or internal impedance and the charge rate or discharge current value at the time of measuring the internal resistance or internal impedance; and The internal resistance or the internal impedance is calculated by substituting a state of charge estimation value obtained by estimating a state of charge of the battery at the elapsed time t or the current value for device operation and an adjustment parameter that is determined into the calculation correlation formula, and in the voltage drop amount calculation, the internal resistance or the internal impedance is substituted into the voltage drop amount calculation formula.To:The charging device according to claim 1, wherein the calculation processing unit starts charging the battery when the discharging duration is compared to a predetermined load control time and determined to be shorter than the predetermined load control time.The charging device is configured to charge the charging device.
4. The device according to claim 1, wherein the arithmetic processing unit determines an adjustment parameter by substituting a measurement value of the internal resistance or the internal impedance and a temperature at the time of measuring the internal resistance or the internal impedance into a calculation correlation formula created in advance for the internal resistance or the internal impedance using a temperature as a variable and having the adjustment parameter; and The internal resistance or the internal impedance is calculated by substituting the temperature of the battery at the elapsed time t and the determined adjustment parameter into the calculation correlation formula, and in calculating the amount of voltage drop, the internal resistance or the internal impedance is substituted into the amount of voltage drop calculation formula.3The battery state detecting device according to any one of claims 1 to 3.

Title: Storage battery deterioration judgment system
Inventor:
TSUJIKAWA, Tomonobu
Yabuda Firefly
MATSUSHITA, Suguru
Abstract:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide an energy-saving, reliable storage battery deterioration judgment system which can properly detect and estimate the capacity of each storage battery while reducing power consumption and improve estimation precision as the detection is repeated.
SOLUTION: One pilot cell is discharged and the capacity of the pilot cell is detected. A regression equation indicating the correlation between internal impedance and capacity is created on the basis of past impedance measurement results and capacity detection results. Using the created regression equation, the capacity of a remaining cell is estimated.

selection means for selecting, from among the plurality of storage batteries other than those determined to be defective by the determination means, a storage battery having a highest internal impedance as a pilot cell; and determination means for determining whether a voltage of the pilot cell falls to a set value, Discharging means for discharging the pilot cell at a constant current; capacity detection means for detecting, as the capacity of the pilot cell, a product of a time until a voltage of the pilot cell drops to a set value due to the discharging and the constant current during the discharging; and capacity of a remaining storage battery excluding a storage battery determined to be defective and the pilot cell is determined to be defective, Capacitance estimation means for estimating the capacitance by comparing a regression equation expressing a correlation between internal impedance and capacitance with a measurement result of the impedance measurement means, calculating the regression equation used for estimating the capacitance estimation means as a pilot cell selected in the past by the selection means as a pilot cell.AccumulatorA measurement result of the impedance measurement means for the current pilot cell selected by the selection means, a measurement result for the pilot cell selected as the pilot cell in the past by the selection means, and a measurement result for the pilot cell selected as the pilot cell selected in the past by the selection means.AccumulatorAnd the detection result of the capacity detection means for the current pilot cell selected by the selection means.

6. A power generation apparatus comprising: a battery pack formed by a plurality of storage batteries connected in series; voltage measurement means for measuring a voltage of each of the storage batteries; impedance measurement means for measuring an internal impedance of each of the storage batteries; andimpedance measurement means for measuring an internal impedance of each of the storage batteries, the power generation means and the impedance measurement means based on measurement results of the voltage measurement means and the impedance measurement means; Determination means for determining whether the storage batteries are defective; selection means for selecting, from among the storage batteries, a storage battery having a highest internal impedance as a pilot cell, the remaining storage batteries excluding the storage batteries determined to be defective by the determination means; Discharging means for discharging the pilot cell at a constant current until a voltage of the pilot cell drops to a set value; capacitance detection means for detecting, as a capacitance of the pilot cell, a product of a time until the voltage of the pilot cell drops to the set value due to the discharging and the constant current during the discharging; Capacity estimation means for estimating capacities of the storage batteries determined to be defective and remaining storage batteries excluding the pilot cell by comparing a regression equation expressing internal impedance and a correlation between the internal impedance and the capacity, with the measurement result of the impedance measurement means; andAccumulatorA measurement result of the impedance measurement means for the current pilot cell selected by the selection means, a measurement result for the pilot cell selected as the pilot cell in the past by the selection means, and a measurement result for the pilot cell selected as the pilot cell selected in the past by the selection means.AccumulatorAcquire a detection result of the capacitance detection means for the pilot cell selected by the selection means, and a detection result of the capacitance detection means for the pilot cell selected by the selection means. A management device that creates the regression equation on the basis of the measurement result and the detection result each time the measurement result and the detection result are taken in, and sends the created regression equation to each of the storage battery deterioration determination devices.

Title: Storage battery diagnostic system
Inventor:
TSUJIKAWA, Tomonobu
Yabuda Firefly
MATSUSHITA, Suguru
Presentation present
Abstract:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide an energy-saving, reliable storage battery diagnostic system which can properly detect the capacity of each storage battery of a battery pack comprising a plurality of storage batteries connected in series while reducing power consumption.
SOLUTION: The storage battery diagnostic system 10 comprises an impedance measuring section 32 for measuring the internal impedance of each storage battery constituting the battery pack, a discharging section 24 for discharging a sample storage battery until its voltage drops to a predetermined voltage with a constant current, and a control section 13 which detects the product of the time elapsed until the voltage of the sample storage battery has dropped to the predetermined voltage through the discharge with the constant current and the constant current value during the discharge as the capacity of the sample storage battery and estimates the capacity of remaining storage batteries except the sample storage battery in accordance with the internal impedance measured by the impedance measuring means and the detected capacity.
